description:
A great spot to catch up with friends and explore new ciders. The space is large enough and has plenty of tables - never feels like it's too crowded here. 

Upcider has three full pages of ciders from all over the world. Even if you aren't a cider aficionado, it's fun to sample some if the more exotic ones. They also have beer and liquor if that's not your thing.
author: Rich S.

description:
3.5 rating overall.

Upcider isn't necessarily in a nice area of town, but you wouldn't feel that was as soon as you got inside. The ambiance was nice. The restaurant has an excellent variety of ciders - the most I've ever seen available at a bar or restaurant - and I liked how the menu was organized by state and country. The ciders ranged from sweet to funky, and everything in between. We ended up forgoing the menu and walking up to the counter to order the $20 flight of six ciders which require you to look at their draft cider menu listed on the boards behind the bar. It was fun being able to pick out what you wanted, write it on the wood holder and hand it back to a staff members to go find your ciders. They all tasted great and it was nice to try so many kinds. 

In addition to cider they have beer, wine and food. We ordered the Buffalo Fries which came with hot sauce, celery, carrots, and blue cheese, and they were...weird? The fries themselves were spicy and must have been covered in some sort of spicy rub, topped with blue cheese dressing (I think) and there were small cubes of cold celery and carrots on top of that. It just didn't make sense? The pieces of cold vegetables were too small and too heavy in comparison to the fries themselves that you couldn't eat them without a fork, and we got them to share at the table. Even then, it was strange to put a bunch of cold vegetables on top of hot fries and sauce? I don't know how to explain it but we immediately wished we had ordered other fries.  

The staff themselves were all nice and helpful but because there was no table service and you had to go up to the bar to order anything.
author: Bri T.

description:
I came here solely for dessert, so I can't speak to the quality of their drinks or food. The bread pudding was good but not as amazing as I had hoped having seen pictures on Yelp. It was a solid dessert option, but not one I'd be rushing back to have. 

I was thrown off a little when I walked in because you order at the bar, take a number, and then grab a table. The atmosphere was cool - very laid back. Their second story location provides great people watching opportunities.
author: Kirsten H.

description:
Upcider is a great spot for drinks and apps. My boyfriend and I came here before heading to the movies a few blocks away and enjoyed it. 

As expected, there's an extensive list of ciders, but beer and wine are also available. The prices for ciders vary a lot but there are a ton of reasonable options which I appreciated as I don't know much about cider. I had a black currant one which was unique and delicious! 

For appetizers, we had the potato soufflé, gruyere spinach flatbread, and a fired chicken slider. This ended up being plenty of food. Both the soufflé and flatbread were pretty great, but the chicken slider wasn't anything special. 

The ambiance wasn't anything incredible, but it did have nice lighting (and good people watching) since it was on the second floor overlooking the street. 

Upcider didn't blow us away but it was a good spot to hang out at for a while with reasonably priced food and drink!
author: Jessie K.

description: Best cider bar in SF. Mena is fantastic - She made our night!  We search out cider bars across the nation and Upcider offers an impressive selection!
author: Mel V.

description:
One of my friends recommended that I check out Upcider since I am a cider lover.  I visited the bar around 3PM on a Saturday looking for a bite to eat and a drink to start my Saturday.

Not going to lie, I had a bit of sticker shock looking at the cider menu prices.  I lived in Sacramento and drank lots of Two Rivers so I felt like the price of a glass was a bit too steep considering it's shipped only 80 miles away.  I ended up getting two bottles of Sonoma Cider (the bourbon Anvil was my favorite) along with fries and a Turkish flatbread.  Unfortunately, the flatbread was pretty unflavorful and not hot.  The fries looked yummy but were not anything special.  Because the food and drinks were underwhelming and more expensive than it was worth, I don't think I'll be returning to Upcider.

PROS: 
- Space is open and spacious; it's an upstairs bar so you get a nice view of the streets
- Blueberry ketchup is unique addition to the fries

CONS:
- Ciders seemed really pricey
- Food was also more expensive and tasted pretty bland

**Tip: Google and Maps will try to send you down Hemlock St. to get to Upcider but the entrance is on Polk St.
author: Cimma S.

description:
They have so many cider options here...everything from locally made to Washington, to UK, to Spain ciders! I did the flight option, 6 ciders for 20 dollars. Flight of ciders only apply to the ciders on the chalk board. 

Seating is self seating. It has a very cool, chill ambience. They had a coloring contest when I was here yesterday.

You order everything at the bar. 

Food was good but I think it's pricey considering the portion. The slider was at least 5.96 for just 1!! 

I had the salmon cider. And the bf got a chicken slider. We shared the mac and cheese and garlic fries (which was delicious). Mac and cheese wasn't cheesy enough.
author: Caitlin P.

description:
Really cool place to grab a drink and some bites with some friends. There`s ample seating and some really nice seating next to windows if you feel crowded at the bar or at tables (its pretty spacious, so you have ample room to stretch out). The list of beers/ciders is extensive. They definitely have anything for everyone. 

Come check it out!
author: Taylor Z.

description:
A couple of friends and I stopped here to start off our night while in town for the weekend. I love the concept of this place, a bar dedicated to ciders. There's literally like 2-3 pages full of all different types of ciders. We were easily able to grab a table and then were told to place our order at the bar.

I tried the purple monkey cider which was very good. They also let you sample the beers before deciding on one which was awesome. For food we shared the buffalo fries which were topped with little tiny pieces of celery and carrots. The flavor was really good and not too overpowering. (4/5) I also had one of the portobello sliders. This was prob the best portobello sandwich I've ever had in my life, so good! (5/5)

I'd highly recommend checking this place out. Super cool vibe & great food and drinks.
author: Erika N.

description:
This place has 4 pages of cider options in addition to their draft selection.  We got a flight of six ciders ranging from the sweet to bone dry ciders.

My favorites were the apricot and oak barre aged cider which had a delicious vanilla flavor.

The bone dry ciders are an acquired taste.  :-P
author: Thomas B.

description: I love this place! Honestly, I come here for the bread pudding. I'm usually not crazy about bread pudding but at this place it's a must try. Not gonna lie, it's pretty sweet with the caramel and whipped cream and all. But it's delicious. (Hint: get a cider that's on the dry side or semi sweet to help balance it out -not a sweet cider) their sweet potato fries are great! Crispy and yummy. The blueberry ketchup is too sweet though. The mushroom flat bread was also delicious. Another great option to balance out the sweet bread pudding too! The cider options are unique as well.
author: Rachelle C.

description: The black and blue cider is my absolute favorite. They really do have a HUGE array of ciders. Ive tried jalapeño infused ciders and habanero infused ciders here and they were quite interesting. It's definitely a cute place to go to with friends that isn't too crazy and packed with people like other places on Polk. This place serves food too, which I've never tried but always looks really good. Also it's near bobs donuts which makes it perfect.
author: Kalani R.

description: $7 sliders with little to no taste? Count me out. Service is lame- if I order 3 sliders, why do they come out one by one with 5 minutes between each? Ordered the pulled pork and fried chicken sliders, meatballs, shrimp, and sweet potato fries and all were mediocre at best. Not to mention, the easiest thing to get out first was the fries which came out last. Lucky for this spot that our concert venue was close. Would not ever return and do not recommend.
author: Lauren W.

description:
Most reviews of this place are probably for their ciders, as that's what they're probably known for, but I came here for food after finishing an escape game nearby.

We arrived on a Sunday afternoon around 3 pm and it was pretty empty as you'd probably expect. We seated ourselves and perused the brunch menu, which was the only food menu available at the time (brunch goes until 4 pm here). 

I went with a french omelette ($11.95) with the additional of the housemade lamb sausage, as I was in the mood for something egg-y. It was served with your choice of house potatoes, arugula salad, or french fries. I have to admit, I had some doubts about the quality of the food here, since it's primarily a bar, but I was very pleasantly surprised by how much I found myself enjoying my omelette. The eggs were done just right where they weren't overcooked but also not runny at all. The lamb sausage was salty but given that the rest of the omelette was pretty bland, each complemented the other pretty well.

Parking in this area is all along the street. My friend was able to find parking fairly easily right across the street for.

I like that it's located on the second floor, so it'd be an interesting spot for people watching at night. They have plenty of seats right along the windows!
author: Dianna H.

description: 4 stars for being a cider house 3.5 stars for the food. I tried the buffalo fries, fried chicken slider, and the cajun chicken slider. The buffalo fries were mehhh but larger than I expected, the fried chicken slider was good, and the cajun chicken slider takes the win. They have a nice variety of ciders, both dry and sweet. Flights of 6 are $20 each.
author: Elaine N.

description:
SETTING:
On the second floor. Wooden decor, warm and cozy, dim lighting. Background music is not overwhelming so you can actually have conversations with your group. Good for small parties or larger ones. Lots of open space.

SERVICE:
I didn't have much expectations. When I frequent gastropub establishments, the service is usually pretty average...kind of the bare minimum chit chat to get orders and then the quick "here's your food" dropoff service. The staff here was above average (read: they acted like they cared about their patrons) and were pleasant to interact with.   

FOOD: 
I enjoyed the mushroom flatbread ("thin sliced pizza"). Would get this again for sure, also a great bang for your buck. Probably the size of a medium sized thin crust pizza. The lamb slider (a bit smaller than the size of your palm) was delicious but for $7 it is pretty steep. Buffalo fries were tasty and a great side or snack item. 

I would recommend doing a cider flight too where you can choose 6 hard ciders (mostly from CA, OR, WA) on their rotation of close to 20. That way you can choose your own adventure and sample different ciders!

IMPRESSIONS:
Upcider is a modern and laidback establishment where you can enjoy small bites and drinks. I also dig the fact that it overlooks Polk street so you can people-watch through their full length windows and just take it in. Really, the only knock is that it can be a bit pricey for the quantity especially if you are hungry, but there is so much going for this place that I am a fan anyway. Big ups to Upcider!
author: James L.

description:
Large space with a large selection of ciders and beer.

I don't normally drink cider, but the array they have here is very impressive and I've had some really delicious drinks here.

The staff let you sample things if you're not sure what you like, which is probably recommended since cider can vary a lot. Recommended as a chilled-out place to try different ciders on Polk st.
author: Joe B.

description: After all my visits here, still one of my favorite bars on Polk st. It is just cozy and relaxed environment and I love all ciders so its really the perfect combo. You are in the hustle and bustle of it all but not in the crowds.
author: Celia Z.

description: Really cute cider pub with some tasty food. The bartender was great at recommending ciders for us to try, and brought us many samples until we found the one we each wanted. The food was super tasty- we tried the fried chicken slider which had some interesting flavors, loved the pulled pork bbq flatbread, and the Mac n cheese and a delicious treat. It was fun to sit above Polk street with our drinks and watch the world go by. Fun spot!
author: Hannah S.

description:
I really don't know where to start. Upsider is one of those places that you wouldn't necessarily consider going to... Before I found Upsider I didn't even know what cider was. Let me just say, this place blew me away.

Their staff is incredibly helpful and will help you find a cider to meet your taste needs. The friend who I went with enjoys bourbon and wanted to get a Seiter that had darker tones. Out of the 200 (yes 200) different types of cider that they carry, the bartender helped my friend find the perfect Bourbon barrel aged cider just for him. They listen to what flavors you like and will help you pick a drink that is perfect for you.

Aside from the staff, the food is daring and delicious. I recommend trying the blueberry ketchup, it's not as weird as it sounds. The ambience of the whole loft is spacious and open. The lighting is delicate and inviting above the always crazy, bustling Polk street below.

I would highly recommend catching up a conversation with the bartenders, as they are all characters and will give you awesome recommendations. I will return soon!
author: Tessa M.

description: As a cider fan, this place is to my liking. I was raised on Apfelwein (not too far from Frankfurt). Upcider has a magic attraction. And I always find something I like. Beware though that they let you try before you buy; and you should. Some "creative" new world cider choices are between awkward and disgusting. Most old world classics are fantastic, but a few new California ones are not too bad. I had to try a few and eventually figured out that the bartending woman was rather clueless. The guys seemed much more competent (despite the preoccupation with taking photos that evening).
author: Manfred S.

description:
My girlfriend and I are really into cider. Hence we checked this place out. There are over 20 different ciders on tap with an additional selection on the menu. This is a nice quaint bar on the second floor with a typical ambience. 

Out of the 20 different ciders on tap, we tried 8-10 of them. Our specific favorites were 12 and 16, Aspoll Dry and Ace Space respectively. These are light and sweet and have a big alcohol content. A good and dangerous combo if u will. 16 specifically tastes almost like a cocktail with its citrousy taste. 

Accompanying our escapades was an order of garlic fries. I advise eating a little bit on ur adventure through this field of juices due to the sweetness

Expect the SF prices but I just got paid so YOLOSWAG on this and you will have a good time
author: Ver S.

description: Came here with a few friends just to grab a drink and a snack. My wife and I have never been here before and were amazed how good the food and drinks were. We ordered a cider and a few sliders, absolutely delicious. This place is great for just hanging out or even a happy hour, you won't go wrong. Definitely will be coming back to try more things on the menu and other drinks.
author: Roman L.

description: Great selection of ciders! Friendly bartender who answered all my questions about drinks and recommended me certain ciders based off my preferences (I prefer much more tart flavors to sweet for ciders). Highly recommend the cider flight to try out different types of cider!
author: Bradford L.

description:
I am married to cider. The days of when all I found at the stores were strongbow, stella "cidre" and angry orchard are over. Cider has slowly picked up and invited real cideries like Golden State, 2 Towns and See Canyon to spread their seed over the west coast. When I first found out about Upcider, navigating to it became my gold rush (because you know, most cider has a golden pour).

This bar's layout is perfect. The walk of stairs to its 2nd floor location, the dim lighting, the loud mumbling, the friendly bartenders and the view over a busy Polk street. What more could you ask for? Oh yeah cider.

Upcider has a bottle menu that a newbie would be overwhelmed by. Ice cider, farmhouse cider, dry cider, semi-dry, it goes on and on. They cover their regions. The Spanish the French and the English run the euro list while the west coast runs their domestic options. 

+ What they have on tap might surprise you. You want Aspall on tap? and poured into an Aspall glass (which Aspall does not ship to the US), they got you covered there too. 

As for the food, you cannot deny the lamb slider. Lamb and cider is a beautiful combination. 

My only problem with upcider is their mark up on some of the bottles. 35-45% on most, which is unfortunate because people unfamiliar with cider may shy away from having something other than a crispin or ace just because of pricing. Although yeah I am sure that rent comes with a huge price tag for them too.

Upcider is one of a kind in California. The only other cider bar in the state can be found in Long Beach (review coming soon), but it falls short. Different leagues. Upcider is my spot. Thanks to the distance, I have avoided alcoholism, but otherwise this review would probably be taken down due to conflict of interest. Don't be scared, come to Upcider, grab a menu, pull up the RateBeer app and make a decent selection.

Specific Recommendations...

If you care to know, my favorite ciders during my 3 stops here were:

-Aspall Dry (on tap, its purity when compared to the bottled is obvious)
-Shacksbury Arlo (refined farmhouse cider)
-Sidra Bereziartua (well balanced versus other Spanish Sidra)
author: Javier J.

description:
Just walking around Polk st and came across this hidden gem. Love at first site. It's located on top floor so expect to go up flight of stairs. Great ambience and view. 

They also have great selection of food, get there before midnight to order food. We could still order garlic fries and sweet potato fries. 

A lot of selection of beers and ciders. 

Go and try them out.
author: Aditya C.

description: I loved Upcider! I got a flight, which includes 6 four-ounce ciders, for $20. You can choose from 18 different ciders. The bartenders were really nice, and even let me sample a couple ciders to help me decide. I got numbers 1, 2, 9, 12, 13, and 17. All were delicious, except for #13. I also got a portobello slider, which was a little expensive ($7), but it was DELICIOUS. The sweet potatoe fries are pretty good. Overall great vibes and great ciders! I love the string lights!
author: Krystal R.

description: Finally, a great meal after series of disappointing experiences all around sf. A good place to eat and hang out /  people watch. Awesome selection of uniquely flavored ciders and great food. I highly recommend lamb flatbread, if you like thin crust pizza.
author: Arkady I.

description:
This place is cool. Finally something for the cider lovers! I always end up at a bar who says they have cider, only to be presented with one standard option: Angry Orchard. I know it sounds snotty, but AO is like PBR for beer. Bleh.

Anyway, this place is like something out of my dream. Four full pages of ciders, plus tap options on the wall. AO is offered...but it's one among dozens and dozens of choices. Actual decent selection of beer too. Prices are reasonable, especially for SF. 

They also offer a food menu. I went in not expecting much better than just the regular bar food, but the food was really good! The pulled pork sliders are amazing! A couple plates for dinner isn't going to destroy your wallet and they're definitely not stingy with the portions. 

Will be back! Go visit! It's worth the trek if you love cider even if you're not in the area.
author: Yo M.

description: came on a friday night.  thought to myself, i never had a cider before.  lets try it out.  who knew there were so many different ciders.  had a flight.  i must say some of the ciders were so stinky.  smelled like a bathroom.  after holding my nose to try to drink it, the taste wasnt very good either.  but the ones i did like were delicious.  it was 20$ for 5.  they have bottles and tap and they are about 7 bucks each.  the bartenders were nice in explaining the different ciders.  i guess if i go back and get another flight, id have to say no bathroom smelly ones please.  its a big place with plenty of seating and the bathrooms are clean which is surprising for a bar in the city.  cool atmosphere.
author: Matthew G.

description: Food was lovely, we ordered the Turkish flatbread, the peppered salmon and Cajun chicken sliders with some sweet potato fries and everything was lovely. We love ciders, so we got a flight of 6 ciders for $20 which were amazing. We also wanted to be a bit adventurous and ordered the Ace pineapple cider and oh my, it's was great!
author: Maria R.

description: This place is well known for it's cider collection and for good reason; it has several pages worth of ciders from all over the world. I've never seen a black currant cider before so I had to order it. Coming in at $17 for 25 ounces, it is definitely on the more expensive end, but I think it was well worth it. It was my favorite cider of the night and I tried all of my friends ciders.
author: Edward W.

description: Love this little cider bar tucked away on the second floor. Incredible cider selection, so a must for any cider fan. Prices range from affordable to extravagant for a bottle. There's selections from all over the world which makes it fun too. Great lighting and ambiance. Food served here is also pretty decent! Would recommend the mushroom flat bread.
author: Evonne L.

description: Great selection of cider (from a cider head) beautiful layout, and delicious olives. The flight of ciders is a deal at $20 and I was able to select from 18 different ciders. Highly recommend for those who love ciders or are interested in trying the offerings.
author: Elena G.

description:
An awesome spot serving up a cider's galore with some crafty eats in a nice and cozy atmosphere? Just think: what kind of place can you enjoy a nice social buzz while there are some families and toddlers around? Just one: Upcider.

I spent an early New Year's Eve dinner out in Polk Street and found this place, and I have to say, as the "first cider bar in America," this place hits all the spots for what you'd want and expect for a cider bar, and bar in general. It's got that intimate "tasting room" kind of vibe for aficionados, but plenty of communal sitting to enjoy REALLY good eats and chats with friends. Since it was a Saturday night on NYE, the place naturally got a little packed towards the end of the night.

This place is on the second floor (go upstairs) from street level. The food is actually DELICIOUS for a bar/gastropub. Lots of places I know don't serve good bar food, but this place had the eats that were well worth the price. I had some of the Turkish Pizza Flatbread (blend of light meats, spinach and gruyere) which was surprisingly light and easy to eat -- similar to a margherita pizza, and also their standout flatbread. I ordered an Eggplant Slider for myself which was to DIE for -- arugula, goat cheese, a hunky piece of tomato and a hefty, meaty eggplant slice (cooked through, soft and and chewy). For a slider, it was definitely satisfying and appetizing for the price! I also split the Garlic Parmesan Fries which I had no complaints about, and the Buffalo Fries which were basically soft and doused with the buffalo wing spice and peppers on top -- definitely felt the heat with it.

The cider menu definitely looked daunting, as they had lists of ciders from ALL AROUND THE WORLD (Germany, England, Spain, US?! How was I to decide?). I decided Spain was a nice, promising region to try a cider from, as their tasting notes were lighter and fruit-forward. I didn't want their super-sweet ones so I decided on the Maeloc -- a Pear Cider with slight sweetness. It hit the spot. (As for ciders in general, they can get pretty sweet and like you're drinking juice nonstop... Let it creep!).

I'd definitely be back here in a heartbeat. Polk Street has a great barhopping scene and I can see why people recommend it. Nice to dine and chill with friends while taking in that sweet, San Francisco air. What's not to love? A nice ambiance, perfect for a night out.
author: Rachel Ann C.

description: The cider selection was great and loved the flight option. The vibe was cool and laid back. Didn't have any food so I can't speak for that. I definitely recommend it for a relaxing night out without too much craziness.
author: Grace D.

description:
If you enjoy drinking cider over beer, then this is the spot for you as they have a great selection of ciders on their menu. They have many different types of beers as well, but I believe most of them are from a can or a bottle. 

Their garlic fries and buffalo fries are the perfect snack if you're craving something tasty. Personally did not enjoy their flatbread pizza as much. 

Love how open the seating is and there's a ton of space to actually sit down and enjoy a beer versus standing the entire time at the bar. 

Would love to come here for brunch one day!
author: Nancy L.

description:
Had a great time with friends and a hot date! 

Their list of ciders is the 'Utmost' - not certain about that grammatically but you get the point. It's a cool spot and obviously on trend. In 2014 Cider consumption increased by 89%!! I've always liked it and ordered it occasionally but now there are real choices. I personally like the one's that are more dank, funky, have some Brett and / or yeast in them. I tried a Sheppy's, a Sonoma Cider, and get this....................... Bereziartua (a funky apple cider from Basque Country - northern Spain into the Pyranees.) Anyway - great atmosphere and a lot of great flavor profile's to check out. And of course Cider's have been around for hundreds of Years and they are all kind of delicious! 

Be BOLD and DRINK CIDER!!
author: Rew C.

description: If you appreciate the finer things in life (i.e. cider), then this place is for you! If you appreciate the finest things in life (i.e. people watching drunk idiots stumble around polk) then this place is even more for you. The inside is cute and fairly spacious. I always get the flight that allows you to choose from around 20 options (you get 6).
author: Morgyn T.

description:
Huge cider selection! Although as a beer fan, I chose to indulge in that instead. The food is on point and perfect portion to get a little taste of everything. I came here for dinner to kill time before a show I was going to at the Regency Ballroom. 

I shared garlic fries, two sliders and the Stuffed Potato Soufflé which was SO BOMB. Oh my gosh, it was like a heavenly shepherd's pie: Smooth and fluffy mashed potatoes with ground beef, cheese, and sour cream.

They seem to update their menu regularly though, so be sure to watch out for new, current bites. 

With friendly and quick servers, dim lighting, and decent table space, it's a great spot to catch up with friends or go on a date.
author: Amanda K.

description: Nice place, warm atmosphere, awesome ciders (the Costa Rican Pineapple is amazing). Will definitely come again
author: Anastasiia S.

description:
This is definitely one of my go-to places to chill in Downtown SF. If you`re into Ciders, this is the place for you. This place has infinite selection of ciders ranging from local CA to France,Spain and NZ. Apart from the food/drink selection, the place has a very chill vibe and is the perfect location for long conversations with friends. The place is generally not too crowded and getting a table shouldnt be much of an issue.
Even my friends in the city who aren`t much into ciders genuinely love this place. 

DEFINITE Recommend from my side. Wish I could come here more frequently :)
author: Pranav B.

description:
Upcider might not be blatantly obvious from the street since it's a venue on the second floor, but once you get upstairs, there's quite a bit of seating, whether at the bar or at tables. 

And it's well worth the effort in making the short hike up the stairs. You'll find many quality cider offerings from all over the world, in addition to beer. What's more, the food offerings here are solid, whether the sliders, salads, flatbreads, or tapas-sized entrees. 

Service is also courteous and attentive, and overall this is a great venue for many purposes, whether cavorting with a large group, making this a stop on date night, or simply grabbing a drink on your own. Highly recommended. Thanks Yelpers for another great find!
author: Vincent L.

description: I came here with a group of friends and had a fantastic time. We explored the different types of ciders and shared them - splitsies for life! It was so much fun making fun of each other's drinks. My friend got the Tipsy Buddha, and I don't think any of us really liked it. That's the fun though - trying bold flavors. I had the Ace Pineapple Cider, and it was everyone's favorite. It tasted like soda, and though it was just 5% APV, I still felt a bit tipsy. That's probably what happens when you share drinks. Even more fun! Overall, fun place for groups of you want to try ciders from different regions
author: Jennifer W.

description: SO many good things in one place.  Everyone at the table got a flight of six ciders on tap.  It was great.  Some we like and some we traded each other for.  The food came out very quickly and boy was it good.  The list of vegetarian items was overwhelming.  I never see so many options for me.  Service was excellent too!!!
author: shannon S.

description: Okay the cider was cool love the huge selection, but honestly DO NOT order food from here overpriced and gross, I ordered the garlic fries originally and did not like them tried to return them but they said they couldn't give me a refund, I understand I mean they already made it, so I re ordered the Mac and cheese and it was completely flavorless small cost me 10$ that I could have used on my uber home instead of leave with a bad taste in my mouth, really I would rather make pasta at home or like have gotten pizza around the corner the food experience I came here for deserves a one star or no stars no doubt!!  only reason for the extra star is the effort they put in the cider selection , but I literally got mine from a can so how could they mess that up. :/ so not much to judge about this place. Literally the worst WORST food experience I've had in San Francisco!! I've gone to many many places maybe haven't made a review for every but honestly don't eat here just awful
author: Michelle M.

description: Tasted the shrimp, mac and cheese, meatballs, and buffalo fries and it was all FANTASTIC. I didn't drink the cider, but there are a ton of cider options and some beer choices. Seriously good food. Hate that there aren't servers though. You have to order are the bar for everything.
author: Lindy M.

description:
SUNDAY REVIEW: A group of 12 friends and I stumbled upon Upcider and were thrilled to find this bar. We were able to all sit together, easily order drinks (fantastic beer/wine/cider selection), and enjoy a great selection of apps (vegan/vegetarian friendly). Service was prompt, friendly, and helpful in selecting beverages amongst the vast menu.

TLDR: Great for groups, beer/cider lovers.
author: Sarah U.

description: Great selection of ciders and affordable food - good portions for a quick snack and drink.
author: Katey V.

description: I only stopped here for a pint at the end of the night but I really enjoyed the concept and the selection. They have an extensive selection on tap and an even greater menu of ciders from across the globe. I really appreciated the bartender who gave me a couple of suggestions when I told him that I the only cider I had before was Angry Orchard (and even better was that he did not make fun of my unsophisticated tastes). I would certainly go back again and hope I can find a similar place to try when I go back to the East Coast.
author: David L.

description: Stop me now. A place that specializes in my very favorite beverage. All sorts, all kinds, loads on tap, in bottles or cans. Really nice spot 'cats-eye-view' for people watching upstairs and out the surrounding windows. The place is warm and welcoming and the menu - did I mention there were SO Damn Many Ciders?? I met a few old favorites and a few new as well. We didn't dine here, but the food looked pretty good. I'll be back!
author: Deb S.

description:
Very cute ambiance! Great place if you're into cozy atmosphere with an abundance of ciders at your choosing. 

I came here with two friends and we were the first to arrive at opening. The guy who was heading the bar was very nice and attentive and helped me select my cider because normally I don't drink cider. I chose a passion fruit variety from Sweden. It was delicious! Tasted like fruit juice.

I also ordered the meatballs. It was decent, but it definitely needed more salt to taste. The mac and cheese was also quite bland.

Overall I'd come here again and perhaps get the garlic fries. Really chill place upstairs of Vertigo to come and post before a night out.
author: Connie M.

description:
After meaning to try Upcider for years, I finally made it in. My one complaint is that we were there during brunch and thus couldn't order off the regular menu. I tried one of the flatbread benedicts and my wife had an open face sandwich with pulled pork. The food was all very good, better than I expected and in the style I had hoped. The cheesy flatbread was frankly amazingly perfect. Chewy and crispy and cheesy.

What had me even more pleased was the cider I ended up with. I explained to the tender what my favorite ciders are and asked for a recommendation. He pulled a little bit of two different ciders on tap and let me sample. I ended up with a delicious cider I would never have thought you choose for myself, which is perfect.
author: Austin M.

description:
Really excellent selection of cider, and splitting a cider flight is fun to do if you want to try a lot. The bartenders are knowledgeable and the ABV's seemed to range from 6%-10% with a wider variety than most bars! 

The food wasn't anything spectacular. Ordered kale salad and sweet potato fries. 

Go for: casual week night with friends, first date, or post work drink. 

Leave for: food after
author: Anna S.

description:
RIP yolozone where my bladerunner Thai crew x I used to get krunkthep till like 4am beezys.

But uhh can someone remind me which foods I'm reviewing bc MY mind's still on dat brunette whitechick shorty w glasses x pajama print office slacks like #dayng.

Hold up though:

(^_^) Pulled Pork Slider $6
best of what i had ::shrugs::

(-_^) Calamari $9
liz lemon aioli

(-_^) Spicy Lamb Slider $7
not spicy. sweet. wanted savory.

(-_-) Lamb Flatbread $11
lk heggathin pizza w no toppings

I'd return to try more stuff. Always going to miss the foreign language schwasted karaoke and broken glasses n shizz but hey.
author: Dan B.

description: If you like ciders, this is your place. If you like food and good service, this is not your place.  Their service model is order at the bar only with no one waiting tables here, which leads to long waits at the bar to order anything. Time better spent with your friends at your table in my opinion.  Food for our table came out sporadically and no one was able to eat at the same time. The particular bartender I had taking our order had a bad attitude and seemed bothered that I had questions about the menu and process as it was my first time there.  We had the pork and fried chicken sliders, sweet potato fries, meatballs, and shrimp.  All was just "ok", fried chicken was gross.  Nothing that blew us away as others have mentioned. Would not recommend for anything other than cider. Poor rating due to attitude from bartender and fried chicken sliders being cheap cuts of meat with lots of tendons that were on the verge of inedible.
author: Justin W.

description:
It was on a fun night of bar hopping on Polk St with friends during my college days that I discovered and fell in love with Upcider! I have never been to a bar that had as extensive of a beer and cider menu as UpCider has. This girl loves cider, and with a three-page menu for cider alone, I was completely overwhelmed (in the best way possible) with the choices that Upcider presented me. 

I was able to sample quite a few of the ciders due to coming with a large group of people who each ordered something different, and everything I tried was spectacular. I don't think you can go wrong with any of the cider options, so go ahead and be spontaneous! I am confident that whatever you pick will taste amazing. I decided to be spontaneous myself (a bit out of character for me really) and ordered the Two Rivers Huckleberry Cider, which was crisp, refreshing, and had that semi-sweet and tangy flavor characteristic of huckleberries. If you see this on the menu, I'd definitely recommend it. 

In addition to the amazing beer and cider that Upcider has, I also highly recommend their caramel bread pudding. It is rich and luxurious, semi-sweet from the caramel, and a lovely warm pudding that comes with a dollop of whipped cream on top. If you're in the mood for a sweet treat as well as some cider, do not pass up the caramel bread pudding!

I'm looking forward to indulging in some yummy pudding and trying out a few more ciders in Upcider the next time I find myself on a fun night out in the city!
author: Pooja M.

description:
Interior: The atmosphere is casual and surprisingly relaxing, almost "cozy" despite the how modern it looks inside. The bathrooms are clean, and there's enough seating to accommodate larger groups.

Menu: Extensive cider collection with some unique choices (mango habanero, pineapple, matcha, ect...) and many delicious ones (plum, black currant, blood orange, raspberry, pear...) There are plenty of options from all over the world and things at various price points. There's also a menu for food.

Staff: Courteous and knowledgeable. 

Location: Convenient. We managed to find parking a couple blocks away.

Overall: A really nice experience. I'd like to come back in the future with some friends and try out more cider.
author: Alex K.

description: Upcider has been on my list of places to try. After my recent trip there, I can honestly say that I am not a fan and that I won't come back unless someone else is willing to pay the tab! The Bacon topped Mac n Cheese wasn't anything special and the BBQ Shredded Pork Flatbread did not taste better than the flatbread I can get at BJ's. The Caramel Bread Pudding a la mode I had for dessert was the only great thing there and quite expected more after all the hype this place has. It was rather disappointing and I would be surprised to find myself having dinner again.
author: Jessica G.

description: Love this place! Great selection of cider, tasty food, friendly atmosphere, very spacious and nice view of the streets! Kiwi cider and beet salad with Turkish flatbread were the best!
author: Juliana V.

description:
Cider is my jam! It's got a little bubbly and a little alcohol to give you that nice social buzz, but doesn't fill you up like traditional beers do, and doesn't leave you sloppy like hard liquor can. It's my go to for a nice refreshing drink or a chill night cap.

Any time I find a cider house, I am jazzed. An entire line up of different ciders to try?! Upcider has a killer selection of every kind of cider you might want to try, and then 5 more you didn't think could exist. Sours, dry, crisp, tart, pear, apple, blood-orange -- you name it, they have it. They have ciders on tap and by the bottle, all between $6-13 a pour/bottle. 

The set up is super cool and chill - they're upstairs on polk street, in a urban, hipster, dark lit/industrial lights set up, with a great view down Polk St. It's spacious with industrial decor and long farm tables. There's single-stall bathrooms in the back right corner (facing the bar). Order everything at the bar and they give you a number.

Food was decent too, albeit pricy. $6 for a slider. $6 for garlic fries or buffalo fries. Wanted to try some other things but we were already at $55 for 4 ciders and fries. Will save the menu choices for our next visit.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
It's great what it aims to be, but what it aims to be ain't all that great is probably too harsh sounding, but it is what it is. 

If you're into high end ciders and tiny but really well done sliders, then this is the place for you. 

2 ciders and 2 sliders will cost you $40 and, while tasty, will leave you hungry. The sliders come with a little side of plain sliced beets, so, they got that going for them...

The venue is open and airy so it's good for after work gatherings, but there are just so many better bars or restaurants in the area it's hard to suggest upcider over them. Unless you really like high end ciders...
author: Cabaca T.

description:
I love this place mostly because I dont drink beers. Beers just don't agree with me so I tend to get ciders. This place is known for its ciders - they have a ton of cider choices which makes things fun. I've tried various items and most are great ciders. 

Haven't really tried the food, but it's always looked amazing. 

Protip: come here if you don't like beers!
author: Nina Y.

description:
Largest selection of ciders I've ever seen, both bottled and on tap. They have ciders from all over the world and a great selection of food as well. The atmosphere is cozy with great service. 

If you like sweet try the Strawberry Lime cider.
author: Emily S.

description: Love love love this place!  I am a big fan of cider so this is the perfect place. Bartenders know how to steer you in the right direction to find you your right cider. I had a Granny Smith Apple pie cider and it was amazing!! They only sell cider here but that's totally ok with me. Not to mention the food is awesome here!  The kale Cesar and flatbreads are great!  This is one of my to go places when I'm around the area. It has a nice interior and atmosphere and it's perfect for any occasion!
author: Kristina H.

description:
Disclaimer: I am not the worlds biggest cider fan. But even with that said, this place was very underwhelming.

I opted for the 6 cider tasting menu and asked the bartender to surprise me. I told him I didn't want anything sour. But the selection that he chose were.... mediocre at most. 

I do have to say the food here is quite delicious. The flat breads are really tasty. But given that this place is called Upcider, I really expected more out of the ciders.
author: April Z.

description: Blah. Crappy ass service - my wife's food arrived 15 minutes after mine. Waiter didn't care.
author: Wilder G.

description: Awesome cider selection, amazing food and friendly staff! Its large windows offer nice street view. The decor inside gives good vibes too. I really enjoy this place and I will definitely be back.
author: Ibrahim G.

description: I really enjoy this place. From their knowledgable staff to their ciders to their delicious pesto flat bread all the way to their bread pudding. This place has a chill vibe
author: Becky Mae A.

description: One of my favorite bars in SF! You MUST get the BREAD PUDDING!! I haven't had better bread pudding anywhere~ the cider selection is extensive and the food is delicious. Get the calamari or one of the flatbreads~ can't go wrong
author: SunnyAndLeonard E.

description:
Upcider's dishes strike a 3.5star for me, but I really enjoyed the intimate ambiance and open setup, which bumps it up for me. 

I feel like this is a venue that's really malleable to many different occasions, and the overall comfort this allows its many guests is lovely. I came with a group of friends on a casual triple date, and initially it wasn't very full. By the 8pm or 9pm mark though, things were definitely heating up, especially with the interesting beer and cider selections offered. Service is more on the casual side, and I loved the self-serve water in mason jars and barrels. Prices are a bit high for the quality of the food, but I didn't expect differently given the location and decor.

Spicy lamb upslider:
(http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=PpvAHpTeR2aYy9jzXi5UJQ&userid=1ug7EtH4blOzzbqqkmkenA)
The lamb really came through on this upslider (such a cute name), but I didn't get too much of the spiciness. I could taste the quality of the meat, which was nicely set off by the somewhat bitter greens and pickled vegetables on the side. It's a very small slider though, and it was gone in about two small bites. 

Garlic fries:
(http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=zt_53BMgi8Q77gGrKXA5zw&userid=1ug7EtH4blOzzbqqkmkenA)
French fries:
(http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=bxq6jLGluuBtNlUP8x5k0A&userid=1ug7EtH4blOzzbqqkmkenA)
I felt like the fries here were well-fried but underseasoned, especially the garlic fries. I only detected a hint of garlic in those fries, although the minced parsley (I believe?) was a nice touch. 

Turkish flatbread:
(http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=tT-ll82p5rVoWDWwYMU8Tg&userid=1ug7EtH4blOzzbqqkmkenA)
Pulled pork flatbread:
(http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=JCgJSCnkZLKt1RAThB-WAw&userid=1ug7EtH4blOzzbqqkmkenA)
Out of these flatbreads, I am partial to the pulled pork one despite my affinity for lamb. The Turkish flatbread with ground lamb and beef veered slightly on the salty side, and it was a bit one-dimensional in flavor despite having good quality ingredients and being well-made. The pulled pork flatbread had a sauce that was a touch too sweet, but the fresh cilantro and red onions on top balanced it nicely. I would have loved some minced cilantro on top in addition to the sprigs, but that's just me because I think cilantro lights up almost every dish.

Mac and cheese:
(http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=gpabfBSi2ugaUy7jU--K3Q&userid=1ug7EtH4blOzzbqqkmkenA)
I only had a bite of this dish, but it felt a little bland to me. The cheesiness fell a little short, as well as the browned crust on top that I've come to love in traditional versions of mac and cheese. I would probably not order this particular choice again.

The adaptability, careful yet classy presentation, and overall intimacy of this restaurant makes me want to come back for a variety of occasions.. even with my apple allergy.
author: Maggie X.

description:
Upcider is a change in scenery when drinking on Polk street.  I'm use to the rowdy crowds stumbling, drinking, vomiting, eating, hollering along this strip.  We sat by the window which was the perfect place to people watch.  The place was dim and not too loud creating a chill environment to chat.  We noticed a female in one of the apartments across the street slowly taking off her jacket.  We were hoping to see some action as we commentated and created our own storyline of what was going to happen.  Sadly, the story remained PG.

They didn't have 805 so my friend got me an ale, which I was not a fan of, no fault to him or the bar.  

Cool place to chill, nice décor.
author: Linda N.

description: Woooooohooooo! Best place to hang out! You will leave with satisfied appetite and sober mind. :) The place was opened by pals from Turkish. So I really love their interior decoration taste. I ordered the sort of cider bundle. They give you tons of choices, so definitely ask them for help. Wonderful place for cider holic.
author: Chun J.

description:
this place was ok... really depends what you're going for. cider? oh yeah, the selection is massive. food? meh. hipster vibe hangout spot? yup, this is it.

drink: i've never had cider so i wasn't sure what to order. they were great and gave me tastes of the ones on tap. nice variety to choose from.

food: we tried a few apps and dessert. sweet potato fries are a must. seriously good! very fresh tasting. dipping sauce wasn't a hit for us, but they're good alone. calamari could have used a tad more cooking and seasoning. the lemon mayo was underwhelming. spinach gruyere flatbread was incredibly bland. crispy texture was nice, but very little flavor. caramel bread pudding was good, just too sweet. needed ice cream instead of whipped cream. 

loved the ambiance. simple yet enjoyable decor. if they had better food we would have stayed longer.
author: Linnea E.

description:
Good cider, good ambiance!

I am so happy to finally find a cider spot in SF! They have a great selection of ciders. They have a multi page menu of all the different ciders available. The first page has mostly local ciders from california. But the menu goes on and I saw ciders from England that I recognized. The menu was nice, as it listed where all the ciders were from. However, the list went on and on and was a bit overwhelming.

Additionally, the staff there were not the most helpful or accommodating. They were nice enough, but didn't give specific recommendations. So my friends and I ended up doing a sampler of the 6 ciders they had on tap.

They offer a sampler of 4 or 6 of the 6 ciders they have on tap. And for 6, it was $20, which wasn't too pricey.

This place also has a good amount of food available if you get hungry. They have flatbreads and all your basic bar bites.

The ambiance here was also very cozy and hip. I liked the strings of lights they had up, which made the place feel more festive. The only thing was that when I went, it was super cold and my friends and I were freezing.

Would definitely come back for more flights of cider thought!
author: Julie L.

description:
Upcider was awesome! Wen't in on Sunday before going to a concert at Regency. It's located upstairs with a ton of window seats, but we chose to sit at the bar.

They have the largest selection of ciders, almost 20 of which are on tap, and a great menu.

We tried a few ciders, a pizza and some one of their apps (fried spinach balls? - can't remember the name). Everything was delicious and the staff was very nice and knowledgeable. 

We will definitely go back... lots more to try.
author: eddie c.

description:
Came here because we were gonna go bar hopping in the area except we were a bit early and ended up going to up cider to grab another bite (gluttonous I know) . 

I have never been to up cider before nor heard of it, but they have a huge selection of ciders !!! I'm not much of a drinker, but there were so many ciders here, they even had a kombucha cider!! I wasn't that hungry but my friends ordered the Mac & cheese, potato flatbread, and buffalo fries to share. 

The food came out within 15 minutes, and they were served very hot !! 
The buffalo chicken fries had a lot of flavor !! The fries themselves were super tasty but the blue cheese sauce on top really gave it the most delicious flavor ( my friends said that since I can't eat blue cheese) the Mac & cheese was sooooo creamy and cheeses, although the portion size seemed small, it's so heavy it's really hard to eat that much of it.  The potato pesto flatbread was very crispy and fresh.  There was a lot of flavor and texture packed into each bite. 

The food here is a great greasy and tasty way to fill up before going out.  I would suggest this restaurant in your in the area and want a quick bite to eat and aren't that concerned about calories.
author: Tiffany Y.

description: So glad to discover Upcider is offering brunch now. Not enough options in the area- so this is a great addition to a current Polk situation. You will find staple egg essentials with slight yet creative Mediterranean/ Turkish twist accommodated by a lively life streaming view of Polk street:) service is top notch per usual, big kudos to Serkan!
author: Liza B.

description: My new favorite place to get a drink in SF. I love cider, and there's no better place to go for a cider than this place. I think they have about 18 on tap at all times. Currently they have a strawberry cider, and Kombucha cider that are my favorites. Definitely try those if you can!
author: Jordan R.

description:
LOVE THIS PLACE!
So many options!
Lot's of space, friendly staff. 
Never got around to trying the food but loved the endless cider options.
author: Dawn B.

description:
I was famished when we were looking for a good nearby place on our first night in the city. This place sounded great, and had a small tapas-style shareable menu that we could pick and choose from. 

The room has a nice ambiance, with a seat yourself policy. It's wide open, with lots of seating and a nice upstairs corner view of the traffic out on Polk street. You order everything at the bar, and they will bring it out to you, so don't expect someone to come over to your table. We sat at the bar for the convenience of asking questions of the staff. 

I asked the bartender for a cider recommendation, and he helped me pick out a delicious mango-based cider that was sweet, but not overly so, and went down smooth. We tasted the ginger-based one, blackberry, and pumpkin as well. The ginger was very gingery (perfect if you like it), the blackberry was a little tart (if you don't want to go sweet) and the pumpkin was like drinking a carbonated pumpkin pie - like kissing your alcoholic aunt after she's had dessert!

For food, we started with the garlic fries, which had plenty of fresh garlic on them. No such thing as too much garlic for us, so we were very happy with them. We tried some of the sliders as our "main" - pulled pork, lamb, peppered salmon, and portobello. All of them were delicious, and perfectly sized for a bite each. 

We went full balls to the wall, and finished off our meal with the mac & cheese and zucchini bites. The m&c was cheesy, bacon-y, buttery, you know, the good stuff. There was something "off" about the zucchini bites. Neither of us could place the flavor, but they didn't taste like the description in the menu (zucchini, feta, onions). The cucumber yogurt sauce helped, but I probably wouldn't order those again. 

We were way too miserable, I mean full, to have dessert, so I skipped on the bread pudding. However, I did spot a can of the Trader Joe's holiday toffee on the back of the counter, and the bartender graciously offered us some. That toffee is seriously my favorite in the whole world, so I was more than happy to accept it! :) 

I may have walked by the entrance two or three times while trying to find it, but that's my fault for not remembering how small the city blocks are in SF compared to my hometown. All in all though, a great place that I can't wait to come back to!
author: Dustin B.

description: The ciders and food is delicious!!!! The bartender was great on helping me a decision since I don't have much experience lol
author: Rho G.

description: Huge selection of cider; you'll find it hard to decide if you don't already know what types of cider you enjoy. You can always ask the staff for recommendations though! They're all amazing people there. The food is also super. We got the Turkish flatbread, sweet potato fries, mac n cheese, and zucchini cakes. All in all, Upcider was a great experience. I will definitely be coming back.
author: Majid A.

description: When the bar food includes lamb sliders and peppered salmon, you know you've found a good spot. The cider selection is huge as well.
author: Steven D.

description: We received good advice from the bartenders about what new ciders we should try. We ordered fries and the cheese plate. The quality of the cheese and meats on the plate were good but the pairings were very weird and didn't make sense. The fries were good.
author: Shel M.

description:
I was really impressed by this spot- they have a massive cider list (the claim is that they have the widest selection of cider in SF, and I'd say that they have the list to back up this claim!) and what I would call upscale pub food that hits the spot.

There are plenty of tables and it's seat yourself- you do have to order everything at the bar though (I did wait awkwardly for a bit before realizing this).

Food wise, I was most impressed with their zucchini cakes- almost like zucchini falafel with a great cucumber yogurt dipping sauce. We also got two of their sliders (each slider is pretty much half of a normal burger). We opted for the grilled portobello and the spicy lamb. I thought each was great and it's awesome that they're a bit bigger than a normal slider as it feels like you're getting great value.

If I had to guess I'd say they have 75ish ciders available? They are from all over the world too, which is fun!

This would be a great place for a group of friends or for a first date!
author: Elliott W.

description:
Overall just missed the mark. Ciders not really cold. Have to order at bar including food. Basic items like fries were slightly under cooked. No full bar. 

Couple ++ good people watching from the windows. (Bar is on 2nd floor). A conceptually great place but needs polishing.
author: Joseph E.

description:
Was in the area bar hopping and stumbled upon Upcider, which I've been wanting to try for ages!

I'm a fan of cider, both sweet and dry. The bartender was really helpful when she could tell we were a bit overwhelmed with the menu (there's a lot to choose from!) I decided to go with a pear cider and LOVED it. So refreshingly delicious! My other 2 friends liked their choices as well.

The cute mason jar cups added a nice touch.

Great place if you love cider, and worth trying even if you don't!!
author: Noelle H.

description: So good! Really nicely designed, staff are really helpful, great choice of drinks and delicious food! The potato pesto flatbread is unusual but great!
author: Anne-Marie R.

description:
Extensive list of ciders with description. English ciders are very good.

My friend and I tried a couple of the Williams ciders, and the better one was perhaps the Dragon's Breath. Spicy due to the ginger, but it gave the cider such great flavor.

Prices are okay...average alcohol prices $6-8 per bottle (unless they are 20+ ounces)
author: Amy K.

description: There's sooo many choices for ciders here. The menu has pages filled with them from all over the world​ like France and Spain- these ones are bottles and can range in price from 6 to 40+ dollars depending on the cider and size. They have a draft menu of about 20 or so ciders and you can do a flight of 6 pours which I recommend. The servers are helpful in helping you choose as they know the ones that are sour, dry, or sweet. Definitely a place to try out if you're​ in the area.
author: Byron P.

description:
The good: great people watching from 2nd floor!
The Eh: 
Food: I only had the fries but no bueno... limp with no crisp 
Drinks: cider... duh lol. If ur not into cider this will not be your jam. But if u love cider they have a huuuuge selection
author: Chrys L.

description: A friend and I came here after a concert for a late night snack and drink. We loved the vibe and cider selection. It was cozy, but lively. My cider was a little warm, but it was still very good. The fried calamari was delicious and the serving was pretty huge. I would definitely go back!
author: Lexy P.

description: I have good news for everyone:) they have really Turkish beer and awesome sliders( you should try). If you guys have not been yet I think you lost some important stuffs... Atmospheres was crazy and hot.
author: Tom J.

description:
Before venturing off to Upcider on a casual SF Bar Crawl with friends, I had not known that there were bars devoted to showcasing alcholic ciders! Upcider is a hard cider lover's haven, paradise, treasure...but really no matter what you decide to call it, this bar is a godsend to those who crave the particularly sweet alcoholic carbonation of a good ol' hard cider. 

As an avid beer drinker, I admit that this would not be my go-to spot since the beer pickings are slim (rightfully so) and personally, some ciders can be a bit too sweet for me however, I have to say Upcider - WOW, just wow! The variety you have to choose from is pretty top notch. I'm talking, they have a cider (or did during my visit) that was nearly $32/pint! 

FYI, they do have other alcohol for sale such as beer but the pickings are slim. 

I really love the ambiance of the place and it would be a great spot to hangout in with a group or just a few friends as well. 

I will note that Upcider does have a kitchen, but alas I was unable to try their offerings since the kitchen was closed. Till next time I suppose!

Overall, a great hip bar for those who love the (alcoholic) ciders in life. Can't wait to come here with my cider loving pals! :)
author: Janelle V.

description:
Visited Upcider before a show at Social Hall just a few feet ahead on the same street! How convenient.

I only had a beer, which isn't saying much about their other beers and food items. I just wanted a quick beer, so didn't get the chance to see what beers they had on tap. I got a light ballast point sculpin, which was unfortunately from the can. I should have looked closer at their tap menu, darn! Next time :) The bartender pouring my beer was efficient and smiley, but nothing too drastic of service. They still had some people having light dinner when we came around 9:30PM on a Thursday evening, but most people were having beers and enjoying their company.

I loved that upcider's sign was on their second-story corner because it's so easy for me to describe to your friends who don't think they can find upcider. Just tell them to look up, and the sign will be extremely obvious. Street parking was super great because there were so many spots on the street (metered, but free after 6PM YAY!). The ambiance is what I loved the most. There are so many bar stools that wrap around the edge of the space, which is perfect for people-watching and in our case, watching the line to Social Hall. I love the convenience of this bar and how it's on the second story. Cool, wooden-vibes, warm beer hall with a pinch of hipster. Will be back!
author: Jodi H.

description:
To find this spot, you have to look up.  It's above Subways.  The entrance is on Polk by their chalkboard.

Love the casualness of Upcider.  You order food and drinks at the bar and they give you a number on a stand.  You find an open table and settle in.  Food arrives at your table and it's totally easy.

We liked the cider menu.  Many to choose from and were pleased with what we ordered.  Served cold in a mason jar, I can see coming back for the drinks.  Cider list is 3 pages long and ordered by state or county (England, France, Germany, Ireland, Scotland, Spain, New Zealand, etc)

The food menu looked great but some dishes were very poorly executed.

We ordered a few things that are not worth repeating:  
*Fried chicken slider (chicken too dry and fried to a chicken jerky, slaw lacking flavor)
*Flatbread with spinach, gruyere & garlic (didn't taste good)

We really enjoyed 2 dishes:  
+Salmon slider with tomato pesto and basil pesto
+Meatballs.  It reminds me of the giant meatball at Beretta in the Mission.  Upcider's is smaller, still juicy (beef and pork blend?) sitting in homemade tasting tomato sauce.  We loved this.  Served with some toasted baguettes to finish up the tomato sauce.

We'll come back and try it again.  Service was good and drinks were great!
author: Susan C.

description:
Checked this place out before a concert at the Regency Ballroom. Super hipster.  They claim to be the first cider house in California. 

The cider list is pretty overwhelming, there were about 5 pages of bottled cider plus a tap list. They also had a page of beers available.  I'm not a huge cider fan but I figured I should get once since I was there. I had a cider on tap and they serve it to you in a, wait for it, mason jar! So hipster it hurts. 

I also ordered the zucchini cakes and an eggplant slider. The food was awesome! The zucchini cakes were so good, actually had a lot of zucchini in them and came with a dill dipping sauce. The slider was also delicious but you only get one. I'd recommend two, three if you're really hungry. 

You have to order food and drinks at the bar, which I could see being difficult when it's crowded.  They give you a number and bring out your order to you. 

I'd definitely check this place out again, there was a lot of yummy looking food on the menu!
author: Lauren L.

description: This place is such a good place if you just want to chill with your friends on the weekend. Ciders are definitely on point as well as the food! Ambience and music are also spot on. Service is excellent and overall a reasonable price. Also it's great place for a first date
author: Austin L.

description:
I went here last night (last minute idea) for the first time, and it was pretty great!  Note when you enter, you must go upstairs to get to get to the actual restaurant/bar.  Also note, even though there are tables or low tops -- you order from the bar.  Also, if you aren't really paying that much attention when you pick the place (like me) -- this is a place that specializes in Ciders (thus the name), so there are a lot of Cider choices, and not many other options.  

I liked the atmosphere/decor of this place -- the windows are large and let in a lot of natural light, and you're able to look down on Polk street, which is pretty nice.  There are also cute hanging lights, which really give it a trendy/fun/cute vibe.  

We ordered the Cajun Chicken Slider, Peppered Salmon Slider, Turkish Flatbread, and Sweet Potato Fries.  My friend and I both agreed that the best part of the sliders was the bread/roll (really buttery and perfectly toasted).  I thought the chicken was dry and didn't really eat too much of it -- although my friend did.  The salmon slider was really peppery but didn't really have enough salt -- but it was cooked perfectly.  We were disappointed by the Turkish Flatbread -- mostly because it didn't have cheese (lol). Honestly, it tasted great, but we just really wanted the cheese too.  Our favorite part were the Sweet Potato fries -- MUST TRY.  They were so good and the house-made blueberry ketchup is amazing.  We were totally blown away.

Overall -- definitely a great spot to meet up/hangout.  I would recommend, and would go back again.
author: Michelle S.

description: I was introduced to Upcider by a friend and think this spot has it all!  Cool location looking out from the second story out to the street, amazing food, super friendly staff who really take care of you and more ciders than you can count.  This place would be perfect with a large group of friends or an intimate dinner for two.  Def would go back.  Check it out, you want be disappointed!
author: Christopher S.

description: Huge selection of ciders with knowledgeable bartenders who can help you navigate the menu and help you find what you're looking for. The food was surprisingly also fantastic!
author: Suman G.

description: Cider lovers unite!!! Went here over the winter break and was very pleasantly surprised at how spacious this place is -  don't be deceived by the small narrow entrance and how extensive the selection of both local and non-local ciders are! My friends and I ordered a bunch of different ones to try and they were all great, from freshly baked pie scented ones to ciders mixed with other fruits. Gotta love the mason jars too. I opted for the "Mischief Maker Pomegranate" and highly recommend it if you're looking for something edgy and not too sweet.
author: Grace J.

description: Omg! I love cider, specifically a certain one from Denmark that I can't find anywhere but Europe. This cider pub was the answer to my quest. While is doesn't have the exact same cider the Swedish cider comes super close. They have a huge selection of ciders, cider on tap, beer, wine and food. What more could you ask for. Come, drink their cider, ppl watch from their location. A great time to be had.
author: Linda H.

description:
Upcider's a fun little bar on Polk St with a large selection of ciders, IPA's, and other fun beers. There's lots of seating and quite a few stools along the window if you're interested in people-watching while drinking with your friends. 

They also have a kitchen but I recommend this more for finger food and small bites. I came for dinner once, ordering the fries and stuffed potato souffle. Though good, it definitely lacked in quantity for what I paid and I found myself quite hungry later on in the night. Still, it's a fun place to stop by if you're bar hopping around Polk Street.
author: Philip W.

description: They have amazing flatbread!!!! I also tried stuffed potato souffle which ia very unique and very delicious. They  have all types of beers, very good music and very helpful and friendly staff. It's very good to see that they have a book section. I really enjoy my time in there. You guys are amazing.
author: Tugba Y.

description: A friend and I went there for a drink last night at 7 pm and left 3.5 hours later!  Love this place - it has a cool Manhattan vibe, is on the second floor looking down on Polk, and an interesting crowd.  The bartender is great - friendly,  very knowledgeable about their many ciders, and even offered tastings.  Delicious food: tried the mushroom flatbread, buffalo fries (with blue cheese and cayenne...YES), and maybe the best fried calamari ever (lime dipping sauce).  Really glad to have found Upcider and will definitely be returning often.
author: Jim S.

description:
Gluten free heaven. I was visiting San Francisco with a few friends for a birthday weekend and being the one with Celiac disease I usually take charge of finding places to eat/drink so I'm not stuck with water and veggies. Upcider was an answer to prayer!!! 

Cider flights--um YES PLEASE! You could do a few tastes or all of them and see which ones you liked  flights make cider tasting so much more fun because they're all so different!

They also had this poached apple dessert yumminess that was gluten free and no one at the table missed gluten. We ate them so fast! 

Beyond the food and drink, the location is pretty awesome. It's on the second floor and on a corner so the Windows give a pano view of the street below and all the way up and down. I can't imagine what it's like during the day with the windows open! 

If you love cider or you have an aversion to gluten, check this place out.
author: Noelle S.

description: Really great atmosphere and more cider selections than I even knew existed.  Sweet potato fries with blueberry sauce is a great snack - food can get pricey for a whole meal though.
author: Margo B.

description:
I really like this place! I love cider so this place is like heaven to me. My friends make fun of me cause they drink beer and I'm always ordering cider. 

I found out about this place from a friend. It's in my neighborhood. You can almost miss it if your not looking out for it. You have to go up a flight of stairs. 

This bar is nice. They have an extensive menu with ciders from around the world. The service is great. The bartenders are very knowledgable with the ciders. The atmosphere is chill. 

I like to sit by the window and people watch while enjoying my cider. This will be one of my go to spots when I bar hop on Polk St.
author: Edie G.

description: Extensive menu of drinks. Bartender gave me some samples when deciding which was very nice. First cider I had was Cactus Red which wasn't labeled as a sugar free cider, which should've been. But the other ciders and beers my friends got were very good. Can't wait to try the food.
author: Kerry G.

description:
1. This place is dedicated to Ciders (hence the name Upcider)
There are 3 pages in their menu solely dedicated to ciders, small beer selection, offers non alcoholic beverages and food. ( so tempted to try the eggplant sliders but I had already eaten.)

2. Order at the bar
We were given menus and greeted as we entered and instructed to sit wherever. There were signs on the wall indicating to order at the bar, subtle yet effective.

3. Look up
Upcider is located above another bar/restaurant. Up the entry stairs and to the left, they have a beautiful location. Dimly lit and spacious, long tables made for groups and parties, more intimate seating near the windows with a nice view of the hustle and bustle of Polk Street

4. Have a Cider
I feel like I cannot give a complete review because I had an Old Rasputin and it was bottled. I'm not a big Cider fan but I really think the variety in this place can change my mind.


I'll be back soon Upcider
author: Genoa D.

description: Do NOT order the hot pho you. Tastes like sriracha simply watered down and poured into a standard beer. Very yuppy. Too much butter on everything. No pork. Very disappointing thought may be perfect for the valley girl from socal. Not coming again.
author: Kimberly H.

description: I love cider and can't believe it has taken me so long to get my butt over here! I love the ambiance of this place and of course all the ciders! I definitely recommend the sampler to get a taste of everything.
author: Janet H.

description: They recently started doing brunch and I'm so happy they did it right :) They give a slight turkish twist to brunch and it's SO SO GOOD plus you can have cider for brunch and there's NO WAIT - how great is that! My boyfriend's favorite is the spinach gruyere flatbread(in fact his favorite brunch food he's tried ever) which has poached egg on top and an amazing flavor. I really like their menenen(or sth spelled like that) which is a turkish scramble egg with lamb sausage. So different from your usual scrambled eggs and also really good! Their french toast was really good as well. Almost worried to leave a review cause I'll be sad if they start having lines, but they totally deserve a five star just for brunch alone :)
author: Sunny K.

description:
This was such a fun place to be at! I'm not a big alcohol drinker, but my friend absolutely loves cider and wanted to bring me here. We ubered here, which I imagine most of you will do as well lest you actually attempt parking and not drink because drinking and driving is not acceptable. 

The atmosphere is really nice here. We came around 9 on a Friday and it was pretty busy. We ordered bbq fries, two flatbreads and had cider! 

The flatbreads were wonderful, the fries were good and I really enjoyed my cider.

The menu for drinks is extensive and I think that's why my friend really enjoys this place.  The list is no joke and they provide a lot of different options. I liked the menu because it was detailed and organized--that's something that makes it easier to choose. 

They provide names and a description of the drink so you'll know what you'll be ordering as well as the alcohol % and the price. Those were nice and I don't believe every place does that. I could be completely wrong, but it was my first time seeing such an extensive and detailed menu. 

We sat against a window which was nice to people observe and enjoy the scenery.  There were also employees who came around periodically to take plates and ask us if we were doing okay which was really nice. 

It was a good experience. I'd definitely come back to this place. Fair prices, good service, and a great atmosphere!
author: Jay K.

description:
If you like hard cider, this is a must stop. The atmosphere is chill and the ciders are amazing! We had a sampler of the ciders on tap and ordered a couple of bottles. The experience was awesome! I would gladly go back if we didn't live in Seattle. 

While we were sitting at the bar we met a cider maker and he told us about his business. It was a truly awesome experience. The bar tenders were also very chill and knew a lot about the cider.
author: Heather M.

description: I love this place for both dinner and brunch. Their Blue Berry French Toast is mind blowing. I love that there is not usually a wait time and the staff is knowledgable, helpful and friendly. Also the ciders are mostly below $10 which is great. I go to Upcider often. It's a great spot for friend groups, date or even to hang out by yourself since they have great counters that face the windows.
author: Göksu K.

description:
I can't believe this place exists. A bar dedicated to ciders! There are SO many from all over the world. I enjoyed the pear cider last time I came here. n addition to ciders, there is a good amount of other beers. I was unaware that kombucha beer exists, but it does, and they have it here.

It's a gastropub, so there is a pretty extensive food menu. I can't comment on any of the food because I didn't order anything, but my friend said the flatbread was good.
author: Steph V.

description: I had the spicy lamb slider and the pulled pork slider, both on cabbage. My boyfriend had the fried chicken slider. We shared some sweet potato fries. He had the mad bark cider and I had the non alcoholic ginger beer. I LOVED the lamb slider, simply stellar. Everything else was good, but not stand out. My boyfriend was very disappointed with the size of the slider, especially at $6 each. After tip, the bill was $47 and some change, basically for appetizers and one alcoholic beverage. We stopped at Subway downstairs when we left so that my boyfriend could get a sandwich. Overall, I enjoyed it though, and the ambiance was nice, though it was too cold to take off our coats.
author: Brenda B.

description: I loved their white bean shakshuka that serves during brunch . There are also variety of egg selections such Benedict , omelette and menemen( tuskish soft scrambled egg). My friends ordered those which were also delicious . I also highly recommend their cidermosa which made with cider and orange juice. In other words, It is a great replacement weekend mimosa routine. Thanks upcider opening for the brunch , I look forward to come back and try other items on the menu.
author: Korzay N.

description: Get the flatbread with mushrooms. It's literally a small pizza - and delicious!! Friendly and helpful bartenders, by the way.
author: Kristen S.

description: The location is big, super cool people and owned by amazing 2 young guys. They are extremely friendly and pays attention to every customer and make sure that orders are coming fast, and the drinks are well prepared. First time here and I am amazed with their amazing work ethic and location. I highly recommend this place to anyone. If you want good food, good ambiance, affordable place. These type of places makes SF an amazing place!
author: Giselle S.

description: Had the salmon slider and the spicy lamb. The salmon was really good. Friendly staff. Cool chill vibe inside. You order at the bar and they bring the food to your table. Good price.
author: Matthew D.

description:
We went on a Wed night after hearing great things about this place from a coworker. I was not disappointed! Tried their passionfruit cider and Ace cider.
