Passionfruit cider was a recommendation from bartender and it was too sweet for my taste but Ace cider was pretty awesome. We ended up ordering garlic fries and sweet potato fries with blueberry ketchup. I was really hoping to like blueberry ketchup after reading other yelp reviews but it was not for me. Loved their garlic fries though! Also, ordered potato flatbread and it was yummy. We really wanted to try their caramel bread pudding but they sold the last one and told us that we will have to wait another 40 mins for it so we skipped it. 

The best thing was the ambiance of this place. I am not a big cider fan but it was very chill place to come with friends and hang out. I would definitely recommend this place! :)
author: Shirali A.

description: Amazing food and cider options! I can't wait to come back and I haven't even left !!! Great suggestions from bartender as well and pretty noises but relaxing .  Cool view as well!
author: Cassandra P.

description:
Great selection of cider. Disrespectful staff.

If you cannot cope with drunk people why would you ever work at a bar? Observed a pretty horrific incident here that involved  the "owner" and a woman customer but will spare you the details.

They really need a lesson in customer service here. It's extremely disappointing considering the cider list is great but I will never step foot back into this place.

Please consider other places to drink cider before you give them your business. Upcider should be closed.
author: Kylie D.

description:
If you prefer cider to IPA like I do, this place is your jam! The selection here is solid; you have pages upon pages of cider to choose from as well as their rotating daily specials. Many are served in mason jars. I discovered a new pineapple cider that I love.

Food-wise, it's a hit or miss but I would recommend the lamb sliders. Although they are a bit on the small side, they're really tasty. I thought the pesto flatbread was just average. The blueberry ketchup was unique, but a little off-putting for my taste buds. The food is a notch too expensive for what you get.

Still, a fun and lively cider bar to go with a group (or alone -- just sit at the bar!) and you'll probably find a new favorite cider.
author: Valerie L.

description: We stopped here for some apps and a drink before heading out on the town for the night. Of our three night vacation, we ended up coming here two of the nights. We could not get enough of their mac and cheese and their potato soufflé. The location was really cool, we had seats that looked out over the street and was great for people watching. It was not a loud place so we could enjoy our evening and have conversation. We will definitely come back here the next time we're in town.
author: Erin L.

description:
Cider selection is worthy of a closer look lots of good unique choices as well as some of the more common brands. They have a 6 for $20 flight list on the chalkboard behind the counter. ( I liked the first one from Washington and the fifth one that tasted sweet like a moscato) I also liked Dragons breath which was not too dry and not too sweet 

Beer selection was a little sad. A can of beer poured into a chilled glass. 

It can get crowded for a sat night. Reservations accepted if you want to eat dinner there too. It's a good location on Polk street but parking is horrendous
author: Vicky L.

description:
I came here because the concept of drinking cider with bar food, sounded like a worthy event of my time!  It was!

Possmann from Frankfurt, Germany - Pure Cider - fragrant apples with apple aroma. 

Black Berry Currant Cider - tasted more like juice rather than cider.  It was refreshing.

Wandering Dry Oak Cider - It left the palate dry, rest assured.  I wasn't a fan of this, but if you like it dry, you'll like this!

Do order up some dibs, such as their buffalo fries with blue cheese, kale salad with Caesar dressing, lamb slider and Creole Shrimp!  Their Turkish flatbread and calamari was passable.  

Bar severs were fast and came around swiftly.  I like the dimly lit, cider place.  I do recommend checking their selections of unique ciders out, but their meals aren't fillers and quite on the pricey side!
author: Tiffany D.

description: This is a super fun spot! We stumbled upon this spot after moving into our new condo a few blocks away and devoured our food, and not just because we were hungry, but because it was delicious. The cider selection is INSANE. I had a delicious pear cider and my husband got a beer (I know, I know, I explained we were at a place called upCIDER, but the heart wants what the heart wants). For good, we went with the mac & cheese (SO GOOD), the meatballs (meh), and three sliders (all delicious). We will definitely be back here some time soon. It's a super casual space -- grab a table when you walk in and walk up to the bar to place your order. Makes it a great spot for groups!
author: Hillary M.

description: Good if you want to drink cider. Nothing special about the food.
author: Nato G.

description:
Really really good place. Went there on a Saturday night around 11:30pm. Easily got a seat. There is no table service, put all of your orders for drinks and food in at the bar. Had a cool window seat that looked out over Polk St. in Oakland. Oh, the place is on the second floor so the view of the area is nice.

Good was overall really good. Ordered Cajun chicken sliders and peppered salmon sliders. They were the weakest entree, but not gross. Also ordered garlic fries which were good. Turkish pizza was awesome. And the. Finally the meatballs. Those were the best. The order I just mentioned everything in was from worst to best. Meatballs stole the show. Must get those if you go.

This would have been a 4 rating if only for the food (sliders took it down a little bit). But the view and the setting bumped it up to 5. Happy we went here.

I don't drink so I can't comment on the cider. But they have a lot.
author: Sylvester C.

description:
Great food, great drinks selection, and great atmosphere. 

Some operational details were annoying - please note that it opens at 11am, not 10am as listed on the website and on their sign. Also how can you be out of something when your restaurant opens? Warning not to pay for OJ at brunch. It's obviously from a carton.
author: M. M.

description:
Following a Macallan tasting event at the Regency on Sutter, we decided to come to Upcider for both dinner and drinks. Upcider is located on the second floor of a corner building on Polk and this provides a great view looking out through the massive windows. The interior has a great atmosphere with dimmed lights and hardwood walls. It feels like a cross between a sleek lounge and an old fashioned saloon.

As the name implies, Upcider focuses on all types of hard ciders. The sheer amount of options are almost overwhelming. There are literally four pages of cider options from numerous breweries. All total there are well over a hundred choices to decide between. There are varying sizes, alcohol content and flavors, some come in cans, some in bottles. Not really knowing too much about cider, I lucked out when I chose a tasty apple ginger flavor called Dragon's Breath. After that I got a pumpkin flavored cider which was light and delicious.

The food was not all that great. We had a few flatbreads which were average and some sort of potato dish which was good but nothing special. I probably wouldn't come here for food again.

Overall, I liked a lot of aspects of this place and had a great experience. I would definitely come here again for drinks.
author: Mark O.

description: This place is in a very colorful part of San Francisco.  Easily accessible and walking distance from public transit.  I ordered a Benedict and it was yummy. But the attraction is Cider.  I ordered Apple Cider with low alcohol.  First time I visited this gastropub was to attend a friend's farewell brunch and I've been coming back since!
author: Wing W.

description:
My friends and I decided to go bar hopping on Polk Street. This street has TONS of bars to choose from. Our first stop was upstairs at Upcider. 

My first reaction to this bar was 'WHOA. The selection of cider here, is pretty nuts.' I have never seen such a selection before! They literally had pages and pages of ciders to choose from. 

Of course the only way to go in these kinds of situations is to have everyone pick the one that sounds the best and then we just sit down talking story while rotating the drinks in a circle. Best way to sample multiple at once~!
author: Ariana M.

description: While they have an extensive menu, the one time a friend and I came, we ordered a cider flight tasting.  There were lipstick marks on 3 out of the 5 mason jars.  gross.
author: Diane T.

description: GREAT SLIDERS. Enormous beer/cider list. Definitely worth going to.
author: Doug M.

description:
Just order the mushroom toasts and thank me later.  "Woo-freaking-who amaze-ball-city."

We also had a couple ciders, the buffalo fries (which were spicy, and I appreciated the small dice of the celery and carrot garnish), and the spinach salad (also very good, but really who wants a salad when they are drinking? - the crazy "carb-free", "bacon on the side" girls I was with--that's who!).

The 2nd floor space is great and really gives you a birds-eye view of the polk gulch.  It is a bit pricey for what you get, but what you get is quality with pretty decent service so no complaints....and really I want to rub that mushroom cream sauce all over someone and lick it off....Jesus, it was CRAZY yummy.
author: Amy W.

description: Decent selection of pub food with a Mediterranean feel. Massive selection of ciders from various parts of the world. I think the beverage selection holds this place up, food is average at best. Good value nonetheless.
author: Jack B.

description:
I was intrigued by the extensive cider menu and comfort food offerings, but unfortunately, I wasn't impressed, and will not be returning.  Sorry to be a debbie downer but the food just did not taste good at all.  Don't get the flatbread or meatballs (odd and hard). The flavor was off, and it was pretty pricey.  The cider was very expensive, and while we tried several kinds, it just seemed like $14 for a cider that the bartender hands you in a can or bottle (on the cheaper side of the menu) is a lot to pay when you can get a fancy cocktail elsewhere that someone handmade to order.
The bartenders were unfriendly and when we picked something that wasn't available, they acted annoyed when we asked if it was available sometimes. He curtly replied, "we have it rarely."  Um, okay thanks, it's on your menu.
author: Kari L.

description:
Phenomenal! Many cider options and knowledgeable staff. I spoke to the bartender for 20 minutes after realizing he was the owner. If you want a custom experience, this is the spot.

*cider flights!!
author: laz d.

description: Low key bar with a large number of ciders. They also have beer. The service is friendly and quick. It's a great spot for a group or a casual couple getting a drink. It's on the second floor so if you look out the window towards the corner of Sutter and Polk you might get a show from down below. Bare, yet contemporarily styled interior. Great place for a drink. Enjoy!
author: Robert H.

description:
The garlic fries were good. 

Lots of cider up for selection if you're into ciders. If not, it's still interesting to try. The flight could be just a tad cheaper imo. 

The staff were all very friendly and service was good at the tables (cleared empty glasses fast). 

Pretty decent atmosphere, would definitely come back.
author: Scott K.

description: Awesome gastropub with great eats as well. You can tell it has Irish beer to it when you walk in the bar.
author: Harper W.

description:
CIDER WASTED!!! Bookoo choices 
(4.5 stars)

I love myself a good Gastropub!! It's my new place of to leisure  to knock a few out.

- FOOD, good. CIDER, oh mymymy 
- PRICES, decent
- SERVICE, on point
- AMBIANCE, chill and spacious

I'm a sucker for Pear Cider (or jaegar), they are my kryptonight. How about coming to a place that has 3 pages full of cider selections with different flavors, from different states, from different countries.There was just too many to choose from, we plan to frequent here often to knock out the items we didnt try last time.

HEFFER STATUS (ciders and food pairing)

BLOSSOM NECTAR ($13) - Tieton Cider Works, from Tieton, WA. 17oz with 6.9% alcohol. This was my number one choice because it just sounds so unique. Well, it was and it was BOMB. Has a nice crisp sweet to it, that's what I look for the crispy and the sweet. Pleasant sweet notes of the nectar is tasted but nothing powerful. Good choice, the bottle is equivalent to two glasses.

SIR PERRY BERRY(~$9) - William's from Bistol, England. 17oz with 6% alcohol. This was pretty good, similar to the blossom nectar but not as crisp yet has some light notes of strawberry and berry. Kind of reminds me of a "diet" strawberry soda.

JOKER DRY (~$8) - Ace Cider from Sebastopol, CA. 12oz with 6.9% alcohol. Took a sip of this and it was dry. I can't remember much about this one. LOL. sorry.

STUFFED POTATO SOUFFLE ($8.95) - house-made ground sausage*, mashed potato was their basic description. My description, fancy ass mash potatoes with a fluffy whip to it. DAMN THIS WAS GOOD. 

CALAMARI WITH PRESERVED LEMONS ($8.95) - description says 'green onions and jalapenos', I didn't really get any of those flavors. I did enjoy that it had the light batter and it was crispy but I've had way better and have had way worst. It was fair and managable to eat. But why did I really have alot of tentacles (i hate tentacles).
 
SWEET POTATO FRIES ($5.95) - served with house-made blueberry ketchup. Sweet potato fries were good and the blueberry ketchup was interesting. It looked really dark but it had some hints of blueberry. Not sweet, more tangy. It wasn't so bad at all!

SPINACH AND GRUYERE ($9.95) - spinach, garlic, gruyère. We saw another table have this and although we were pretty stuffed, had to get it because it looked really inviting. VERY THIN FLATBREAD, those are the best. The crust was so thin and crunchy, loved it. I liked how they cooked the pizza, melted the gruyère and then added the spinach last. 

Will I be back? YES INDEEDEE!!!! You don't have to ask me twice. 

JABA APPROVED. Until the next review...
author: Jane A.

description:
Feel guilty for not trying the cider!!! 

Huuuuuge selection of ciders and also very large collection of beers in bottles & cans too. 

Great service, great vibe, lovely food.
author: David J.

description:
Wide variety of beer and cider at a decent price....BUT the food (sliders) are way overpriced...$6 a slider? Really?  I can go to any other bar in SF and get 3 sliders for about the same price, and they probably taste better too!  

it was also a rainy night when I came here, and since this is in an older building, it was a little cold inside.  Other than the drink selections, there's nothing too special about this place.
author: Kevin C.

description: This place is cool because it's above street level and has lots of window seating to watch people go by on Polk. Inside is open and light with globe string lights, big glass windows, and rustic-style furniture. Everyone who helped us was friendly and attentive. And of course, awesome selection of ciders and other apple treats.
author: Becca S.

description: I love their cider selection. Would just wish they had a lunch hour rather than brunch hours
author: Mynx C.

description: We went on a Sunday evening over Labor Day weekend, so it wasn't crowded, which was nice. We ordered Spinach and Gruyere Flatbread, Pulled Pork Upsliders, Sweet Potato Fries, Buffalo Fries, and Zucchini Cakes. We ordered a lot. The best of the bunch were surprisingly what you could easily get at other restaurants - the Pulled Pork Upsliders and the Sweet Potato Fries. The others were ok, but nothing I would probably order again. The best part of the restaurant is probably the extensive list of ciders. I ordered the Anthem pear cider, which was tasty. Overall, good atmosphere and I would go back again.
author: Annie L.

description:
Came here on a HowAboutWe date. Cool urban atmosphere and our server seemed knowledgeable about all of the ciders that could be offered to us.  

I ordered a cider that he classified as the most "difficult" - reminded me of pickle juice - or a dirty martini, and I quite enjoyed it. Fiance had one of the more traditional ciders, which he enjoyed as well.  

Our deal came with sweet potato fries with blueberry ketchup - not as good as I hoped it to be. The flavors were surprisingly subtle, if not bland.

We also ordered a slider, which in the end, was not delivered to us at all.  Personally, this wasn't a huge deal breaker.  I can only assume that the server had forgotten we had ordered something in addition to our deal, and we ended up just leaving.  I would like to come back and try more substantial food and taste more ciders.
author: Trish P.

description:
As a cider-lover, I was excited to find this place. FOUR pages of ciders on the menu, six ciders on-tap.

We ordered buffalo fries, portobello slider, and pulled pork flatbed. All the food was good (fries and flatbread nothing exciting, slider REALLY good). We also had 2 ciders (one on tap, one bottle). After tax/tip, bill was $50. 

Two gentlemen working, not busy yet at 6pm on a Saturday. Both employees were friendly, though not very chatty. My husband likes to ask a lot of questions and make conversation, so that's hit or miss depending on personalities.
author: Kristina R.

description:
What a great find; I loved Upcider! This might have in part to do with the fact that I really enjoy hard cider, but besides that, this is a really fun place! I came here on a Sunday evening and the place was pretty empty. You order at the bar and then seat yourself. 

I got the blood orange, tangerine cider: it was not as sweet as I wanted it to be but it was a really interesting drink! They literally have 3-4 pages of ciders so I can't wait to come back and try dozens and dozens of other flavors. 

To eat, we shared the sweet potato fries, mushroom flatbread, and the zucchini cakes. In my opinion, this was too much food for 2 people! The sweet potato fries came with a blueberry ketchup which was delicious - such a great addition to the fries! The mushroom flatbread was pretty good and paired well with the cider. Warning: there are a LOT of mushrooms on the flatbread so only order this if you LOVE mushrooms. The zucchini cakes were just ok - I've definitely had better. They were a little dry and flavorless. 

Overall, I had a great experience and Upcider and I will be back again with a larger group of people because this restaurant is pretty big!
author: Malika R.

description: Great place for a glass or flight of cider. Knowledgeable and friendly bartenders who will let you taste and help you figure out what to order!
author: Roxy H.

description: Great sliders, sweet potato fries with blueberry ketchup and ciders! Great vibes and music.
author: Zach G.

description:
Amazing! I have had ciders before that mostly tasted like sugar water, so I was completely blown away by the diverse selections they have.  Definitely do a flight if it's your first time! One tasted almost like champagne, another was almost an ale -- really they have SO many choices!

The space is huge and airy - feels more like LA than SF. Perfect group hangout spot.

The food was divine!  Lamb slider was perfectly savory and juicy.  I am not a salad person (or a beet person) but the beet salad here is the most delicious healthy plate I've eaten in years.  It's a simple menu, but everything is executed flawlessly.

can't wait to go back!!!
author: Renee B.

description: Can't speak for entire table but calamari was almost inedible. I wouldn't have eaten it if I wasn't starving. Beyond salty.  In fact quite a few ppl withing our group agreed.  I barely have taste buds and I taste so much salt. So not worth the money. Location was good. Food was mehhhh. Beer was decent. But service sucked. We were visiting SF from chicago. This was our 1st place to visit aside from the hotel. Not a good first impression. I would not return here if I came back to SF. We weren't greeted. We had to ask for menu's and waters. Nor were we told that we had to order at the bar. We sat there like dummies for a good 10+ minutes.  Ridiculous.
author: Laura G.

description: This place kinda sucked. I liked the decor and craft beer/cider collection but the chicken slider I had was horrible. It was so overcooked that it felt like rubber. The waitress was also a little rude and standoffish.
author: Martha E.

description: Cider choices are good. Had the upsliders and they weren't good at all. Try something else.
author: Elizabeth R.

description:
Is it Upcider or should it really be called Outcider or worse yet, Downcider? It probably depends on how thirsty you are and whether you have plans to dine elsewhere. On Valentine's Day, I had the implausible notion that this would be a casual, low-key place for me and Jamie W. to eat and have some cider. The cider part was decent enough albeit nothing that came fresh from a tap. It was also nice to view the hubbub of Polk Street from a cavernous second-floor space away from the glare of vagrants and perpetual gawkers. But the food was marginal at best, ill-conceived at its worst and not worth repeating until they decide to place greater focus on their food menu.

Jamie and I were the only ones seated at a table for quite a while. In fact, it was a bit of a challenge to get the attention of the waiter who appeared to be doubling as a second bartender. After studying the extensive cider menu, we let him recommend our libations for us. Jamie ended up getting a $7 bottle of the German-fermented Possman Pure Apple Cider, a sweet, tingly refresher of a drink that was quite perfect for a briskly chilled evening (see photo). I ordered the $5 bottle of Ace Pear Hard Cider, which was more sweeter despite an infusion of apple cider and quite refreshing to boot (see photo). It was a tad too bitter for my taste, but I was encouraged by this start. Upcider indeed.

But Downgrub it was. The chief disaster came in the form of the $6.95 Buffalo Fries, which believe it or not, came out ice-cold with a heavy ladle of blue cheese mixed with chopped carrots and celery and doused with hot sauce (see photo). We had them sent back to the kitchen for repairs only to find the fries still lukewarm on their return visit to our table. Another disappointment was the $10.95 Turkish Flatbread, which bore little resemblance to the roadside pizza I had on the Turquoise Coast of Turkey. Though there were claims of chopped lamb and beef, we barely noticed any on it, just a light tomato paste, a lot of cilantro and chopped peppers (see photo). We were audibly sighing from indifference at this point.

Things picked up with the $8.95 Kale Caesar Salad, and even though kale is far more fibrous than romaine, the switch worked simply because there was ample dressing on every single leaf, and it was tossed generously with parmesan-encrusted croutons (see photo). Jamie's favorite small plate, however, was the $9.95 Garlic Shrimp which came blackened and heavily sauced in a Creole-style cream with toasted baguette slices (see photo). I liked them, too, but the sauce was a bit too overwhelming for my taste. The waiter was pleased we finished our plates and even comped us for the chilly Buffalo Fries, but that wasn't enough for us to change our mind. We may be back but only for the cider and the streetside view.

FOOD - 2 stars...disappointing small plates of food treated as afterthoughts...
CIDER - 4 stars...but the cider's good on its own
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...heavy on the black but quite spacious even as it crowds up
SERVICE - 3 stars...a slow start and multi-tasking too much but ultimately quite nice
TOTAL - 3 stars...a upcider/downgrub combo
author: Ed U.

description: They have the best cider, taste so good. Different brands I never heard of and love. Service was great thanks upcider. https://spreadthebutter.com/video/340
author: Austin M.

description:
Ate here with three other people and we shared, which was great so we got to try a variety. The location and atmosphere is really cool- on the upper level on polk street. If you get there at a good time and get a seat by the window, I'm sure it's amazing people watching.

What we ordered: Turkish Flatbread, Pesto Kale Flatbread, Shrimp Crostini, Buffalo Fries, Sweet Potato Fries

My Favorite: Shrimp crositini. I loved the sauce that it came in, and I love shrimp. The Pesto Kale Flatbread was also really good.

Eh, might have order again: Buffalo fries were too spicy for me, but the guys loved them. The sweet potato fries were also not that flavorful, but had an interesting blueberry sauce with them. Turkish flatbread was a little too meaty for me

Drinks: We got Racer 5's- standard beer.

Overall: I would definitely come here again!
author: Jenna G.

description: The service here is amazing!! I started going here after a friend recommended trying their huge cider selection and although I'm not actually a fan of cider, I couldn't stop coming back after trying their buffalo fries. I'm usually one of the first ones there as I generally head straight there right after work so it didn't take long for the staff there to remember me. I'm always greeted with a smile and asked how I am since the last time I've come. A few of them remember my name and order which I personally love! All my friends I bring out always love it too!!
author: Claudia M.

description: Casual vibe, obviously a large cider selection, and fun cider flight option! I'd happily go back.
author: Nicole L.

description: I recently visited San Francisco and this is one place I would like to go back to. The cider selection was excellent and it was fun trying different ciders. I went there for an early dinner so it was not very busy when I went. Overall the staff was friendly and the food was excellent. I had the creole shrimp which was very flavorful. I also had some of the buffalo fried which I cannot wait to get next time.
author: Alex C.

description:
We came in on a Friday around 7:00. The restaurant/bar was fairly busy. They told us to order at the bar, which we did- drinks and food. After 10 minutes or so we had not received our drinks. They were confused, said we didn't order correctly, etc.
The food comes out as it is ready (since it is more of a bar food or tapas style. 
I ordered the Turkish flatbread and the kale Caesar salad. My hubby ordered a spicy lamb slider, a Cajun chicken slider and the Buffalo fries.
Turkish flatbread says it has beef and pork. I could only see a spiced tomato sauce and no meat. It wasn't bad but nothing amazing. 
Kale Caesar salad was pretty good. Not overly dressed.
My husband said the Cajun chicken slider was very good but the lamb slider was not.
The Buffalo fries are literally French fries soaked in hot sauce with maybe a little blue cheese and carrots and celery diced on top. It is super spicy and needs a thick ranch or blue cheese dressing to make it edible. They don't offer that. I asked for it and got a watery blue cheese sauce.
We got beers (because we aren't fans of ciders) but they had a huge menu for ciders if that is your thing.
author: Mary Kate D.

description:
I'll preface this by saying I'm not a huge cider fan. Too sweet for me. 

That being said - I love this bar (and quoting country music songs, apparently, thanks Toby). 

Really cool vibe. Not dark or dingy like a lot of the Polk establishments in that area. Plenty of room to move, and not too crowded, even on a Saturday night. We got lucky and snagged a table for 5 near the window which worked out great.

If you do like cider you'll love this place - they have an extensive list. I need to take my cider loving roommate here...

And for those who don't particularly like cider, like me, not to fear! They have plenty of other yummy things to drink. I was feeling like a stout, so I went with Old Rasputin from North Coast, definitely a fave of mine so I was quite pleased when I saw it on the menu. Beer menu is also fairly extensive so good choices for everyone!

Finally, the food here is way better than your typical bar snacks. I had a delicious slider and shared a Turkish flatbread, which was essentially cheese-less pizza (sounds weird but it was super tasty) with a friend. There were lots of other tasty sounding options as well. Perfect dinner snacks while enjoying some drinks to start the evening.

I'll definitely be back here (with the Magner's loving roommate) soon :)
author: Krista S.

description:
One of my new favorite places on Polk. They have a great selection of ciders, but they also have beer and wine as well. My friends and I ordered the cajun shrimp and the buffalo fries. OMG the shrimp was too good. One of the owners was our server and he was really nice and gave me his opinion on what cider to order.

I want to give this place 5 stars, but the service was a little on the slow side, especially since the place wasn't full. Nonetheless, I shall return!
author: Vanessa S.

description:
This is definitely the place to go for ciders. They've got pages and pages of ciders from domestic to international. So, take your pick! I also like that it's upstairs (corner of Sutter and Polk), so you get a nice view and can do some people watching. 

The food was okay - got to try their fried calamari and buffalo fries. I didn't think it was overly amazing, but also not bad. My friend got their slider, which looked good and he enjoyed it. Maybe that's the item to get. 

Definitely would come back here. Pretty good service and large enough for groups too! 

(25/100)
author: Cassy H.

description: I really love this place. It has all my favorite things- cider, potato souffle (no but seriously check out the potato souffle- it's SO GOOD). I've never had to wait but it definitely gets busy on the weekends, so watch out!
author: Lai-Nin W.

description: Awesome food and awesome service! I love the food! We have been coming to upcider for a long time, and the food and ciders are amazing. Great news, they also started serving brunch and breakfast. You have to try it
author: Nurgul K.

description:
Cider selection looks good, but it takes 10 minutes for the bartenders to even look at you and then you order a cider and they say "we don't have that one. Choose another". I'm not going to play Go Fish with your bottle list. Print some up to date menus!

Decided not to pay $6-7 for a *slider*. The $11 pint of cider my roommate got was tasty. I won't be going back. Don't go here unless you have money--and patience--to burn.
author: Eric S.

description:
Not one, not two, not three, but a million types of ciders here!  I've never seen such a big selection of pear ciders in my life! Didn't know which one to choose, ended up with the Ace cider ($5), and it was fantastic!  (On the plus side, found out they sell this type of cider at Trader Joes for $2.99!) Our group ordered a bunch of apps, and enjoyed almost every one of them.  We came here on a Saturday evening and it was not crowded at all.  It's a pretty cool view as you are on the 2nd floor and the windows peer out to the streets.  

Delicious items to try:
-Sweet potato fries with blueberry ketchup (blueberry ketchup was soooo good!!)
-Pork slider (a little on the expensive side, but quite tasty, I think it was $6-7 for one)
-Mushroom and gruyere flatbread (great to share)
-Garlic fries - Just the typical stuff but good to munch on 

Bleh items:
-I can't remember the name of it, but it was a lamb flatbread.  This one was spicy and messy.  I didn't really enjoy the taste of the meat either.  It looked like a sloppy joe flatbread so that was already a turn off.
-Calamari - This could have used more flavor and the sauce it came with didn't really complement it well.
-Fried zucchini cakes? - Just didnt wow me too much either.  

All of us bought one drink, and the total came out to be pretty much $50/person.  Not bad for the amount of food we were able to taste and the cute environment.  I would probably come back here to try their other ciders in the future.  The alcohol was very reasonably priced and the food wasn't too bad either.
author: Julie L.

description: Best bread pudding ever. Good selection of cider beer and wine. One of the best places on Polk for sure. I love Upcider and the people that work there.
author: Dennis Uluç' T.

description:
My friends and I came to Upcider for late night drinks and food. Upcider is located upstairs and you order food and drinks from the bar. The drink menu contains a variety of cider beers along with wines and other beers. The service is good and the staff are very nice. 

We ordered the must haves.... Fried zucchini cakes, calamari, sweet potato fries with house made blueberry ketchup and the Mac n cheese. Oh yes, you can't forget dessert delicious bread pudding with a light mint cream. 

The sweet potato fries were delicious. I don't know how I really feel about the blueberry house made ketchup, it wasn't bad but definitely not mind blowing. We ordered extra aioli which was yummmmm. The Mac n cheese was so good. It was buttery and the crumbs made a great Mac n cheese. I will definitely be coming back.
author: Annie V.

description:
Yum.

Simple menu, lots of craft beers and ciders. Tons of seating. Can easily accommodate parties of 6+.

The chicken slider was bomb, the salmon one was okay. The buffalo fries are ultra spicy and delcious.

Would recommend, and would return.
author: Peter T.

description: This place is great!  It's rather spacious, and the cider that I tried, pear, was wonderful.  The pizza and fries are great too.  Hope to try again.
author: a f.

description:
Excellent list of cider. Great customer service. 

The food was underwhelming. That is an understatement. 

Cheers!
author: Lee S.

description:
What an SF treasure. Finally a bar that takes hard cider as seriously as it takes beer. Not being a beer drinker, I hate going to a bar to see that they only sell one type of hard cider, and mostly as an afterthought. For people like me, the Upcider is a revelation.

They have Hard Ciders from around the world, and most of them are under $10. Every time I go I try out something different, and really recommend the Irish and English ciders, which are very smooth and crisp. You could go to the bar all year and always be able to try something different.

The food is great too. It's gastro-pub style, with a lot of great slider options (the peppered salmon is my favorite), and some other really savory dishes. I've had the creole shrimp a couple of times, and the buffalo fries are good too. 

Throw in nice decor, and the fact that the bar is on the second floor means great views of Polk Street. Being at this place means you're going to have a good time, and drinks that you can't get anywhere else in SF.
author: Marcel M.

description: Super cute place located on the second floor. They have large tables for groups and seating all around the edges by the windows looking out to the street. They have a huge list of different ciders, beers, and wines. Most come in a bottle so they give you a mini mason jar or goblet to drink out of.  They also have food and bar snacks.  We tried the sweet potato fries with BLUEBERRY KETCHUP!! Whaaat!! Yes it was delicious.  We also got a ginger beer and pumpkin cider, yum! Great place for a date night.
author: Linz C.

description: I'm a huge fan of cider and this place had like 4 pages of ciders from all over the US and the world! We really enjoyed trying different ciders from different places. We ordered the buffalo fries which were spicy but good. We also ordered lamb and salmon sliders which were delicious. I would have given them 5 stars but we had to go up to the bar to order food and drinks.
author: Martha Z.

description: Good place to chit chat with friends, music too loud a little bit. Not too crowded on Friday Night. While some other bars nearby are packed. That's just perfect for us. We come around 12:30 am, only drinks to be served, no more food!  You'll have lots of choices to drink.
author: Jeff S.

description:
5 stars easily. This is such a fun place to start off your night on Polk! I was extremely happy with everything I ordered, you need to try all of the following things: 

The peppered salmon slider: THE BEST slider I've ever had! So flavorful and the fish was crunchy and soft and all sorts of perfect. Tried the lamb one too and though it was really delicious, it had nothing on the salmon one! 

Dry joker (cider): If you're not into super sweet drinks, this is a good choice! It's still cider so it was still sweet, but it wasn't too much so that was good. There was also a ginger cider that my friend got but it had kind of a weird aftertaste so I'm really glad I went with this one.

Raspberry kombucha beer: This was amazing! Sweeter than the cider, but it was really unique tasting- kind of a mix between moscato and beer. I finally understood what hops are from this drink! Also, it's pink so you can't really go wrong. 

Got some caramel bread pudding to end dinner. For all my Indian foodies, this tasted like caramel gulab jamun! it was super sweet so I couldn't have more than a couple bits but it was delicious. It was pretty big too so it could easily be shared between 4 people.
author: Aradhana V.

description: Sweet spot! Lots of ciders on the menu, including pumpkin - yay! They have cider flights too. Pretty average prices $7-8 a glass of cider. The food looked good but we didn't get anything. For 11pm on a Friday it wasn't too busy which was nice.
author: Kelly G.

description:
This is a challenging review for me to write.  Why? Because I am not a big cider fan.

Cider for me was what kids growing up drank when they didn't like beer.  It wasn't quite on par with teenage girls drinking wine coolers but for me, they were in the same ballpark.  Visiting places like the UK have edified me otherwise but I am far from a connoisseur of cider, I just acknowledge that it's something beyond a beer alternative.  So if you like cider, this is your mecca.  I didn't know there were this may ciders available for consumption in the US, much less anywhere. So yeah, cider, have at it.

My review is based on the food which is primarily why I was there (and that my friend selected the place).  We had the creole shrimp which tasted amazing, incredibly savory blend of hearty spices.  It tasted very much like my favorite dish from Town Hall, the barbecue gulf shrimp, similar in both flavor and complexity.  I basically ate the sauce with a spoon.  No, seriously, I asked for a spoon.  

Also had the mushroom medley which was mushrooms heaped on top of thin toast and dripping with warm gorgonzola.  It was incredible as well, decadent blend of flavors. 

My only regret was that the portions weren't huge to share and I was still hungry when I left. But definitely recommend you try this place!
author: Saminda W.

description:
Love Love Love this place! It doesn't feel that I am in a restaurant, feels like I am visiting my friends, everyone is so welcoming and friendly, easy relaxing ambience. Busy but not overwelming. 

My favorite dishes to order is Turkish Flatbread, it  is very delicious, thin crispy crust, lamb slightly spicy, perfect with perfectly dressed arugula salad. Mushroom flatbread is delicious as well. 
Bread pudding served with mint cream is a great ending to your meal, yumm.
Huge selection of ciders, even though I am not big fan of ciders, but they have delicious selections of wines.
author: Natasha S.

description: We LOVE this place. The owner and 1/2 the staff are Turkish and very friendly and warm. The food and cider is DELICIOUS TOO - no joke!! Sliders are epic. Great calamari. Perfect flatbread. Cider is refreshing :)
author: C. L.

description:
This place is tasty, unique, and fun!  

I love ciders, so my boyfriend, knowing this, found this place so we could try out a bunch of different ones.  I definitely got a lesson in ciders, as there were so many, and we were able to try a whole bunch.  There were 4 of us, so I had the opportunity to sample tons of ciders.  There were typical sweet, crispy ones, and ones that tasted more like champagne or wine, others that were super dry, and still others that were just..."interesting."  I think I still like the sweet, crisp ones the best, but I'm glad I got to try all the other varieties.  If you're into ciders and want to sample what the apple has to offer, I'd definitely recommend this place.

In addition, we got some food, which was all quite tasty.  Tried two sliders - a cajun chicken one and the salmon one - both were pretty good.  Also tried the spinach gruyere flatbread, which I also enjoyed.  The sweet potato fries come with this interesting blueberry ketchup.  It was alright.  

Also, the place wasn't super crowded on a Saturday night, and there were plenty tables for us to sit comfortably and chat.  It's not like a typical SF bar on a Saturday night where you can barely hear each other and have to weave your way through a crowd.  This place is full, but not crowded, which lends to a much more enjoyable experience.

I should caution, however, that if you decide to spend your entire night here sampling ciders, it will get expensive very quickly.  The cheapest ciders are around $5.  And then there are ciders that are about the size of wine bottles for several times that.  I don't think they had anything on tap, so you're getting a bottle each time you order a new cider.  So yeah, watch your wallet.  Or at least come with a bigger group so you can try each other's drinks without having to order a ton of different ones yourself.
author: Vivian C.

description:
I think this venue is great. It's upstairs on the 2nd floor, large floor to ceiling windows, christmas lights lit up the room, but the cider was disappointing and the food items weren't that great. 

I did enjoy the lamb burger, but our sweet potato fries with blueberry sauce dipping was odd. The cider choices weren't that great. Nothing was on draft, everything bottled. We saw a snakebite on the menu, so we decided to get that thinking it was guiness and cider mixed together which is DELICIOUS...turned out to be a bottle that mixed an amber ale with cider. It was not very good. 

I ultimately just don't like their menu choices, and why does a cider place not have things on draft? At least have samplers! They don't have that either!
author: Joanna S.

description:
One of my favorite/local spot in the city. Spacious (huge place and great view of Polk) and isn't super crowded so you can sit&chat and enjoy your ciders.
While the grand list of cider drinks offered (3 pages of cider menu :) ) , I like to try ciders on tap which I strongly recommend. Staff is friendly and helpful if you have any questions about ciders. 
Favorite food : All their sliders, potato pesto flat bread, kale salad, mushroom flat bread, sweet potato fries with with blueberry ketchup.

I would definitely come back Upcider again to chill.
ps. Cute/quiet enough/hip music makes there great place for a date night ;)
author: Ihsan C.

description: great place to stop by. Lots of drinks to choose and Great view on Polk St from second floor
author: Pang W.

description:
The greatest cider selection I've seen this side of the Pacific Ocean. The portions are a bit small, but that's okay since it allows you to drink more cider.

Very chill atmosphere and vibe.

I recommend sitting at the bar by the window as it's a fantastic people watching opportunity.
author: Ryuta O.

description:
I went to this cider bar with excitement and high hopes of being able to select from variety of ciders. I was SUPER happy to see such an extensive list of ciders, including tasting notes of each, and origin of each; a concept not new to Seattle or Portland, so Im stoked SF is catching on.

We ordered the salmon slider which was smothered (to a fault) in pesto and a mayo thing and eggplant slider, both on a cabbage roll (versus bread, as I am gluten-free). We also did the sweet potato fries w/ blueberry ketchup which was good. For 2 small ciders + 2 small roles and 1 order of fries, our bill was $45 + tip. I know SF is pricey, but the food prices here felt really high for what we got.

I would go back, but for drinks only.
author: Vanessa C.

description:
We came here on a Friday night so it was packed. Waited a while for a table since we came with a group. Our party ended up being separated because they couldn't accommodate all of us at one table :( this is one of those places where you order food at the bar and they deliver to your table. We waited a whopping ONE HOUR for our food to arrive... And everything came very slowly. Probably waited a total of an hour and a half to receive everything we ordered. I understand, they were busy on a Friday night, but the wait for the food was ridiculous and no one came to check on us or update us on how much longer it would take to arrive.

On the plus side, the food was delicious. We ordered the lamb slider - so good!! Eggplant slider - yummy veggie option that was so satisfying. Did not miss the meat! Also ordered the Turkish flatbread, sweet potato fries with blueberry ketchup (please pass me the good ol' Heinz tomato ketchup!), and mashed potato soufflé (not really a soufflé, just mashed potatoes with bubbly melted cheese on top - still tasty but not what I was expecting). The cider was really good too - tried blood orange cider and huckleberry cider.

I'll come back here on a not so busy day and give them another chance.
author: Krizia M.

description: Excellent menemen and flat breads. The service was also very friendly.  The combination of a cider bar (rare enough in itself - I was told there may be only two others in the U.S.) and Turkish food is wonderfully peculiar and delicious. Have saved this place on my maps so that I'll be sure to come back whenever I'm in town.
author: Don I.

description:
Very large selection of ciders. Nothing on tap, just bottles. Limited beer and wine selection. 

I had a Crispin and "Graviva." The second one was more interesting by far. I wish the bartenders were a bit more knowledgable about the offerings. 

The spinach flatbread was delicious but the food here is WAY OVERPRICED. Lots of cheaper bites in the area. 

Nice second floor space with big windows for people watching. 

Perfectly fine if you're in the area and want to meet up with a friend for a drink but nothing too special.
author: Semuteh F.

description:
I really liked this place. Big fan on bars on second level buildings.

The ambiance is cool and I like how everything is seat yourself. A cider bar is cool. I tried three ciders, all great and they might be a bit pricey but I think it's worth it. I mean where else is there a strictly cider bar? Props.

While I'm still giving this 4 stars, the food wasn't great ... At least what I tried. We had the kale flatbread and it was pretty bland...my bad though, I order kale.

The zucchini bites were just ok. I had some serious food envy for the girl next to me eating a slider. Next time.
author: Sarah S.

description: Great little gem on the second floor.  Stopped on recommendation from son.  Way to many choices of cider with excellent service.  Even a few nice wines for us winers
author: Robert B.

description:
Moving from the Midwest out West could be summed up in one glorious word "ciders!!"

Chicago had it's fair game but there seems to be an explosion of new cideries opening up on the West Coast and PNW. This is definitely a great place to come and try some unique ciders. They do have an extensive menu, but you will pay a premium for some of these ciders too.

I actually came here on Halloween, and, amazingly, there was no line during the prime hours to get in. More of a sit-down place than a club, the interior had a really cool vibe. 

Their list was extensive and they definitely had a great variety, but most of the drinks seemed overpriced. That's my main beef. Must be to pay rent in a location that prime.
author: Carol M.

description: Cider was great.  Good place to go for a social gathering.  Great location on Polk.  Came here for dinner and didn't enjoy the food for a meal rather thought it would be good for a drunk snack.  Had the sliders, flat breads, and fries.  However, if you're a cider fan, go here!
author: Kevin N.

description:
Upcider has a nice, classy feel and the prices aren't too harsh. My friends and I made our way over on a rainy SF evening, I took the 3 from Post at Kearny which drops you right across the street, so not a bad commute if you don't want to look for parking. Right on Polk next to Vertigo, and huge windows framed with twinkly lights.

I thought the place was closed because it's in an upstairs locale, but I found my way into the clean, modern restaurant. I arrived early and ordered the Julian Black and Blue cider, per the server's recommendation. It was tart, sweet, lightly bubbly, served in a redwine glass, would abso-fruitly get again. When my friends arrived we ordered a few appetizers to go with our cider. 

Buffalo Fries: spicy! I love spicy food, so that was great for me, and my girls liked the heat, too. They are drizzled with blue cheese dressing and chopped carrots and celery so you get a nice little crunch. They cool off fast, so eat up, Buttercups! My favorite dish we got, and to think I wanted regular old garlic fries!

Bacon Mac n' Cheese: hot, cheesy, salty, with baked breadcrumbs on top. Too many green onions for my taste, but still good.

Creole Shrimp: nothing to really write home about, I probably would skip this next time and get a flatbread. It was just over cooked shrimp in a thick, creamy red sauce. But you can't win 'em all, kids.

I got the Aspall English Demi-Sec as my final cider which was sweeter and less tart, very good, both of my friends liked it better than their ciders. Overall, I would definitely go back, it's a good spot for chatting with your friends about your old boyfriend or how much you hate your co-worker, or whatever, because it's not too loud or quiet, also good for a date if you're into that kind of thing. Enjoy!
author: Crystal C.

description: Upcider is perfect for locals. It's not trendy enough to be touristy, but on a Sunday evening there was a good vibe and there were still tables open for groups small and large. That meant I could have a conversation in my party of 6 without struggling to be heard. Add to this 4 pages of ciders and another page for beer or wine snobs. Thumbs up.
author: Christina J.

description: Great cider selection and good service. If you like cider at all you will love this place. 16 ciders on tap and seemingly hundreds in bottles and cans.
author: Mark V.

description:
Went to this place to catch up with a friend that I had not seen in a while.

The space itself is very minimal in design--almost like a basement room at a frat house. On this particular night, it was pretty cozy and there was a good amount of people as well.

I enjoyed perusing the GIANT cider menu and liked the concept of the place but wish that they offered some more substantial dinner plates. I did enjoy my kale caesar salad, but would have loved to get something a bit more filling to enjoy with my cider.

Overall, this place has a good concept and I think they are on their way, but they need to offer several viable options for dinner to really make this place a dinner destination and not just a place to get drunk bar grub.
author: Ryan R.

description: Best cider bar in the city. Staffs are friendly. The mustache guy is very handsome and funny. Their lamb slider and french fries are the best.
author: Alican B.

description:
good service. excellent cider. decent prices. horrible calamari. i dont know how they even consider that calamari. it was grey and completely undercooked.. we complained and it was almost like they were waiting for our complaint. they comped the calamari with no problem. 
The turkish flatbread tasted like it came out of and easy bake oven.. gross. The zucchini cakes however were delicious. if i return it will be for zucchini cakes and a cider.
author: Mallory V.

description:
I love this place. I came here with my friends to celebrate me passing the boards. We each tried to order a different drink so we can sample different ciders. The place was small and cozy, music was a bit loud, clean, and accessible (easy to get to by bus). 

I recommend the: 

Alcohol: 
Pinot Grigo (medium sweet cider)
Pomegranate Cider (If you like really sweet drinks)
Pear Cider (both wine cooler and beer are deliciously sweet) 
Pineapple Cider (too sweet w/ strong overwhelming pineapple flavor) 

Food:
Shredded pork flat bread (DELICIOUS: delicate balance of bbq and pork)
Sweet potato fries (w/ blueberry sauce. YUM!!!!!!!!!!!!!!) 

Not recommended:
1) Mushroom flat bread (bland)
2) Mushroom on sour dough (bland) 
2) Buffalo fries (basically buffalo wing sauce slightly on the fries w/ vegetables on top)
4) Zucchini cakes (battered zucchini w/ ranch sauce.... it's boring)
5) Garlic fries (very weak garlic fries. I like garlic fries that have strong intense garlic taste that punches you in the stomach)
author: Lily K.

description:
This was a quick stop on my way out of town, but a good one. The cider list is fantastic and the staff seem very knowledgeable about making reasonable recommendations and discussing flavor profiles. 

The food was decent, nothing crazy... but maybe I just wasn't adventorous enough knowing I was getting on a red-eye flight shortly thereafter. We did have what appeared to be the most adventorous flatbread (Turkish) - which was good - but it wasn't nearly as flavorfull as expected. 

The housemade blueberry ketchup, served with the sweet potato fries was nice. It did, however, taste how it sounds... and not in a bad way.

This is a good spot. Maybe if I was a cider lover I would learn more towards the four stars versus three.
author: John F.

description:
They have a great selection of ciders, but they're all in bottles? I was really hoping to get something on tap, but if you want to try anything cool or unique you end up having to pay $30+ for an entire bottle of something you might hate. 

The ambiance is cool so I'll give them that.. I'll have to try the food at some point. I read an article recently that said they have one of the best kale salads in the city!
author: Siobhan F.

description:
I'm not even a fan of beer, or hard cider. 

But I am a HUGE wallet-breaking fan of gastropubs and the food that entails inside, so when my friend suggested this place, I said I'd be down.

This place is on the second floor of a slightly dark and damp looking building, but upon entry upstairs, it's cozily lit with candles, large windows, and adorable little succulents right next to the window :D who can say no to succulents?!

Please note - the menu for hard ciders here is ridiculously long. It's organized by country of origin, and yes, they carry hard cider from almost anywhere. I think on the four page list stuck on the clipboard, I saw France, Germany, New Zealand, the list goes on..
Unless you're a hard cider tank and you are willing to spend anywhere from $7 - $30 each time for a new glass of hard cider, I'd recommend getting the flight that's written on the chalkboard. $15 for 5 small glasses of hard cider they're currently featuring? I consider that a pretty sweet deal. My friend got it and even though she didn't like one or two of them hard ciders so much as the others, she did think it was worth it. I personally got the black berry currant cider which tasted more like girly wine, more to my liking.

Their food was pretty good, but don't expect cheap gastropub food. While I'd say the food was done well, UpCider as a whole has you feeling slightly ripped off at the end of a long workday.  Also, I'm not really a fan of how you have to go up to the bar to order, than walk around looking for the water serving station(IT'S SO DARK IN THERE, HOW COULD I HAVE FOUND IT?!) and then you see the employees frantically and hopelessly swim in the room of people looking for the appropriate person to give their plate to.

4/5 for their ciders, but minus 1 star for their prices.
author: Zoe H.

description: What a wonderful spot for people who like cider! My husband is not a fan of beer so this is a great spot for him to enjoy a drink but they also have a great beer menu for people who don't want cider. They have some good food options on top of their huge variety of drinks!
author: Jena H.

description:
If you like cider and bar food - Upcider is the place for you.

Be prepared to be overwhelmed by the wide selection of ciders (organized by geography). You'll likely be confused by all the choices but it is fun to talk to the servers about what they think of the options. The servers are very friendly and helpful - highly recommend talking to them! 

The standouts were: 
- the pulled pork slider with peach bbq sauce (we inhaled this one)
- the mushroom slider with caramelized onions
- the Angry Orchard ginger apple cider
- the sweet potato fries with blueberry ketchup (sounds weird but totally delicious)

The Turkish flatbread was good, but not as amazing as the stuff we had above. Next time I come here, I will just order more sliders instead of the flatbread. I also ordered the North American black currant cider bc I like the taste of black currant candy - but it ended up tasting like a strange combo of wine and apple juice. 

Service was excellent - the cider and food came out quickly and the signout process was very fast with the iPad. Interesting that they have a frequent diner program (for every 10 visits you get 10% off!). 

The restau is in a large open space with big windows - would be great for groups or just a casual date.
author: Amelia C.

description:
This is SO CUTE! It's right next to Vertigo, but upstairs.  The space is huge - plenty of room to sit and you can people watch out the windows.

Their selection of ciders is massive.  Like, almost overwhelming.  I don't know anything about cider and the servers were great at helping me find one I loved.  The service was fast and attentive.  Also, they have a pretty good selection of food, including vegetarian options.  We ordered the buffalo fries - you want to eat these fast because the sauce will make them soggy.  We also ordered the spinach flatbread - super good, and the mac & cheese, which is like the best thing ever when you're out having drinks.  

I would definitely come back here to chill - it's cute for a date and for groups.
author: Sumeena B.

description: If you don't get enough crap service in the Mission come here. Plenty of ignoring, sarcastic eye-rolling, and smug assholeness. They can come to your table to collect the bill but not take your order. Skip it.
author: T T.

description:
They have an overwhelming list of ciders and a surprisingly good list of wines. Fun menu item: Sweet potato fries with Blueberry Ketchup!

I like this place for a quick happy hour on a weekday, but would skip this place on a Saturday. It isn't exactly a venue for a party-starter. The place nextdoor has good music bumping though.
author: Val K.

description: Food was awesome. Had a pulled pork slider, the potatoe  souffle (a must have), meatballs with tomatoe gravy, and the beet salad with peppered salmon. Would order them all again. Good bar menu, plenty of beers to go along with the Ciders.  Would recommend it all. Bar staff is helpful and ready to serve.  Highly recommend if you don't mind the plethora of hipsters.
author: Jeff B.

description:
I like cider. I think it's great that there's a cider bar now. Even better that it's on a street that has plenty of bars but not very many good ones. Even better, it's somehow emptier than the pit of despair of mcteagues so you can actually hang out with your friends without feeling like a sardine squeezed between the olive oil and aluminum of the bros around you. Or that oil is just their hair gel. Hard to say.

Go for the dry ciders.
author: Misha T.

description: Best food, atmosphere, ciders and friendly environment. I miss their lamb slides and Turkish flat bread the most...owners are super friendly...a must visit in SF.
author: Bugra B.

description:
They carry STELLA ARTOIS CIDRE!!!!!

Crisp, refreshing, slightly on the drier side but with a good balance of sweetness

Overall Thoughts

Yeah for Upcider!
author: Eddie W.

description:
Great cider selection and great food.  Loved the sweet potato fries with blueberry ketchup and the sliders were good, too!

A great place to catch up with friends and unwind!
author: Kathryn C.

description:
THREE PAGES of ciders on their menu! THREE PAGES!!! It's relatively small font too... they must have scores of ciders.  There is also a selection of mead, wine and beer, too.   On my first event, I arrived expecting on-tap ciders. There are none -- everything is bottled or canned.  But my disappointment on this point quickly faded once I saw how many ciders they had to choose from. 

They provide an option on week nights to taste a flight of four ciders, so I gave that a try.   Of the four ciders in the flight, I hated one (Trabanco Sidra Natural), really liked two, and the fourth was the best cider I've ever had (Clos Normand Brut).   The staff were very friendly and knowledgeable about their ciders.

(Note: I have not tried the food there, so this review is only about their cider selection and their staff).
author: Heidi M.

description:
There's a bar that specializes in ciders? Cider is one of the few beverages I can handle on a semi-regular basis. I had to go here.

After a few foiled attempts, my friend and I finally were able to stop here. Unfortunately, there is no happy hour menu. The list of ciders is endless. I ended up going with a raspberry cider since I didn't want to shell out more than the usual $5. They're all bottled from what I've read and the prices range from $5 up to at least $30+. They also have a smaller menu of beers and wines as well as some food.

They happily made my sliders without the bun since I'm watching my blood sugar. I'm glad they could amend their items like that. We also split a flatbread which ended up more like a pizza and a kale caesar salad.

The food is decent. The service was AOK. I will be back though because they carry cider - many bars don't. It's about a mile walk from Powell Street BART.
author: Amy J.

description: Stopped for a bite on our way to the WEEN show at the memorial, Share the potato soufflé or Mac n cheese portions are not huge but these dishes are super rich.
author: Michael P.

description:
Yay!  Finally a cider bar!  I know not a lot of people are big on cider, but you just gotta give them a chance!  They have an extensive menu of cider from all over the world.  I tried a Scottish cider once that I pretty much blew me away.  Tried to look for it at Bevmo and found no luck.  

It's a great place to hang out, get some grub, and call it a chill night.  It's not too loud, so you can actually carry a decent conversation.    Plus, the service is great and I totally dig the crowd.  

Only one downfall that makes this place a 4 star rather than a 5 star: I believe most of their cider are bottled, not on tap.  The also ran out of pumpkin cider when we went during Thanksgiving! :(  But it's ok, I'm just ecstatic there's a cider bar in town!
author: Cecilia S.

description:
So many ciders, so many choices, and so many decisions to make here! As a cider-fiend, I reveled during my only visit here, but it was so easy with the assistance of the knowledgeable waiters. I likely had the Blackberry Pear Cider from Fox Barrel. I love pear cider and blackberries, so why not mix the two?

Now, I did not come here for food, so my review only reflects the cider. But, if you come to Upcider, it should be a given that you order at least one serving of cider. If not, it would be the equivalent of going to the Omelette House just for fried chicken. It's a no-no! Ciders are their specialty, obviously.

Take note also that it's full title is *UP*-cider, where you walk up the stairs to the second floor. Get a window seat to get a fantastic view of the town with your friends for the night as the city lights up!
author: Garett T.

description:
Yay ciders!! Literally half their menu is cider and the other half is beer. They also serve food but my friends and I only came for drinks. 

I tried a semi-dry English pear cider that our cute Eastern European server recommended. I initially ordered another pear cider, but she said that if it was my first few timings drinking cider then I should choose another one. She also recommended ciders to my friends and her suggestions were all on point. We really enjoyed it as we reminisced about high school.

Upcider is a great place to drink casually and lounge around with friends without having to go to a noisy, crowded bar.
author: Jessica C.

description:
This place is one of my favorites on Polk Street, because of the ambiance, the food, the wide selection of ciders from around the world which does its name justice, and the fact that it wasn't difficult to get a table (at least the couple times that I've been here) for a party of 4-6.

The servers are attentive and will help you select a cider based on your taste preferences, which is much like how you would select a wine--dry versus sweet. The food portions are just right and enough to share with a table of friends (I recommend the mac & cheese if it's available on the special menu or the Cajun shrimp from the regular menu).

I always appreciate a place that doesn't try too hard. Upcider's ambiance is relaxed enough to have a drink with a few friends and catch up, but also intimate enough to bring a date and converse while sitting by the large windows and people-watching the Polk Street bar crawl crowd.

The reason this isn't a five star rating is that the food overall is a little underwhelming. Though the mac & cheese and Cajun shrimp are delicious, the flatbreads and the sliders fall short. But that doesn't take away from the fact that this is one of my go-to places on Polk.
author: Ryan M.

description:
I'm not a big fan of beer, but if I do drink it I tend to like sweeter ones like Früli. So the idea of having 3 pages of hard ciders from around the world to choose from was a winner for me. Plus this was located just a few blocks from where I live.

It's on the corner of Sutter and Polk, you'll see the sign to go upstairs. It's bigger inside than I thought. Nice big windows that overlook the busy life of Polk street. We arived around 6:30. I'm not sure if all the tables were reserved but it was pretty empty. We did make reservations for that time just in case. You could also sit at the bar and a bar table by the windows. By the time we left the place was super packed.

I had seen that some Yelpers had cider flights and was excited to try several to taste. Unfortunately they don't have flights! I had done some research on best ciders so I started out with Tieton Cherry.. which was very good, sweet and perfect for my taste. My partner had the Ace blackberry which was ok. We also ordered the Turkish flatbread which was yum and perfect together with the ciders. Also ordered the mac n cheese with bacon (good), grilled portobello slider (super yum), peppered salmon slider (again, super yum), and the meatballs (good). Oh and bread pudding for dessert (yummay). We ordered a couple of other ciders: since I liked the Tieton, ordered the spicy pumpkin from them.. it is autumn! And Crispin The Saint. Both were good. 

Our tab was $100 so yes can get pricey. I thought the food was really good. Service was impeccable.. so fast, efficient, and thoughtful. We really enjoyed our experience, and plan to return very soon.
author: Vol T.

description:
Amazing selections of ciders, and since I don't really know my cider preferences the staff was able to make me a flight to try the different types. They made really great recommendations once they knew what I liked. A great place to stop before you head out to Polk Street craziness. I loved the Julian Cherry Bomb for a sweeter option after dinner.

The food was pretty darn good. The salmon sliders were the favorite. Dug the kale salad but it was crazy big!

Good music playing, friendly staff, pay your check on the ipad.
author: Nikki M.

description:
Get ready for a CIDER menu! But don't worry, wine and beer on the menu, too :)

The food list is short, but good items for a decent price. The only thing I didnt like was the cajun shrimp. Seemed a bit "burnt" flavored to me, but I think that is how the dish is supposed to be, I just wasnt a fan.

Everyone was nice and knowledgeable on the ciders. Good place to go, sit by the window and people watch Polk Street.
author: Tosca B.

description:
A bar with a city view, in San Francisco. 
It is my go to location for my visiting friends.
Polk street is the longest, most vivid street , just like Fillmore. You'll always feel comfortable 
on Polk street though.
author: Kursat U.

description:
A place that doesn't sell just angry orchards as their primary cider. Thank goodness. 

The menu is through and long with lots of flavor sweetness and dryness profile. They do sell many 22 to 25 oz bottles, which are perfect to share with other people. 

The group I was with just wanted something quick and simple. We ordered their selection of fries. Sweet potato with blueberry ketchup, garlic fries, and buffalo fries. The sweet potato fries were awesome and the blueberry was evident. The garlic fries were very garlicky you could smell them the moment they were placed on the table.

The buffalo fries were too spicy. We all tried them and then we didn't eat the rest of them because all of our lips were burning and we couldn't taste out cider.

This place doesn't have many gluten free menu options, which is interesting for a place that focuses on gluten free drinks. It was disappointing to me. I would not go back to eat, but I would definitely go back to eat!
author: Nicole V.

description:
I went here the other night and I'll definitely be back. 

No beers on tap - only ciders. But they give you generous, giant pours in mason jars and you'll definitely get drunk. Ended up getting four different ciders. The ones that I can remember (which means they're good) are the white wine cider (can't remember its name) and the spicy jalapeno cider. The spice didn't overwhelm the cider but was definitely very much so present. 

We were there mostly for drinks but decided to also try a flatbread (spinach) and it was perfect. The crust is nice and thin and it wasn't overwhelmingly cheesy. Perfect as a drunken munchie to share, but probably substantial enough if it's going to be a meal.
author: Sylvia L.

description:
I like the concept. Neighborhood is not the best, but there is a good amount of different cider/cidre, and the snack food pairs pretty well for a reasonable price. 

The atmosphere is fun and warm.
author: Lionel F.

description:
Really great selection of cider!!! :D This is my kinda place.
Their sweet potato fries with BLUEBERRY ketchup is addicting.
A really chill place to hang out with friends and you can walk over to any of the bars/clubs/lounges around the area for some more fun into the AMs!
author: Angela D.

description: Incredible selection. Even as someone who's not a big cider fan, I found multiple options that I legitimately enjoyed. It must be heaven for cider geeks. The staff are very helpful and friendly. I can't speak more highly of the place as a whole. Also, I would like to recommend the weekend brunch, which involves "flatbread benedicts" and "cidermosas."
author: Grace M.

description: Very large choice of ciders, of course! Nice interior and food. It's all self service, you have to order at the bar and then they'll bring the food to you. The portions are not that big, but small bites. Food is very tasteful
author: Nienke S.

description: This was such a great find to grab a bite and drink before a concert. The mushroom pizza was delicious as were the sliders.
author: Ciara L.

description:
I love the cider array and the staff is knowledgable about the variety of flavors and types. I would buy cider by the bottle, not by the flight, and then just share amongst friends so you can try many. The ones from the flight seemed to blur together a bit. 

The salads and flatbreads are good- nothing amazing. 

It's a fun spot for a saturday night or a great place to take your gluten-free friends, but otherwise not on the top of my list.
author: Vinitha R.

description: I have been here many times, finally decided to leave feedback. I keep getting impressed with the food. My favorites are the lamb slider and the Cajun chicken slider. Many options of siders, there is one that will work for everyone, I love the ambience here and the staff is very friendly and nice.
author: serkan e.

description:
Best Mac & Cheese ever! Excellent selection of cider. All the other food looked and smelled amazing. The only reason they don't get five stars, is that my wife ordered one of their salads and was bummed that there were only two pecans. 

My wife and I really liked that they were open so late too. We had gone roller skating with friends and wanted a place that would be open when we were ready. 

Did I mention the Mac & Cheese? By the way, it had bacon on it too! 

It's also really nice to order and pay at the bar. They give you a number and bring your food out. Given that it can get pretty busy, it's a great way to relax and then leave when you want, without having to track down the check. 

Just in case you missed it, try the Mac & Cheese.
author: Andy T.

description: Super cute lounge/bar/restaurant to hang out and enjoy some delicious cider of your choosing from your second story view of Polk street. I personally LOVE hard cider over really all other alcohol, so maybe I'm biased. But if you love cider too this is the place for you! Cider is their specialization and upon entering they'll hand you a menu with a list of hundreds of different a ciders from around not only different states, but different countries too, to choose from! Prices range from $6 a bottle to $70 or so, from what I saw. Just depends how much of a connoisseur you are personally. They also serve flatbreads, sliders, garlic fries and other small foods of that nature. Probably not the place to go if you're insanely hungry, although my boyfriend and I went there in a very hungry state and found enough to eat at a relatively decent total price. Definitely a fun place to check out! They have a dessert called the Tipsy Apple that looked pretty incredible that I'll definitely be trying next time!
author: Tamara S.

description: Excellent service at the bar, especially from the Turkish bartender, who provided thoughtful cider suggestions. Great place for a chill night!
author: Madeline P.

description:
Great service, lots of open seating, good mix of crowd. Hundreds of cider to choose from. If you are a cider fan- stop by and you will not get dissapointed.
Clean bathrooms, friendly servers that will give you suggestions. They have beer and wine as well so for those who are cider enthusiasts like me, they still have something for you.
Tried the sweet potatoe fries with Blueberry plum sauce. A fan of the SWP fries but not the sauce, ketchup would suffice.
This new gastropub is on the second floor, no cover.
Will definitely stop by again to try their food.
author: Claudine V.

description: Great flatbreads- try the Kale Parmesan or Spinach. South City Cider is a good one but the selection is huge. Even have some good CA beers if your not in the mood for cider.
author: Charity B.

description:
Went here via a deal online.  Very extensive list of cider!!  Tried Spanish, French, English, and American ciders and Zucchini patties.  Delicious!  

Interior was really nice.  Had a warehouse feel to it.  Service was slow though.  Bc we didn't stay for long and didn't order much else, can't give it any higher of a score coupled with the slow (though kind!) service.  Felt that they disregarded us bc we bought our deal online.  Would be happy to update the review if I try this place again and have a better experience.
author: Ghizal A.

description:
First time coming to San Francisco as newlyweds...and we decide to stop here since they have an array of ciders.

First off the service was extremely rude, I couldn't imagine my husband and I coming off as rude (since we are in honeymoon land) the girl could have even said hello it was just "what can I get you" 
The same with the guys working! Don't ask "how can I help you" then walk away. 
I'm from San Diego, I expect people to act like snobs...but at a little bar?! Get out of here!! 

The only thing I can say positive: the food is pretty decent. The potato soufflés was amazing. The fries are as well (how can you mess up fries though)
The calamari was not so good. A little too much!

All in all I wouldn't return if I was in San Fran
author: Genifer A.

description: Great cider. Great vibez. Great people. Great prices. And gay friendly!!! I love this place.
author: Debbie M.

description:
A place for just coders, Awww yeah.

It's super casual here, just people coming here with friends to have a few drinks and laughs.

The drink list is extensive, pages upon pages of cider divided based on region of production. So either look up a couple worth trying, or just ask for some recommendations based on flavors you prefer. It's a great place to just sample some and figure out which you like too.

Not to mention this place serves all their ciders in mason jars. Hipsters, cue excited scream fidget.
author: Chia L.

description:
I've been waiting to go to Upcider forever (or at least that's what it feels like)! I strolled in around 6 and found my friend at the bar. She had already been snacking on some garlic friends and sipping on a cider. The crowd seemed sparse but the place was already filling up.

I proceeded to order the Pinot Grigio cider and the turkish flatbread and promptly consumed both. I then proceeded to order on of the dry ciders from the tap as well. Both were quite delicious. Note: they don't do flights but they do let you sample ciders before. Helped weed out the not-so-tasty ones. ;)

Finished the night with a Thistly Cross Real Ginger Cider. Probably my favorite for the whole night! By the time we left the place was packed and I could barely hear myself think. It was definitely time to go!

Overall cool venue. A bit pricy if you don't want the local bottled ciders. I will be back!
author: Jared W.

description:
I was on a roll with the 4-5 star reviews but all good things must come to an end...

Made dinner reservations for a party of 10 (ish) on a Saturday several days in advance. Another group of friends also ended up having a birthday dinner there as well so it was a busy night. While I have some sympathy in that regard, the quality of service was by far the worst I've experienced in a very long time. The waiters and waitresses were really all over the place and hard to flag down. At one point, a waitress turned and walked away mid-conversation...it was pretty unbelievable.

What's weird is the waiters were pretty good about clearing empty glasses and plates from our table but slower than a DMV line to take orders and bring out food.
