What keeps this review at 3-stars is the pure cider and the pulled-pork sliders I ordered. The cider was crisp, refreshing and sweet, and I loved the cilantro in the mini sliders. There was another shrimp dish I ordered that was beyond bland and so not worth the $12 it's priced at.

I most likely won't be coming back. But if you go, try a cider and the pulled pork sandwich.
author: Kat C.

description:
Upstairs + cider = Upcider.  Yeah, I like puns and also I like cider.  So what? Wanna fight about it?

Cider is serious stuff: It has been a popular alcoholic beverage about as long as beer or wine, Johnny Appleseed reportedly planted apple trees so that people could enjoy cider, and our social and moral superiors (ha!), the English, the French and the Spanish each make distinct styles of it.

To the best of my knowledge, Upcider is the only restaurant/bar in or around town that offers more than two ciders, let alone an entire a menu of them. The ciders vary in style and flavor profile, ranging from the ubiquitous Wyders to a couple of Basque ciders (which have that sour-sweet-funk of sour beers).  The beer list features several microbrews and there is wine as well.

There's good food too, which ranges from normal bar snacks such as fries to some more interesting stuff for a bar like a kale Caesar salad, "Buffalo" fries (which are tossed in hot sauce with blue cheese and celery/carrots), various (non-hamburger) sliders and some nice pizza-like flatbreads. I also get the impression that the menu changes a bit to reflect what's seasonal and good in the markets.

It's upstairs in the old Ozone Thai space, enter to the left of Vertigo.
author: Suo L.

description:
We came here for a friend's birthday party. We got there early around 8 on Friday and the place wasn't crowded. The waiter was super helpful and told us that the birthday girl called and said they'll be late. We were seated and they offered to put the cupcakes that I brought into the kitchen and even put them on plates and lit the candles after we finished eating. I was super impressed with how friendly and accommodating they were.

As for the cider, they have probably 35-40 ciders on hand, ranging from $5 a bottle to more than $20. I had a pear cider and really enjoyed it. The food was fantastic, too! We tried everything on the menu, from the sliders to flat breads to salads and entrees. I really enjoyed the potato flat bread and the spinach/guyere flat bread.

Overall, the staff is super nice and this spot is perfect for a large group. Will certainly be back :).
author: Alice W.

description:
Been going here a bunch and I love it every time.

Started coming here when they had waitress  service but they have since updated their approach to include ordering at the bar and then taking a number. 

Basically yeah. All the reviews are true. 

This place has delicious food a great view and a nice array of beverages. 

There was a small hiccup with my order but the smiling and friendly male barkeep made it right with the quickness.  

I love businesses where the staff take pride in what they do and go the extra yard to ensure the customers enjoy everything to the max.  

Stay classy, Upcider.
author: Kevin G.

description: This place is a great find! Was looking for a spot to grab something to eat and drink before heading to the Regency ballroom. Atmosphere is great, and the food and drinks were delicious. Ordered the garlic fries and the pulled pork slider, which I can say was the best I have had to date, that gets 5 stars right there...I'll be back for sure!
author: Kimberly R.

description: Came here before a show at the Regency Ballroom a few blocks away. They have four pages of ciders on the menu. FOUR pages. I was very excited about that. I had the California Mighty Dry. So refreshing and crisp. The menu is amazing too... Lamb sliders, spinach-Gruyere flatbread, and roasted beet salad are a few items that stick out. I got the meatballs. Sauce was savory, meatballs perfectly spiced. Servings are tapas style, 4 meatballs. Perfect for a snack before a show or movie.
author: Jenn S.

description: If you are a cider person this place is awesome and must in San Francisco. we found this place by looking up local cider pubs in the area. To actually get to this place you have to look up because it is on the second floor but don't let this stop you at all. Once you see the sign getting there is easy. Walked to be greeted by friendly staff which gave us the option to sit anywhere so we opted for the bar even thou the window tables are a great spot too. As we sat to look at the menu we where amazed by the amount of ciders they had! As I am a big cider fan I was stoked! We decided to do a tasting, which was on the board above the bar. This was a great choice to sample a few ciders I had not had before. I did get a slider which was great. Overall a great place if looking to expand your horizon on the hard to find in CA cider scene
author: J G.

description: Tasty and overpriced. Interesting atmosphere....definitely low key. Over order or you'll be hungry.
author: KM D.

description:
Amazing cider selection combined with good food and great people watching. This is the perfect spot to start your evening on Polk st. The cider that's whiskey barrel aged is to die for. Try out some of the heavier ciders since many ciders in the U.S. Have barely any flavor at all. 

Sweet potato fries here are thin and crispy and come with blueberry ketchup -- as good as it sounds.
author: Carly K.

description:
My Girlfriend (Birthday girl on that occasion), wanted to wander Polk st. to celebrate another year of life with her loved ones. She of course always does her research, and planned for us to start the night off here. 

When we got there, the mood felt great, it wasn't crowded at all (it was a Tuesday, though), and it had an awesome view of Polk. At first I felt the whole order food up at the bar thing was annoying, but that was just my laziness talking. It's actually nice to feel a little more active in these settings rather than staying sat down the whole time, waiting to stuff my face.

While the grand list of cider drinks was very tempting, I had on a different taste palette that night. I ordered a Kombucha Raspberry beer, because I wanted something on the sour side. It was BOMB, just what I needed, and my table loved the taste too, along with the drinks they ordered. 

We ordered all the different sliders, but much to my dismay, they were all out of slider buns for the night! But they recovered by substituting lettuce wraps. Not exactly the taste I was going for, still tasted good, and at least it shaved off a couple of carbs (if you're into that sorta thing).

One star off for bun shortage, but an awesome way to kick off my gf's birthday night!
author: Cesar C.

description:
I am very happy that this great bar & restaurant just opened in the neighborhood!!
I was wondering what was coming up since the Thai restaurant closed. 

I came here with couple of friends when they first opened, and visited couple other times.  It is a cider bar (whaaaattttt!!)  with amazing food.  Since cider is kind of a new culture here, and hard to find good kinds in stores, this place is heaven!  We tried bunch of different ones after getting great recommendations from our server & owner.  I had no idea how much ciders vary..  They have ciders from US, England, Spain, Scotland, Germany, Ireland  .. and they are looking to bring more and more, that's very exciting!  There is a cider for everyone here: from very dry to sweet organic ones ( Scrumpy is my new favorite as a sweet treat).  
Alcohol content is surprisingly high in many ciders: it is kind of surprising to feel a nice kick after drinking apple cider at the end..  Wandering Aengus and Crispin were our favorites.

The food was way beyond expectations!  The chef is amazing and every dish we tried was very tasty.  We try to order different dishes every time, and I guess we tried every slider couple times ( upsliders :)) , my favorites are cajun chicken and lamb sliders.  My vegetarian friend has to have the portabella mushroom  slider every time we go now..
Flatbreads and salad are great, too! I love the potato pesto flat bread and turkish flat bread if you are a meat lover like me!  Kale Caesar Salad is a great alternative to regular Caesar.

Service has been great every time we have been there. Staff are very welcoming and attentive at all times.  Seems like it is getting busier every week.  We love the simple yet modern & neat style of the place.  It has a very open feel.  Especially if you sit on the counters overlooking Polk St craziness, it is just fun to keep drinking and drinking :)

Very warm and comfortable gathering place, I know so many folks in the neighborhood are very happy to have you here!!  Obviously, we will be back :)
author: Bailey H.

description:
Looking for something new and interesting? Enter Upcider. This pub specializes in hard cider. Wait what, hard cider? 

That's what I thought too. Just how diverse can hard cider be? Well, Upcider has a ton of craft hard cider and they all have their own interesting taste. I've only tried their ciders on tap, which were all good, but some of the bottled ones sound very interesting. 

They also serve other types of alcohol, one of them being a habanero ipa. It's actually spicy, but I highly recommend you try it! 

The pub is pretty spacious with plenty of seating and the atmosphere/crowd is more relaxed. Great place to just drink and chill. Also they have bomb sweet potato fries with blueberry ketchup. So good. 

Definitely stop by this place if you're looking for something new and to chill.
author: Chris R.

description:
Arrived here with a group of about a dozen after a friend's wedding. The atmosphere was lively, room was slightly dim, and there was plenty of seating for us to share. 

The variety of ciders is INCREDIBLE.
Seriously, if you're too snobby to appreciate the list, we can't be friends.

Bar foods were all reasonably priced and tasty, though I wouldn't plan a meal/evening with just these in mind. 

I'm getting older.
You know, the kind of older where you're still young, but the thought of cruising Polk St. for a good time just can't compare with being somewhere relaxing without as much stimulation? That being said, I will absolutely not hesitate to come back if I'm in the area.
author: Phillip K.

description:
Come in at 5pm and get great service. Come in with some knowledge of
Ciders. :-) prices are a bit high and a strong commitment to the cider you choose since they serve in a big bottle.
author: Kim M.

description: Good bar food and extensive cider list! Reasonable prices for cider, too. Try the buffalo fries - it's like buffalo wings without the chicken!  I had the beet salad with chicken and it was delicious and filling. Food is ordered at the bar and you can sit wherever you like. 2nd story view of Polk street with open windows in good weather is really refreshing.
author: Carlee M.

description: Great ambiance. Got the sweet potato fries with blueberry ketchup that paired well due to the sweetness. Got the boonville cider, it was delish and the most apple-y of all the ciders. Then I got the kale salad with creamy anchovy dressing and croutons. I was happy ! My friend got the Turkish flatbread also yummmmm
author: Sophia B.

description:
THIS PLACE IS AWESOME. 
If you've ever wanted to learn more about good cider, or meet up with friends in a fun, relaxing environment, or eat delicious food, THIS is your place.
The zucchini cakes, lamb slider, and sweet potato fries with blueberry ketchup are my favorites, although you may want to try everything on the menu.
As for ciders, WOW they have it all. Dry, sweet, tangy, crisp - worth it to try a bunch and find what you like.

I've seen going-away parties, family gatherings, double dates, and people just hanging out here.
The window seats are great for people watching and catching some craziness on Polk.
Go now!!
author: Erin B.

description: Definitely go here if you love cider as they have at least 3 full pages of the menu dedicated to different types. We went here more for the food (I'm not a cider fan) and everything was delicious. More importantly, the atmosphere here is great if you're actually trying to have a conversation with the group you're with as the place is not loud at all and very spacious.
author: Ken R.

description:
Will very likely be coming back here frequently for chill nights- huge selection of cider, decent food and great space. Bartender was very patient even though it took me forever to decide on a couple ciders and very willing to offer suggestions on food and ciders. He was well informed when explaining the differences in various coders for me. Food- we ordered flatbread with spinach and Gruyere (his suggestion, said it was better than the potato and pesto) and we definitely enjoyed it! Potato soufflé was very fun to eat but I felt like it was less worthwhile for the price. Ambience is great, softly lit with a lot of natural outside light and the window seats are great for people watching. Definitely a good place for smaller/ quieter groups since the space is so large, went on a Sunday so not sure how crowded it ends up being on weekends, especially since it's a block away from rowdier bars on Polk. 
Got a Ace pineapple cider, a Sonoma pear cider, and BF got a dryer apple cider on tap. Prices for drinks was definitely great, ranges from 5$ bottles to $30+, if you're going for a higher end selection.
author: Joy H.

description: Awesome atmosphere, really nice (and good looking) workers, reasonably priced both drinks and food and accepts card (with $10 minimum). Can't go wrong really. It's in the heart of Polk area.
author: Devika B.

description:
Beer and wine aren't really my thing but I love hard cider so when I discovered this place on yelp, I was super excited to go. However, I'm also really indecisive so it took me a while to read over the entire menu and finally decide on one. I was trying to go for a sweet cider I couldn't easily get in the store. I ended up with an Anthem Pear Cider (which I was kinda sad to realize later can be found in grocery stores). It was alright but I've had ones I liked better. Next time, I'm going to try the Ace Pineapple cider since I've had Ace before and really liked it but haven't seen the pineapple one in stores yet.

My boyfriend got the ginger cider and was kinda sad at first that it came in a can haha. I don't like ginger so I didn't try it but he said it was definitely ginger-y. He didn't think it was that great though. We also got garlic fries which were good but nothing amazing.

Next time I might try reaching out to the people at the bar because I would've liked to get some recommendations based on what I've tried and liked in the past. Overall I really like the concept of this place and will definitely be back. I especially liked the atmosphere. It's a good place to chill and talk with friends with a nice view of Polk St.
author: Tiffany S.

description: Large space good for casual friend dates or a quick bite. I'm not much of a cider drinker, but find they have a well represented beer selection as well. Service at the bar can be slow, as everyone orders through the 2 bar men (food + drinks alike!) but the food comes out quick.
author: Jessica G.

description: Gluten free? This is your place! A huge, HUGE list of ciders in both bottles and on draft.  Great menu items as well, but if you just want drinks and tapas-style apps, this is where you go.  I would strongly suggest trying the Aspall ciders from England- especially the imperial. I would also suggest pairing it with either the sweet potato fries or the buffalo fries - the latter we're surprising light and not as greasy as other places.  I'll definitely be back the next time I'm in SF...
author: Ryan B.

description: This place is delicious! My girlfriends and I were looking for a place to have some appetizers and drinks and the SF resident in our group recommended Upcider. I now recommend it to anyone who visits the city. I had a blackberry pear cider which I ordered from their countless pages of different ciders. We shared some sweet potato fries with BLUEBERRY KETCHUP. Of course we were skeptical about the idea but were soon blown away at how tasty it was. Definitely a must try.
author: Julie H.

description:
Upcider is a nice gastropub to hang out at on Polk street and does not get too crowded. It also has a very nice view of Polk street if you sit near the window. I'm not a huge fan of cider, but they offer a good selection of beer to choose from as well. 

My favorite thing about UpCider is their Mac and Cheese. It has bread crumbs, bacon bits and the right amount of creamy cheese. We also had the sweet potato fries and kale salad.
author: Linda P.

description:
Just had a great impromptu supper with friends at Upcider.  Hard Cider is it's main thing but the food was amazing!  We had the Turkish Flat Bread, the Meatballs,  the Cajun Shrimp and the Kale Cesar's salad... just to name a few of the delectable items on the food menu.   It's a great big 2nd floor corner space over looking Polk and Sutter.  
I highly recommend you invite a few friends and enjoy the excellent service, extensive cider, wine and beer selections and delicious food.
author: Antonio D.

description: The food in here was good, but all the decent ciders were overpriced. Cider isn't supposed to be a pretentious drink. I ordered a supposedly English cider (I'm English) called "Excalibur" - wow, it was pretty dreadful & not a make I'd ever seen the like of at home. I posted a pic of it on Facebook which brought much hilarity. A pint of cider should be $8/9, and what you get for that shouldn't be complete pigswill. I understand some of this stuff is imported, but some of it is clearly making huge margins based on ignorance.
author: Fi M.

description:
This review is going to lack detail since the cider hit fast and hard ;). We came in to pre-game, but it quickly turned into a near full game. They had such delicious choices! Being a beer-loather, I usually stick to hard cider. My taste buds exploded with a blueberry-honey one and the other sweet ones. 

I would pass on the food. The food had very small portions and was not enjoyable. I got the salmon slider and all I kept thinking was that I might as well have just gone and inhaled black pepper. The service was great and the place gets busy very quick during the evening. The servers do a great job at giving you great suggestions.

**Note: They only do tasting flights on weekends. Apparently, Friday does not count as a weekend....
author: Surge C.

description:
Great to go to a place which is championing cider in America. The amount of ciders available is impressive.

Being upstairs with big windows is great for people watching on Polk. A minor downside is that for some reason we got the occasional whiff of cigarette smoke, presumably from people smoking below and it rising.

A couple of minor comments, which may only be of interest to real cider aficionados - particularly English ones.

Firstly, american 'dry' cider is nowhere near as dry as you get in the UK, so you may want to go for something European if this is what you like.

Secondly, they didn't seem to have any cider on tap.

Thirdly, they had no scrumpy and didn't seem to have heard of it. Poor show for alleged cider specialists!
author: Colin R.

description:
I'm giving this place an extra star because I think I would've enjoyed it more had I not come right in the middle of Santa Con. I liked the several ciders we ordered and the food was decent; I got the mac n cheese and I believe they mixed something up in our order and gave us a bonus buffalo fries. I liked their garlic fries but the buffalo fries were just strange.. 

I love the decor and how there's seating along the windows which overlook the street. Spacious and quick service while we were sitting at the bar. 

Definitely need to come back on a normal day.
author: Jamie B.

description: I was looking for a gastropub type of place and came across Upcider on Yelp. As always, the Yelp community delivered and I was very much satisfied with this place. Their cider list is impressive and it's categorized in a very informative and helpful manner. I chose a lovely pear cider. The food was also really good. I had a lamb slider and a pulled pork slider and both were delicious! Over all I also like the casual ambience of this spot and you can either come with a big group and claim one of the tables or opt to sit by the windows and people watch if you're with a friend or two.
author: Ryna D.

description:
I had heard about this place a couple weeks after it opened and really couldn't believe it was acutally where people said it was. I had looked all over for Upcider until I finally looked up and saw the sign. Then I had to find the entrance which was just as confusing as its above a Subway but it is definitely worth the scavenger hunt it takes to get there.

Love the ambiance set up by the upstairs location. You have to go up some stairs that sprawls out into a simple bar layout that works so well for this small location. There are plenty of tables set up for group events or dinner dates. And much like Fly Bar next door they actually have enough food on the menu to warrant making this a dinner option as opposed to just grabbing drinks. 

This has to be my favorite date spot in the city. Its not too expensive and it has the novelty of being a cider bar. I have never encountered one of these before and with cider being my favorite kind of drink needless to say I was in heaven. Just the sheer amount of Cider options will overwhelm you if you are not a pro. There are at least 8 pages of ciders from every country that produces quality cider. So many imports to please even the most picky of cider fans. If you aren't sure where to start and have no idea about crispness, bitterness or sweetness the bartenders will willingly help you make a selection. 

They are so good at their jobs I am always afraid my dates are going to leave me for them after a couple minutes of chatting with them. They always make quality selections and keep the night going. 

Whether sitting at the bar or at the tables or along the window there is plenty of room and it never gets too crowded during the weekdays. Be forewarned they are closed on Mondays. Also no need to get dressed up but I would recommend business casual. No one just rolls in off the street or out of bed.

The food is fantastic as well. I would recommend the flatbreads, the garlic friends and the ceasar kale salad. Its the perfect complimentatry food for ciders light and tasty. I have tried several of the dishes there and nothing has really disappointed. You can eat as little or as much as you want so head there anytime after work. 

You really can't beat this location if you are looking for an alternative to the wine and beer of most bars. You get something different in a romantic and intimate setting and are perched above the people on polk street. It doesn't get much better than this.
author: Nick R.

description: Casual, fun, unique environment. Just don't eat the food. The cider wasn't that great either. The atmosphere is really great though. I would go back but the food cost is high and not worth it. Had a slider that was dry, buffalo fries that were cold (came out in just a couple minutes which means they were probably precooked) and macaroni and cheese that was wack.
author: Ebahi E.

description: A really unique offering; I've never seen a cider menu like theirs. Decent food, too. Nice for lunch, too, with the big windows and view of the street from above.
author: David S.

description:
'Tis the season of windy SF nights and... cold cider! 

I was celebrating a friend's birthday with a group of around 20 people - the birthday girl said this was the only place that could fit a reservation on such short notice for a Friday evening. Try your chances if you're wandering past and looking for a bite (and sip, of course)! 

The setup of this place makes it easy for groups that hate trying to split checks. You'll get a clipboard with their portfolio-looking menu, then go up to the bar to order individually. Cards accepted! Servers were nice and easygoing, but we did have to ask for water from the bar.

What Upcider had in store for us:
- Stuffed Potato Souffle: salty, dense, and delicious. It's meat and potatoes, v2.0. Surprisingly filling. 
- Pulled Pork Flatbread: flatbreads are the most bang for your buck on the menu, and perfect for sharing. I love pork with pretty much anything, so this was a smoky, BBQ-ed winner in my book. 
- Turkish Flatbread: I am not a fan of lamb, so far with anything. But I can see why the subtle heat in this flatbread could appeal.
- Creole Shrimp: we had a good laugh over the three pieces of bread and five jumbo shrimp in this dish. The sauce WAS good though and is perfect for dipping when you want some Cajun spice on your flatbread. 
- Fries: we sampled all three - Buffalo, Sweet Potato, and Garlic. Get Buffalo if you love  your fries messy and saucy. The Sweet Potato actually was not that sweet, but the blueberry sauce gave it a little extra flavor boost. The Garlic advertises itself - I swear you can smell the distinctive fragrance from across the room. 

Drinks? I thought you'd never ask.
- Ace Pumpkin Cider: one of their seasonal specials. It smells like cinnamon, but tastes tangy and light.
- Possman Pure Cider: if you're not a cider person,  you'll become one after trying this. It's smooth and complex, leaving a very pleasant aftertaste. 
- Sonoma Pear Cider (The Pitchfork): tastes like juice, with a creamy/buttery tail! How did they do that?
- Sonoma Bourbon Cider (The Anvil): well, it's bourbon. I don't appreciate it enough to comment... 
... And so many more! There's a cider literally for everyone and then some. 

With all these drinks, you'll be expecting a trip to the bathroom. Cartoons of a potty dancing man and woman identify your destination in a corner. There's a sink outside both, which leads me to wonder if the men's room doesn't have one inside? The women's is lit in pink by an overhead light and decorated with a single comic-book style drawing. Can you keep a secret? it asks.
author: Helen S.

description:
Really like this spot on Polk - one of the few reasons I will go out to Polk. It's a pleasant respite from the otherwise crazy drunkenness of the rest of the street.

I've never seen a place with such a good cider selection - or for that matter any sort of serious cider collection. It feels like you're at a fancy winery and getting to try all the different varieties. The most interesting cider I've had here is the habanero cider - verrrry interesting with a serious kick to it. Upcider also has pretty decent snacks. The only downside is that it's often reallly empty which makes you feel you're just not in the know, but really, you are, so suck it up and go there!
author: Milan T.

description:
Cider is becoming this huge craze in the city and Upcider is really doing it right. They have 3 pages of cider menu alone. Their food menu could benefit from more options. Sweet potato fries with blueberry ketchup was really delicious. Zucchini cakes with yogurt dipping sauce was amazing, too. I could eat two of those plates. I don't like the fact that ALL of the sliders come with aioli on them, but the pulled pork ones were yummy. Lamb/beef Indian flatbread was alright, a little too spicy for my taste. Can't wait to go again and try some more ciders!

Only negative, they had us order our food and drinks at the bar. No wait service.
author: Tiffany M.

description:
5 for the Ciders (great list, converted 3 who didn't think they liked cider)
4 for the Sliders and Flatbreads (creative, good flavor)
2 for the calamari and mac/cheese (surprisingly bland - not sure why, but both were the most flavorless I can recall.  If not for the normal texture, they tasted almost watery)
author: Sp S.

description:
I love any place that decides to specialize in any one particular thing. Insert Upcider. I like to go here on one of my low key nights and sample a few different ciders. The bar tenders are well educated in their selection and you can take a few samples before deciding on what you want (so long as its on tap).

I really enjoy the small menu they have here as well. Flat breads to die for! LOL ok maybe not die, but they are pretty darn delicious. 

They close at midnight so get here early and enjoy the intimate atmosphere.
author: Krystle L.

description:
If the service was better I would given it a 4, but we literally sat at the bar for 10 minutes before anyone acknowledged our existence.
When we arrived they weren't super busy so in my opinion someone should have made eye contact at some point. Got some sliders which were good and the spinach and gruyere flatbread which 1/2 of was delicious, the other half was burnt. No one ever refilled our water glasses and getting the bill was just as painful as our initial greeting. Asked 3 different people before it finally happened. I'm sorry but I don't believe in 20% gratuity unless it's earned. They bring the iPads  with the gratuity which u pick between18, 20, and 25%. Fortunately, there is the custom button. I've been here a few times. Today was the worst. I recommend on a Sunday afternoon. Service was great then.
author: Coraly S.

description: Yummy! Such a great place - low key, fun atmosphere, easy to order, tasty food (sliders and flatbreads are all I've had but I'm sure the rest is good too), and extensive selection of cider.  Came here before a movie at AMC, and it was perfect for the occasion!
author: Anjali S.

description:
Food Poisoning. Ate the "spicy" lamb sliders around 7pm and at midnight the pain and nausea set in. I was up all night then had to catch an international flight and suffer on the plane some more. After reflecting on what little I ate that day, I am 100% certain Upcider is the culprit. Also had the sweet potato fries which were over crisped & dry with a bland BBQ sauce. The cider was delicious though.

Decor is minimal, like a cheap asian restaurant. The bar is classier looking. All I can say is "Up yours" Upcider!
author: Ashley B.

description:
My coworker and I got food poisoning here last Tuesday. Terrible, awful, violent food poisoning. We had both eaten different things all day, shared the warm spinach salad at the Upcider, and were both ill approximately 5 hours later. The salad came with a mushroom-bacon cream sauce and we believe that was the culprit. 

The worst part was that when I called to speak to the Manager regarding the incident, he basically told me that if I couldn't prove it, he didn't care. I didn't want to have to call the Health Department on them, but they've given me no choice. If they can't be appreciative and responsive to a call about their health standards, they have it coming.
author: Jessica T.

description:
It was late at night (~11pm) on a Saturday, when I strolled in with a crowd of nine. The place had quite some noise, as we weren't the only large group. The lighting was dim and the atmosphere was very relaxed. Nice place to hang; hard to hear the people you are hanging with. 

The list of cider choices was amazing. There were so many to try that it was hard to choose. I settled on a "Bad Apple" cider and I wasn't disappointed. I wished to try more but it wasn't exactly our first stop of the day. I will definitely be back when I get a chance. 

Also, my friend ordered a small mac & cheese that was SOSOSOSOSOSO good. There was even bacon crumbles on it. Perhaps it is because I only tried a few bites, but I crave it on those cold, windy nights. 

I will be back.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Sweet cider selection and the only place I have ever seen KOMBUCHA BEER - sounds like a dream come true for some of us! I came and had cider flights with a friend and ordered a bunch of food. The service was quite nice and prompt. The decor is very comfortable and they have a bar lining a floor to ceiling glass window where you can sit and happily people watch. Pretty ideal.  

I wasn't incredibly impressed with the food but it wasn't bad either, just decent. We had:
-sweet potato fries w/blueberry ketchup - the ketchup was quite good, I WOULD LOVE TO BUY A BOTTLE OF IT!
-turkish flatbread (lamb, ground beef, cilantro) - kind of lacking flavor, needed to come with more lemon to squirt on it
-cajun shrimp - very good
-meatballs - very good, probably my favorite

Will definitely come back for the drink selection & ambiance.
author: Sonya Z.

description: I am a huge fan of the Cider Movement and thought I would check this place out. The prices are on the high side, but what in San Fran isn't?..lol. They have a huge selection of Ciders and the staff is pretty knowledgeable. Wouldn't mind checking this place back out in the future. Only complaint is the food selection is pretty week in terms of apps. They should find some more bar friendly foods.
author: Randy J.

description:
As a ciderholic, I love the concept (and the punny name). Upcider offers an encyclopedic list of cider options from all over the world. How do you like them apples? :)

We ordered the Finn River Forest Ginger, Thistly Cross Whiskey Cask, and Two Rivers Cider Co. Blood Orange ciders.

The Finn River Forest Ginger was our favorite. It's better than Angry Orchard's ginger variety. We guzzled it!

The Thistly Cross Whiskey Cask was great as well. Not extremely 'sparkling' but it offered a round, oaky flavor.

The Blood Orange was probably our least favorite but had an interesting taste evolution. When the bottle was first opened, it was extremely carbonated, so much that the flavor was masked; fizzy but flavorless. But after sitting for 30 minutes or so, another sip provided delicate citrus notes. Wish this one had been a little more flavorful.

While the cider selection is clearly top-notch, the menu needs some work. First of all, it seems like it's suffering from a bit of an identity crisis. Middle Eastern-inspired dishes and Buffalo fries? With cider? The offerings sound good by themselves but are a little strange in the cider house context. 

Also, such a place could be a drinking AND EATING haven for gluten-free individuals. With a gluten-free member in our group, we came here because we assumed an SF cider house would be gluten-free friendly. However, their food menu's gluten-free offerings were scarce. What a missed opportunity with such a large gluten-free community in the Bay Area! Our gluten intolerant member of the group ordered a slider, gluten-free style. It came sans bun and wrapped in raw cabbage...which added an unsavory bitter flavor. 

We also ordered a round of fries - both buffalo and sweet potato. I thought they were both delicious. I especially liked the blueberry ketchup for the sweet potato fries. The clove spicing was unexpected and brilliant.

Some gluten-eaters of the group also ordered sliders. The upsliders (with buns) were tasty but on the skimpy side for the price ($6-7 for a hockey puck-sized slider). These were the most disappointing items of the night. Would not get these again unless the portion size were to increase.

I would definitely come again but stick to what I know I like...cider and sweet potato fries!

Finally, if you're coming on a busy night and want to grab a table, make sure you do so away from the bar area. We made the mistake of choosing a table by the bar, and there was a lot of 'hovering'. Not my favorite!
author: Lissy R.

description: Got the BBQ flatbread special, calamari and meatballs- all were amazing. Great beer selection too. Only downside was we were seated at a bench looking out window which made it hard to flag waitstaff - also they bring an iPad to run your card and you have to tip in front of them; nonsense! Will go again since eats and bevs were quite satisfying. Clientele is cool too.
author: Sarah B.

description:
A spot dedicated to ciders? Love it! 

While the ones we tried in our individual flights were OKAY, I'm certain their selection is diverse enough where you'll find one that is perfect for your tastes! 

On a rainy rainy day, which San Francisco is experiencing more often these days, it's fun to curl up in a corner and watch from the window above Polk, cider in hand.
author: Tinna H.

description: Great beer below average food. $7 for 1 very average and small lamb slider with no sides. Insanity. Meatballs were ok at best. Garlic fries weren't good at all. No real garlic taste.
author: Haydn O.

description: They have a such a large variety of ciders, it's a place to keep going back to. There are sweeter ciders, dryer ciders, etc. If you like ciders, this is the place the go. The atmosphere is nice and cozy. There is enough space for large groups to hang out.
author: Christina L.

description:
Whenever I think dinner and drinks, my tummy sends little signals to my brain that read "Upcider" or "Chubby Noodle," currently my two fav places for chow and libation that won't break the bank :). Upcider has 3 pages of ciders from all over the world, and also an extensive beer and wine menu. It's also great for groups of friends and serves lots of shareable bites. Located conveniently on the happening Polk St, I think this place is an ideal first stop during a night out. Just make sure that you don't miss it because it is located on the second floor of a building. 

For drinks, we had:

I tried the Wanderlust cider, and wasn't too wow'ed. It was not as flavorful as I would have liked it to be. Mr. K got one of my fav beers, La Fin Du Mond (talk about flavor), and the old / new roomie (reunited!) got a blonde ale of some sort. 

As for food, we had:

Peppered Salmon Slider ($6.95) - Each order just comes with one slider, which is a bit bigger than the average slider. I thought the flavor was great and I loved the sweet and soft hawaiian style bun and the creamy aioli. 

Turkish Flatbread ($10.95) - This doesn't look or taste like your average pizza. There is no cheese. The crust is very thin and crispy, and not doughy at all. I liked the flavor on this - spicy sausage and lots of tomatoes. This was a good dish to share as it came with 8 or 10 slices.

Meatballs ($9.95) - Oh man. I really liked the spicy tomato sauce on this dish. And it tasted so good on the crunchy bread that they serve with it. I liked the sauce so much that I forgot whether or not I liked the meatballs themselves haha. I think they were good though. I remember liking this dish overall :).

Mac n Cheese ($7?) - This was a special for the night. I loved the crispy crunchy golden brown bread crumbs on top. And I liked the flavor combo of scallions and crunchy bacon. This had great flavor, but it was also very rich and buttery.
author: Eileen E.

description:
DRINK/FOOD:
Apple cider beer
Flat bread spinach yummy!!
Lots of selection of pretty high alc beer.

SERVICE:
Good.


ATMOSPHERE:
Not fun when it's kinda slow weekday night, but more fun when with a group of friends on a busier weekend night filled with people. Off of polk and upstairs so kinda have vantage point. Cool place to chill, plenty of seating.

12.3.13
author: Angela L.

description:
Straight aces.

Hard cider has always been a guilty pleasure. Taste of beer has never been appealing  which makes the sweeter flavor of cider much more intriguing.

Brewers like Ace Cider and Angry Orchard make this spot a cider drinker's dream. There was ginger. There was cinnamon. There was much to love including $5 - $6 prices.

Enthusiasm carries over to the food.

Sweet potato fries with homemade blueberry ketchup. Shrimp and creole sauce. Salmon sliders. Potato pizza. Caramel bread pudding with homemade whip cream.

Much heavier than expected but hard to put down. Bring your appetite as well as your discipline.

Keeping them from five stars was the service. Friendly but not very attentive. No waters. One spoon for two people at dessert. Little misses all night.

Otherwise this casual upstairs spot with windows looking out onto Polk Street below is one to recommend. It's very close to a winning hand.
author: Jason B.

description:
This review is quickly based on two moments, and not on the food or cider or service. I've yet to try it,  so my comments are based on 1st impression.

1. Saw a show at Great American Music Hall last night (Friday), and was looking for a bite to eat afterwards. Called at 8:00 pm to make reservations for two at 11:30 pm since they're open late.  But apparently,  reservations are not accepted for a party of two. Really? Minus 1 star.

2. Arrived at the place around 11:30, and was shocked to see a velvet rope outside with folks dressed to kill (more like under aged girls wearing as little clothes as possible) standing in line as if it was the hottest Vegas club opening!  Really? Minus 1 star.

Maybe I've been out of the city for too long but when did Polk St. become Folsom St. circa 2004? Needless to say, boyfriend and I walked away thirsty & hungry. I will however come back on a Tuesday or Wednesday or any other day other than amateur night, and give an updated review. Until next time.
author: chennie c.

description:
Came here on a howaboutwe date and loved it. Had a great cider flight, sweet potato fries, and zucchini cakes. I loved everything. We got there right as they opened and it was very quiet, of course, but it filled up as we were leaving. 

The view of Polk Street was great from the second floor. Great service. Will definitely be back - maybe this weekend :-)
author: Shushannah A.

description:
I did like the Caesar kale salad and the view of Polk Street.

I did not like the lamb flat bread, or the fact they do not have anything on tap and the cider was a bit pricey. It wasn't terrible but I wouldn't want to go there again.
author: m t.

description: I never write reviews but i had to for Upcider. I took my fiancee here for valentines day. The only cider bar in Ca. And it also has beer and wine and great food. I loved everything about this place. Great atmosphere and decor. Really nice and helpful bartender. Unlike most american bars many people brought their kids with them. I really liked the great 3 page selection of ciders they had. I have never had so much variety. I cant recommend this place enough.
author: Brianbatey B.

description: As a sucker for cider, this place was a dream. Came on a Thursday night around 10 for a late bite and drinks with friends. Very friendly staff, not too crowded. They have an endless selection of cider so you won't be disappointed. Food was decent and typical bar food. Definitely will be returning.
author: Teresa J.

description:
I really like Upcider because while it's situated on Polk street, it's not your typical Polk street bar. 

Located on the second floor, it's a big classier and laid back than other offerings around the street. You can sit facing out to the windows and watch all the people go by.

As far as drinks, there is a wide range of (alcoholic) ciders to try. You can go for the regular priced ones, or there are fancy schmancy ones going at $30 a bottle. They also have a pretty good beer menu. I appreciate that their beer menu has a good amount of not-too-mainstream beers, while not going into the deep end of beer hipsterism. They've got a bunch of deschutes beers, which is always awesome.

The food is not bad, but not great. I think their menu is made more for people sharing small bites than having a full meal.

Lastly, I think it's a pretty good spot for a date on a weekday night. Not too crowded, good mood.
author: Julie K.

description:
14.12.19        First Visit

Huge lineup of bottle ciders.
You place your order at the bar.
Short list of appetizer to choose from.

Creole Shrimp - blacken shrimp
     w Creole cream sauce

Spinach and Gruyere w garlic
Meatball w tomato bacon gravy
Stuffed Potato Soufle
   Ground beef, mashed potato,
         cheese, sour cream

Buffalo Fries

Basically a cider drinking place with a short but good bar food.
Huge inventory of ciders.
author: S.K. Y.

description: My first visit to Upcider was on a Thursday night. It was very lively, but not overwhelming with noise. Their menu surprised me -- very creative and quite the variety. We tried the sweet potato fries with blueberry ketchup and it was delicious, as many reviews explain. The lamb slider was simply amazing, bigger than a traditional slider size. We also had the Turkish flatbread, which actually reminded me of Lebanese food I had tried in Abu Dhabi. Already a big fan of Kombucha, their Kombucha beer did not disappoint (I tried the Ginger flavor). This place offers a feast for your tastebuds... I'll be visiting again soon!
author: Aisha R.

description: Love this place! Friendly staff and great cider. Try the Cajun Chicken Sliders and the bread pudding!
author: J. L.

description:
Wow!!! I've never seen a place like this in my life! A cider bar?! OF COURSE! Genius! And theres food! 
Okay, here's the cool parts: its upstairs overlooking Polk st. Low lighting, lots of seating, extremely clean. Great for large groups too! The food is awesome! The sliders (yes sliders and ciders) are ALL awesome! And I love the garlic fries and buffalo fries! Finally, ciders from all over the world and new ones to try all the time! Who could ask for a better selection? Oh, and for the service snobs out here (I'm one too, don't hate) the service is great! They really take care of you and  are extremely kind. Definitely a place that makes you want to come back again, and again! Cheers to Upcider wirh such a great concept! We needed you!
author: Bibi B.

description:
A great little hip/cozy bar with all the ciders you can possibly imagine and much more! Which girl wouldn't be happy here?

Came here after dinner on a Saturday night and it was actually pretty quiet for the most part except for a private birthday party on the other side of the wall. This bar is located on the second floor of the main door entrance and just looks like a great place to hang out after work/dinner. It would make a great date spot if ciders are what you love as well. You get a great view of the streets of San Francisco and can people watch at the same time too, which may help you strike up some funny conversations between you and your date!

Since the cider menu was so extensive, I asked the bartender to recommend a cider that was an absolute MUST TRY, and she was extremely helpful in talking me through a few that she thought was unique. I casually picked one of her suggestions, but unfortunately, to me, it just tasted like any other good apple cider. It was good, but I am just not sure if it was worth the $14 price tag that I paid for it. Nothing against the bartender though, because it was myself that picked that cider knowing that it was apple, so I will definitely have to come back again and try another truly unique and one-of-a-kind cider. 

Overall, cool decor, great bartenders/service, extensive selection of ciders, offers food and other alcohol as well.  Will be coming back!
author: Luby H.

description: Try the Flatbread Pizza! It's gotta be the largest selection of ciders in San Francisco. Yummy.
author: Senem O.

description:
I know, I know, they don't have draft... Who cares! And that is coming from a cider drinker... This is a great place to go to get a full range of local and regional artisanal ciders. 

(+) 
- Menu looked yummy
- GREAT selection of ciders - especially the smaller, local artisanal ciders
- Also have the basic national brands for the people new to ciders
- Great atmosphere with plenty of seating at the bar and at tables
- Great for groups
- They are very pro-local products

(-)
- A little tricky to find because it's upstairs but there is a sign on the corner if you're looking for it
- Okay, they don't have draft... that would be great, but I'm happy to settle for their selection

Can't wait to get back!!
author: Jenn M.

description:
Loved the layout of the place. The bar stools and table lining the window was awesome for those that love to people watch like I do especially in that area. I could sit there for days. Food menu looked good but a bit pricey. 

Cider menu is awesome!!!!!!!!!

Would of gave 4 stars but being that I was one of only two people at the bar and not one person asked if I needed anything for a good 15 minutes with cash in hand. 3 people behind the bar must of walked past me at least 25 times lol. 

Would go back if others planned it such as a special occasion.
author: Jason C.

description:
What a great yelp find. 

Friends and I were going to be in the area for a dressy event later, so I tried to find a place on Polk St. suitable for a bunch of 20-somethings in their Saturday night best. Upcider ended up being a perfect fit. More than enough options for drinks (literally 3 pages of cider alone), and some great food to boot. 

I ordered the Fox Barrel pear cider, which went down easy, aka it tasted like juice. Dangerous stuff. S got a roasted pumpkin cider, which was really nice, too. The Mac and Cheese was legit, as was the Warm Spinach Salad. I didn't care much for the Calamari Flatbread - would probably go for the calamari alone next time. Otherwise, the Meatballs and Buffalo Fries were both great, too.

All in all, I'd say the one drawback of the night was the service - which ended up being on the slow side. We were quickly seated, but it took a while for someone to take our order and then at the end of dinner, get us our check.

I'm actually rather sad that I discovered this place after S moved out of the TenderNob, but alas, another reason to return to Polk St.!
author: Alison C.

description:
This is a very unique place located on the second floor of a building that serves three whole pages-worth of cider, of all different kinds, from all over the world. If you are into trying unique alcoholic beverages that you don't ordinarily find in stores, stop by. Although it can be a little intimidating, it's definitely something fun to try out. 

Positives (+):
(+) Really like the arrangement, decor, etc. of this place. Homie, yet classy, with awesome window views. 
(+) Great selection of cider, also wine and beer if that's your choice. 
(+) Food menu - pretty cool selection of various small plates
(+) Potato souflee - really good, kind of like a mexican baked potato in souflee form. 
(+) Spinach and gruyere flat bread - very spinachy, which I loved. Yummy. 

Negatives (-):
(-) Apparently they used to do flights, which would be so nice so you can try a bunch of different ciders rather than having to commit to a sometimes large and expensive bottle. I'm not sure why they don't have this option anymore, but I hope they bring it back soon! 
(-) Was not a fan of the Turkish flatbread. 

I'd definitely go again to try more ciders. Pro tip: Go with a large-ish group of people so you can taste each others ciders and try more. At least until they bring back the flights. hint hint.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
I love love love cider, so was quite excited to come check out Upcider. I had a cider from Normandie (which, if you aren't familiar with French cider, dry to the point of perfection). The food was ok - had the portobello slider (too much blue cheese!!), zucchini cakes (these were delicious), and sweet potato fries (I've had better :\). Service was great, though a bit hovering and the ambiance was great. Like some one else had mentioned - great for people watching!

Something I wish that they did have (though I completely understand the gastropub vibe that they're aiming for), are crepes! Something lighter than sliders would be great  (since cider isn't too heavy), and crepes, the perfect "something extra" are normally paired with cider, so I would love to see crepes on their menu some day :). Nonetheless, would definitely go back!
author: Christina C.

description:
I usually like amber or dark beer, so apple cider is my "guilty pleasure." Needless to say, when I'm craving cider, this place is heaven! Pages of choices! I was too excited to read through the menu, so I selected off the chalk board. But I will definitely come back since there was lots on the menu that looked interesting.

Great vibe. Not the best bar food ever, but nice that you can grab a bite to eat. The focus is of course the cider after all, and it's delicious!
author: Riz W.

description: I keep coming back to this place! The people are great the atmosphere is always the place to be. Great cider!
author: Shawnacy N.

description: After hearing about Upcider for a while, we finally made it there.  Best cider selection I've seen, cool atmosphere for people watching (second floor window seats).  Great for a meeting up with a group or just hanging out and sampling different ciders.  Parking in the vicinity can be difficult.
author: Paul M.

description:
Awesome hidden space for happy hour! I came here with a girlfriend thanks to HowAboutWe. We each got a flight of cider and then shared mac and cheese, a flatbread, and zucchini cakes. Although the bar was rather empty, service was slow but nice enough. We had to hunt down our server twice to ask him to explain our ciders. The ciders were good though.. we got to try ciders from 4 different countries. As they are a cider bar, I would definitely recommend coming here for their variety if you're a fan. 
The food was ok, but not amazing. The mac and cheese was good, if only for the crunchy topping and bacon.. yum. 
The ambiance was very inviting and I loved the opportunity to people watch from their windows. I will be back for more! (:
author: Jen T.

description:
I hesitated to write this review because it's such a gem. it's challenging to find a spot to both drink delicious beverages and eat a good meal in SF, and for selfish reasons, I thought I could keep it under wraps. but let's be honest: who am I kidding? I don't single-handedly control what is and what is not discovered on the Internet. so here goes. 
the thing about this place is the guys really know what they're talking about- whether it's their menu (delicious) or wide variety of cider (they also have beer and wine). they are legit. major plus that it's above street-level with two long walls of windows so you get a (n interesting) view of the hubbub of Polk below. 
top picks (though I haven't had something there I didn't enjoy): creole shrimp. sweet potato fries with blueberry ketchup (perfection). (any) flatbread. bread pudding (wow. just, wow). 
oh, you're not familiar with cider? just tell them what you're looking for and they'll find the perfect match. 
pair the amazing service with the great drinks and delish eats, and you may have found your newest haunt. congratulations.
author: Heidi G.

description: I seriously love this place! They have a cool unique menu and all types of ciders to choose from. You can sit by the window and enjoy your meal while people watching from above. I love the decor and ambiance there! Cool place for a date!
author: Gisel F.

description:
This place is so awesome...the lights, the seating, ambiance - everything! It's located upstairs with plenty of seating. My friends and I came in here because we were in search of good food and drinks and score! - that's what we got! 

If you're gluten free or just like cider, this place would be perfect for you! There were so many choices and the server was fantastic in helping us pick the flavors we were looking for. I personally tried the Blackberry Pear and it was delish! (Unfortunately, I forgot what my friends got, but they all enjoyed theirs too!) If you aren't a big fan of cider, wine and beer are also options. 

As for food, we got the buffalo fries, potato and pesto flatbread, salmon upslider and the calamari. My favorite was the flatbread. It paired so well with the cider! The other dishes were  also interestingly good.

I even enjoy the pay method, in which they use a square reader with an iPad and stand. Pretty awesome idea! 

Sit by the window if you like to people watch. ;)
author: Mimi V.

description:
There is cider bar on Polk Street?! Upcider? What? Where?! I was dumbfounded. Once I caught wind that there was a cider bar (beer and wine also served) in the city I had to go immediately, all other matters became secondary. 

Upcider is located on Polk, cross street Sutter, sharing a wall with Vertigo. I mention this because, if you been to this area you know that on most nights of the week, you that it is shit show for various reasons that need not be explained at this time. However, since it is on the second floor, you feel like you've momentarily escaped the debauchery. The space is open and inviting, 

The staff was very friendly, attentive, and knowledgable. After taking some time to scroll through the three pages of domestic and international ciders (it may take several incarnation for me to try them all), I ordered Angry Orchard traditional by way of Cincinnati, Ohio (had to support Ohio, since I was born in Cleveland) and ordered garlic fries. This dry, crisp cider in combination with their garlic fries made my day. Ah...simple  pleasures. Only complaint is that the garlic fries are thin cut fries, not my thing. 

Upcider I will see you soon!
author: Brian S.

description:
A great Yelp find! The ambiance is pretty damn awesome - we sat at the bar-like tables by the windows and people watched. Our waiters were friendly and knowledgeable - their recommendations on which cider to choose were spot on. Not to mention they were very gracious when my clumsy self accidentally broke a glass. And their choices are endless!

Definitely will be going back!
author: Mirela L.

description:
Very excellent place to chill and have couple of drinks, food are great, hard cider is also good, I highly recommend their Kale Caesar Salad which is very excellent, fried calamari is amazing also, pulled pork slider is also fabulous.

This is place is awesome, price is very reasonable.
author: Marie R.

description:
Upcider is at the usual start of my Polk street bar hop. It's really easy to miss from the street level, you have to go up a pretty sketchy staircase that looks like you might be entering an apartment complex or something. 

I've only ever been in the late evening and haven't sat down before, but usually swing by for a beer. On weekend evenings the place is really buzzing. The two times I've been there were no tables available and no seats at the bar, so had to stand. 

They have a really wide selection of beers, I stick to the Delerium from Belgium. I know, it's not a cider, but you can't get that beer at just any bar. Next time I'll give one the ciders a try!
author: Brad M.

description: I'm not big on beer but I love hard cider. My boyfriend took me here last night. It was cozy and comfortable atmosphere. It was a Thursday so there weren't a lot of people there and the noise level wasn't supper loud. We ordered Angry Orchard's Ice Man. OMG it was soooooo good. We also ordered the calamari and the pulled BBQ pork flat bread. The calamari was perfect. The pork was ok. It would've been better on one of their sliders. I'm definitely coming back and bringing friends.
author: Kaylan W.

description:
This is a rare spot. I hope it won't continue to be an 'only possible in San Francsico' idea.

Upcider gives you the chance to experience the full range of alcoholic ciders out there , and I had no idea how much variety there was - or how high quality it could get. We tried ciders from beer-bottle grade brands like Sonoma Ciderworks (not quite as good) and Anthem (very bright, well carbonated - would pound) that were definitely interesting alternatives to a beer. It got MUCH more interesting though when we explored the higher end of the cider list with Wandering Aengus and Devoto, which literally came out of a wine bottle and was served on stems. Really tasty stuff.

The food's decent - very comfort focused, but that's not why you'd go. We enjoyed enough baked mac and cheese, buffalo-style fries and meatballs to stay ahead of all the cider we were downing. It all tasted great and offered a definitively classy (while equally heavy) alternative to your typical wings/cheese fries at "the bar", and keeps the focus on the drinks you're there for.

The owner came to our table and chatted with us at one point - he was really engaging and friendly discussing the emerging cider industry and making recommendations for cider 'beginners' without pushing us around at all.

The whole experience here had a really personal feel to it - like we were invited to check out this thing our friend is really into over great food and conversation. Great time. There's also a vibe of wanting to focus on regional brands and local artists that was cool. The space also has a great view of the streets below that kind of does the decorating for them.

I hope they'll get taps soon and continue to grow!
author: A.J. C.

description:
The cider menu is impressive to say the least. I've never considered cider to be something that's worthy of having the main focus of a bar/restaurant on but oh my, they really know how to pick the right cider! Can't remember the names of the ones I got...but I have a feeling that everything on the menu is pretty good :-)

The atmosphere is pretty cool. They have a lot of art on the walls and nice decor. It seems like the hip/trendy place to be.

I got the mushroom flatbread to eat and a side of sweet potato fries to eat and it was super fantastic and amazing. They only have one dessert...which are 'elephant ears'. It wasn't the best dessert I ever had (kinda dry and extremely deep fried :-P) but it wasn't terrible either...A slice of cake might be a nice addition to the menu ;-)
author: Michelle O.

description:
Dinner double date at 7:30 PM - No wait, super friendly, chilled environment, low lighting and excellent cider!

Price: Varies, $7-$100+ Depending on what you want, most ciders average $7-$13. 

Attire: Casual

Setting: Nice interior, low lighting, upper floor with great street view. Perfect for casual going out. 

Service: The server was very patient and knowledgable. We asked a million cider questions, and he knew all of them. 

Food - Tried the calamari with fresh lemon, blue cheese fries, Tuna slider  and special bread. All tasted good. The ciders were awesome! 

TIPS: You can pay at the table. They are sly with their iPad and square app. 
Eat. Drink. & Have Fun!

Recommended? Yes
author: Minh T.

description: This was a cool lounge. I was actually there for a mxyer I was working at and fell in love with the owners. They are AWESOME. The food is good and the vibe is chill. The only con is how hot it get's cause its on the second floor and also the parking. If you are looking for some good bar food and drinks with friends or a date out, this is the place to go!
author: Jess C.

description:
Had a lot of anticipation when going to this place since I am a HUGE cider lover. Contemporary atmosphere the the 2nd floor view over Polk make for a nice experience. They have a huge variety of ciders from all over the country and world. The staff was knowledgeable about the selection too, which was a big help. 

My only cons were that they don't have Wi-Fi operational since they claim it kicks their credit card readers off their network when patrons connect. Second complain are the food prices. $6.95 for a single slider?! ARE YOU KIDDING?! They don't offer full-size versions of the sandwiches either. If you're going to eat there, just plan to snack. Plan on an expensive snack! They need to seriously reconsider their food prices. Yikes.
author: Tim H.

description: Upcider had a great selection of cider and beer, especially cider! The food was great too. They did a great job of making bar food classy and delicious. The sliders were amazing, but I recommend getting two, or sharing a couple of other plates with friends. I got the lamb burger which was very good. The buffalo fries were good, but I would pass next time for another slide or another dish. The atmosphere here is very minimal though. However, the tables along the window were very cool. We also had a few wrong orders with our food and drinks. Nonetheless, I would go back for food.
author: Kelsey S.

description: Really great ambiance! Music wasn't too loud and plenty of seating, all wonderful factors for a relaxed night out with friends. Food was very tasty and there was a huge cider selection. We had a large group and made reservations in advance. This place takes credit cards just so you know :) cider, beer, and wine.  Would definitely recommend!
author: Brittany W.

description:
I give 3 1/2 for everything but 5 stars for CARAMEL BREAD PUDDINGGGG!! Yum, yum, yuuuumm!! With all the bread pudding I've tried and taken chances with, I then hated bread pudding, but this place I was happy to give a chance to! Meetballs are great. Calamari is okay, had much better. Flat bread is tasty. Ciders are good!!

This place can get SUPER load and that's one thing that I really don't like. 
One thing I'm impressed is how when you walk in there isn't anyone to sit you down but yourself, but even then, the staffs manage to know if you need a menu or need to be helped. there was only one time we were totally ignored because it was super busy and we didn't like that at all, but if it's a normal busy day then you're good to go.

Service is great by the way!
author: Elaine N.

description: Big fan of this place, theres plenty of seating and spacious which is a huge contrast to the other late-night Polk street places on a weekend. The rustic style is really cool and it's easy to get the attention of the bartender. Massive drink selection and try some of the food (ends at midnight), especially the BBQ pork flatbread! I also liked their pinot grigio cider - it was niceeee.
author: Ryan L.

description:
I didn't even know this place existed prior to last week.  Came here for a birthday dinner, 6 of us, with reservations were seated immediately.  Very nice atmosphere.  We could talk and laugh without it being inappropriate.  The food is pretty damn good!  5 girls and 1 guy ordered almost everything on the menu...almost, and we loved everything!  Here's what we tried:

-cajun chicken slider
-pulled pork slider
-peppered salmon slider
-kale cesar salad
-spinach and gruyere flatbread
-potato and pesto flatbread
-mushroom flatbread
-cajun shrimp
-calamari
-buffalo fries 
-sweet potato fries

We cleared our plates!   Everything was delicious.  My faves were the spinach and gruyere flatbread, kale cesar salad and buffalo fries.  We had a bottle of wine, someone had a cider and our tab split evenly with tip was $25/person.  Not bad.  And we were all stuffed.  

Service was great, everything came out in a timely manner.  They have a large cider menu...I'm not a fan of ciders.  But the food was great!
author: Lesliegh H.

description: One of the more unique bars in SF - they have a huge selection of cider. Servers are helpful and knowledgeable. A great place for groups. Definitely worth checking out.
author: Ming L.

description:
This place gets much better when there's nobody here.  The bartender gave me and my friend samples of the on tap stuff without us even really requesting it, and even gave us a taste of some sort of private stash when I asked what he liked the best.  Really fantastic service, but again, seems to be dependent on how many people are here (and probably who is behind the counter), but yeah.  It probably helps that the day was scorching, too. 

The stairs down are still treacherous as hell, though.
author: Norman S.

description:
Immense selection of truly unique and delicious ciders from sweet to dry, light to strong and every other kind in between. I love that you can get ciders on tap and that a lot of the more specialty ciders come in 22-24oz bottles.

Don't be scared off by the pricing! Remember, for $14 you can easily get a very tasty cider with a good strength which is about what you'd pay for 2 cocktails anyway.

I have not yet eaten the food, but it looks fantastic and people seem to be enjoying it while they are eating it.

The service is friendly and attentive, the ambiance is nice, and in general it's just a good addition to the neighborhood.

If you like cider, I highly recommend checking the place out.
author: Thomas K.

description: Went to Upcider last night for what I believe is my 5th time. Great range of ciders, we go for the Pineapple Hula. Food service was quick, I highly recommend the creole shrimp. Wish there was table service but other than that, I will be back.
author: Relle C.

description: Best place for people watching ever!  This place is upstairs with tons of windows and seating up against said windows...and lets face it, this area of the city always has great things to see :)  We got here pretty early in the evening, so it was pretty empty, which was totally fine. They have vast amounts of ciders to try (3 pages worth) and the bartender was very knowledgeable on all of them which was great.  They also do tasting flights of 4 from 4 different countries for $8, pretty good deal to try such different varieties of cider. They also have a bunch of "upsliders" which are delicious, as was the calamari.  Next time i'm going for the buffalo fries!  And also coming later at night for an even better people-watching adventure
author: Allison R.

description:
Hidden Gem on Polk St. The atmosphere reminds me so much of Europe.
The have a wonderful array of Ciders and food. The staff is super friendly. 
This place is probably the best place on polk st. if you dont want to go the chaotic bars.
Its also fun to people watch on Friday/Sat night since it is located on the second floor.

Def. coming back!!
author: Yas G.

description:
I love the idea and the set-up of this place. Being a girl who doesn't pretend or desire to acquire the taste of beer, I love ciders. They don't taste like moldy bread and they have a bubble to them that's just delish. 

I do wish they had better food choices here though. They are pretty limited there, but 3 pages of all different ciders--def a cool place.
author: Brittini S.

description:
We got to Upcider at 9:30PM, I was afraid we wouldn't be able to order food and eating was the primary reason for going there (we were starving!!).  The staff took our order without any problem and said for us to stay as long as we wanted.

The waiter/bartender was extremely knowledgeable and answered all of our questions about the different ciders from all over the U.S.

The food was delicious and the cider was wonderful, we each ordered a different one to pass around, except DH who ordered beer.

We were the last ones out and the staff didn't try to hustle us out the door.  Great experience and great food!

Highly recommend.
author: B B.

description:
A chill bar, with a fun view of rowdy Polk Street, great bar snacks and of course, an expansive cider (and more) menu. Plus knowledgeable, friendly staff. Sold.

I've been to Upcider several times now and am always pleased by how easy it is to find seating, and how willing the staff is to sit and discuss cider with you. I'd tried cider previously and hated it, but the last two times I've been there picked up bottles of apple-y awesomeness that keep me coming back. There are seasonal choices and menu staples, and a variety of sizes. And all of the cider (I think) comes in bottles (it's poured into a glass for you) so it's never flat or old.

Upcider is a great place to go out with friends when you just want to sit and drink, and look at the people on the street below.
author: Emilia S.

description:
I've been wanting to come here since this place opened because I really enjoy cider. Something about fall season approaching and pumpkin spice lattes back in the cafe rotation made it imperative that I check this place out last Friday.

I loved the ambiance. This place is so cozy, exactly what you want while drinking cider and trying out their yummy bites. Dim lighting and bar stool seating lining the second story windows makes for great people watching (especially on a Friday night when people having an intoxicatedly good time are roaming the streets). Major plus was the clean bathroom.

The cider selection is actually overwhelming. There was a pumpkin special which one of my friends tried, and I picked Ace Pear Cider mostly because it was at the top of the menu. My other friend got the Woodchuck Pear Cider which is the way to go. Ace was just too sweet and the Woodchuck had some extra effervescence that made it even more satisfying. 

Can't wait to come back to try the food. This is a welcomed addition to Polk's line-up in my opinion. It adds a more laid-back, low-key bar for those Friday nights that you really don't want to deal with lines or redbull vodkas.
author: Raina B.

description: This is my go-to local hangout. The cider selection is immense and the food is tasty (lamb sliders, sweet potato fries and the stuffed potato souffle are my favorites). The music is hip and urban and has me pulling out Shazam quite frequently. The service is almost always top-notch and my favorite server there is is Niqo (short dreads, amazing smile) who knows me by name now. The only bar you'll ever need to hit up in the Gulch!
author: Eli A.

description:
Upcider is a great addition to this neighborhood.  Not only do they have a really good extensive list of ciders and tasty small plates, they also have a fantastic space/location -- great view of the city streets at night.  

Here are my usuals:  kale caesar salad, cajun shrimp, buffalo fries (minus the bleu cheese) ... wash it all down with Julian Black & Blue or Angry Orchard Crisp Apple.  These are all very very good, to me anyway.

Though they arent a full stocked bar, i like that their focus is cider/beer/wine, it makes for a nice relaxing environment.  It's a much better use of space than the thai restaurant that used to be here.  Definitely rooting for this place and hope they stay around for a long time.
author: Juv C.

description:
After a disappointing foray into the local bar scene, and prior to attending a Bo Burnham show (which was awesome) we Yelped and found this bar, which is FANTASTIC. Squeezed in between two other establishments is the stairway to cider heaven. 
     I'd never even HAD alcoholic cider before, and this place is the Trappist of ciders. Elite ciders. Delicious ciders. Ciders that smell like a campfire, or a flower garden. Cider which, unlike beer, apparently doesn't give you that bloaty OOF feeling, which means you can consume MORE of it. 
Pleased to say the service here is great and friendly, the setting is clean and spacious, and the food is excellent as well. The Husband enjoyed his flatbread immensely, and I was thrilled by the Elephant Ears, which were fried perfect nommy goodness. This place is an absolute win, and has probably helped me gain a couple pounds in cider-calories. Well definitely be back.
author: Sarah H.

description:
If you're a cider fan, you'll love Upcider. There's a wide array of ciders on the menu, from pear cider to cider with notes of blackberry to your regular ciders. Loved the Crispin which was refreshing.

Nice, trendy yet low-key place for after work drinks, though the lighting is a little dark and the acoustics are a little loud (better if you sit at the bar). If you're looking for a meal, I wouldn't come here--the menu mostly consists of small plates--fries, flatbreads and sliders. My friend and I split the sweet potato fries which were good and came with interesting blueberry ketchup. Sounds strange, but worked. The Turkish flatbread with lamb on it was also satisfying. Would've loved to try the sliders but $6 for a little slider seemed pricey to me.

It's on Polk so I could see this as a nice mellow place to kick off a night out on Polk.

Tip: Come Sunday-Thursday, they have cider flights!
author: Steffi L.

description: Personally I'm not that big of a fan of cider. But they do sell beers here which is cool. The selection is pretty big and they have a bunch of imported stuff which is fun.  I tried a couple of ciders which were all pretty good, taste wise. The appetizers were good too. The fries were spicy and yummy!  It never got too crowded or busy which is always nice. Seems like a fun place for a quick catch up with someone or a place to start off the night.
author: Veronica R.

description: Had my first Berry Cider here, it was pretty darn good.  And try the cajun chicken slider...mmm good!
author: Ben M.

description:
A friend and I just ate there last night, and we are now completely crazy about this place. 
It's in a really interesting location, second floor overlooking Polk and Sutter. The restaurant itself has got a great atmosphere, and perfect lighting- not too dark, not too bright. 
The food was great, the Stuffed Potato Souffle in particular was unbelievably good. I highly recommend trying it. 
They know a LOT about ciders, and are willing to help you pick out which one you want. Sometimes at restaurants I find it hard to order a bottle of wine because I'm not familiar with any of them and the waiter is not being very helpful, but here they are really informative and very friendly. 
I'm definitely going back, and I would recommend this restaurant to anyone.
author: Jeannie C.

description:
Hidden gem on Polk Street!  Highlights: Habanero Cider .... 'nuff said! 

They have a great second story venue looking over Polk Street that is very spacious and open. I went on a Friday evening and we were able to get a table right away. They have an extensive three page Cider menu--I didn't even look at the beer and wine list (but they have that too)! The servers are very knowledgeable about the ciders and gave us recommendations.  

The food was delicious and arrived very quickly after ordering! The servings sizes are on the smaller side. I was with a group of 4 so we ordered a little of everything and shared. I highly recommend the sliders, the pork slider was juicy and simply delicious! They had a Mac N Cheese special with bacon, which was good. The sweet potato fries are good too, especially the blueberry sauce! Must try!
author: Julie J.

description: Walking down the street trying to find Hemlock to meet some friends, another friend and I noticed this place and decided we'd come by and check it out later in the night. So glad we did. Took a little while to figure out how to get upstairs (the entrance is right next to Vertigo) and then not chicken out walking up the dark stairwell but it's totally safe and well worth it. The atmosphere is great. It's not crazy like all the other bars on Polk, though you can watch the madness through the windows. You can actually sit down and have a conversation. The food is tasty. Wide selection of ciders. I've since told some other friends about Upcider and plan to come back.
author: Sarah L.

description: Friendly bartender such a fantastic selection! I love cider and will definitely be returning. I came here on a Wednesday at 5 and it was empty but it filled up fast over the next hour and a half. The sweet potato fries and calamari were super yummy with great dipping sauces! Would recommend will return.
author: E S.

description:
Upcider's beer and cider selection is very impressive!  I went with my guy on a Friday night and had fun at this hidden gem on Polk Street.

Here's why I didn't give it 4 stars:

1) The service wasn't great, and it was way too crowded.  The servers could barely keep up with seating people, and weren't very friendly.  They never asked us how the food was, and it took forever to get our bill.
