2) The food was very underwhelming.  The calamari was so greasy that we didn't even eat it, and the sliders were tiny.  Overpriced for quality and quantity.

...I'll be back with friends for the drinks and ambience but definitely won't be ordering any of their food!
author: Hanna W.

description: This place is always great. It's never too crowed and they always have what I want. Try the Maeloc Pear Cider it's the best thing I ever tasted. The food is good, the cider is great and they also have a decent selection of beer. I'm sad to be moving because there is truly no place like this one
author: Chris H.

description:
12.14.12 || bookmarked 10.04.12

Large, unsuspecting place nudged between Subway and Vertigo, on Polk.  You walk up the stairs, open the large doors, and enter a grand, albeit dark, room

Their selection of ciders was vast - two pages worth, to be exact.  I was too overwhelmed by my choices, so had the bartender pick.  Prices start at $5, so definitely easy on the pocketbooks.

Moved on to their wine selection - which isn't bad for a cider and beer place.  A glass start at $7, and it's a healthy pour!

Will definitely have to return to try the food.
author: Jenny L.

description:
This place is NOT a happy hour spot. Hearing the hype about Upcider, I brought coworkers here ~6:30 and....it was completely EMPTY. 

Lame!

The reason for my 3-star review is beyond this, however. There's nothing really to write home (or Yelp) about on this - it's a general, cute little bar thing with a huge cider list and a decent beer one. 

It's certainly a refreshing change from the other bars in the Polk / Tendernob area, but I'm not dying to go back. 

Don't get the cider flight - it's the worst ciders in the house, bundled.

Food - try the buffalo fries - spicy / interesting.
author: Meghana D.

description:
I've never thought about cider. I don't drink beer and I order wine at every bar even when its awkward to do so. But this was good! Lots of options and a very nice guy behind the bar to tell you all about them. If you are there "now" (fall) try their pumpkin cider. They _do_ also have wine and can make recommendations on that front. Oh, and beer. 

We did not try the food, but it looked yummy. A guy down the way from us was scarfing down some good-looking pizza.

The space is very nice. There are a ton of tables, lots of bar space, and its very wide open and airy feeling. The space is on the corner of the block, second floor, with floor-to-ceiling windows throughout, so you see all of the neighborhood outside.
author: Catt G.

description: Lots of variety in food but overpriced for the quality and quantity. Same goes for the cider unfortunately!
author: Jenny M.

description:
A toothless street scavenger  quietly squats in between an Oldsmobile cutlass and the newspaper machine relieving himself as the sun sets.  Not far from him a woman who once clearly sported a penis is obtaining a fat rock from one of the many dealers peddling their narcotic wares.   I sit perched high above this beautiful urban oasis encased in 180 degrees of bulletproof glass munching on my cajun shrimp while washing it down with a tart yet refreshing bottle of blackberry and pear cider.  Although I am nestled in in the thick of the jungle, surrounded by the wildlife and urchins,  I may as well be a million miles skyward in the spirit world...Ewok village style. 

Housed in what used to be a Thai restaurant, the Upcider is a space with an extremely modern and simple feel to it, complete with lots of handcrafted hardwood.  While some may find the space a bit too simple I have never been one to worry about decor, especially when the food and drink are on point.  

In my mind hard cider has always been an adult beverage offered as an alternative to beer for women in general or  the upstart young cosmopolitan male.   However, after suddenly acquiring an allergy to hops some years back I have been forced to expand my libation horizons in order to imbibe when a gallon of tequila is not available. The impressive  list of ciders from around the world made finding an ideal pick  essentially a lottery as I have little knowledge of this brave new world.  

The staff is courteous and knowledgeable, the food is filling yet far from overbearing, the space is simple yet the room is filled.    From this perch I can plan my takeover...it is my deer stand complete with libations and nectar.
author: Dru P.

description:
Upcider rocks!!! Who'd have thought of having Thistly Cross cider and Turkish lahmacun in the same menu board? Two of the things I love - it's brilliant! Seriously, I travel to the UK just to have real cider and I'm well-chuffed that there's finally a pub in San Francisco that's dedicated to this grown-up apple juice.  

FYI: Rekorderlig cider is finally coming to America at the end of the year so when you start serving it, I will be a fixture at Upcider.
author: Aurora A.

description:
This is a solid 4.  Cool concept and pretty good execution.  I didn't get to try a couple of things I wanted to because I was eating with a friend that is vegetarian.  

Our Order
Sliders - Pulled pork and Spicy Lamb  - both were pretty good, not mind blowing but good.
Zucchini Cakes - Pretty good, though I would take a good crab cake over these any day.
Kale Caesar - The good - really fresh properly blanched kale, good crunchy croutons; the mehh - The dressing, either there wasn't enough and it just wasn't that good.  
Potato Flat bread - Looked better than it tasted, I think any of their other flat breads sound like a better order; I think other people would like this dish though.

We had a couple of different ciders and as someone who's never really been a cider drinker I had fun.  I think this is fun spot for a date, its upstairs and open so it good for people watching either inside or on the street, and the movie theater is a block away.
author: Adam R.

description:
This is such a fun little place.  I love hard cider and was very impressed by their many options.  

I ordered a flatbread pizza and was surprised to see that it was enough food for my friend and I to call dinner for only $10.

I recommend it.
author: Christy L.

description:
Fellas, this is one of the few places where a guy can get away with ordering cider without having to turn in your man card. Take a date and make the most of it. 

The cider list is gigantic. Be ready to see a lot of "apple," "pear," "berry," and the occasional "cherry." The menu only lists the producer, cider name, and the all-important ABV, so you might need to rely on your server to guide you towards the dryer or sweeter options.  

The food menu is all about sharing with various sliders, flatbreads, several potato-based options, and small plates like fried calamari and herbed mushroom toast. The portions are generous--we actually spent so much time drinking and talking that we weren't able to finish all of the fried dishes we ordered before they started going soft. 

Drink up, share some gourmet bar bites, and watch the action on Polk St. from your elevated window seats.
author: James Y.

description:
Speaking mainly from an ambiance point of view, this place is pretty rad. Their floor to ceiling windows are lined with bar seats and overlook the Tenderloin, definitely would make for great people watching. They had art (for sale) pieces for sale around the place and played a very eclectic mix of music, all of which made made the relaxed/chill vibe that much better.

I tried their newly added Pavo (?) pilsner, Obsidian and Old Rasputin.. never was a stout fan but thanks to a friend -- I am now a believer. Their food menu is modest but offers something for everyone; sliders, salads, flatbreads. 

Service was on point even though we had diff servers coming/going. When you're ready for your check they bring over an ipad to your table and swipe with the Square, convenience!
author: Av A.

description:
Maybe bad luck but the service sucked.  Bartender much more interested in flirting with girls than service.  Also, had a very sour attitude (eve 10/19/13 9pm).
Also, BIG---- they have some sort of flat screen they bring around to charge your credit card.  It is the size of a small television and very bright.  Everyone within 15 feet sees exactly what you bill is and your tip.
author: Ric S.

description:
As a non-beer/non-hard alcohol person, this place was heaven. I am forever disappointed when I go to bars and ask if they have cider only to be scoffed at, or have only one option to choose from. Upcider's two glorious pages of cider choices were beautiful to behold, and ALL of the 10-12 varieties our group chose were delicious. Most of the ciders came in 22 ounce bottles, so you may want to bring a friend to share with if you there are a few you want to try.

As far as food goes, it was nothing to write home about, but it was nice to have some options to nosh on whilst imbibing. We had the meatballs (okay, but overpriced at about $10 for three golfball-sized pieces) and the potato and pesto flatbread, which was pretty much just a large cracker with potato slices, but wasn't bad. We came looking for a light dinner with our drinks, and I think in the future I'll be eating elsewhere beforehand.

Great atmosphere. It's on the corner of Polk and Sutter up on the second floor, so you get a great view of the nightlife. We went on a Saturday night, and there was plenty of room for our group of seven. Loud enough that you could hear the music and not feel bad about some enthusiastic conversation, but quiet enough that you could actually carry out said conversation. Nice musical mix- any place that plays Elliott Smith and Queens of the Stone age has my support. 

Definitely planning on coming back again- way too many ciders I still haven't tried.
author: Lacy M.

description: This place is a gem!  Finally went in after passing by so many times.  It was like hanging out at a friends' [really cool] home.  Service was excellent; warm and inviting. Great place to meet up and stay awhile. Will def be back soon.
author: Karren C.

description:
"If it's clear and yella, you got juice there fella!
If it's tangy and brown, you're in cider town"  - Ned Flanders

I've always had an obsession with cider (so much so that I learned that Ned Flanders cider quote), whether it's the nonalcoholic variety or a delicious hard cider (especially pear), so when I heard Upcider was a cider bar, I excitedly made a reservation to go.  

There were pages upon pages of ciders from all over the world. It can be a bit overwhelming so don't be afraid to just ask for a recommendation and go with what the server suggests.  My friend and I probably tried 4 different ciders and each one was delicious.  The food is pretty good too... I LOVED the kale Caesar salad, but I was not all that keen on the mushroom flat bread (it was REALLY mushroomy... and that's coming from someone who loves mushrooms).

I had to knock a star off because the service wasn't that great at first.  There were only maybe 8 people in the entire place, and it still too my friend and I 20 minutes to get someone to come over and take our order. Finally either the owner or manager came over to take our order and the service was really great after that, but it shouldn't have come to that in the first place.  Oh well. I will still come back when I need a cider fix.
author: Rebecca H.

description: Awesome pub! They have a lot to offer in terms of cider but by biggest disappointment is that most of it comes in a bottle instead of on draft. To their credit, they did have one of my all time favorite summer ciders (Ciderboy's Peach) which is usually very hard to find out West. If you're looking for something specific, it's best to call ahead and make sure it's in stock. Otherwise this is a great place to explore new ciders and expand your horizons on the amazing favors cider can bring.
author: Abigail E.

description:
So I haven't Yelped in like a year, but I needed to make a return just to say that, after a single visit, Upcider is probably my new favorite bar in San Francisco.  In a city where you're lucky to see one or two different kinds of cider on a bar menu, they must have three or four dozen--everything from $5 pints to enjoy after work up to more interesting $40 bottles.  Also, they have a respectable selection of wine, beer and mead at a similar price point.  The two guys who took our order seemed really eager to please.  The space is really inviting, and if you get a window seat, you get a nice view of the clientele at Foot Worship, SF's leading foot fetish superstore.  Cider and high heels.  What more could you want?

The bar food (sliders, fries, flatbread, kale caesar!) is really excellent as well--generously portioned and just the kind of food you want to eat with cider.  NOTE: The buffalo fries are made of potato.

Please visit Upcider!  I really want to keep going here!
author: Sam M.

description:
I recently went back to Upcider... again after a long day at work... and again LOVED IT! 

This time we ordered some appetizers, a flat bread and the zucchini started. Both very delicious! The servers once again were very very friendly and offered great suggestions on ciders to try. 

Even though I am not the most "techy" girl, I did love that they use square and bring the iPads right to your table to sign out. Very nice touch! 

Go... Enjoy Cider.. Eat lots... HAVE FUN!
author: Megan C.

description: It's a nice specious place with beautiful view of Polk st. If you are a Polk street goers this may be a great spot for u to start a night. They have good selection of ciders and staff is really helpful and knowledgeable about ciders if you need a help or want to try something new. Food is delicious and comes with small plates so you can try 3-4 different dish easily. It's like a tapas place. Overall good ambiance friendly staff and  good food. Worth to try. Will be back.
author: Mutlu T.

description: Perfect place to kick back with friends to catch up. Great selection of beer. Food is delicious!
author: Jackie I.

description:
Loved this place! Maybe 30-50 different ciders on the menu from $5 on up in a great second floor hip but not trying to hard space. We tried a few ciders and they tasted so different when compared side be side. My husband is gluten free and the owner/waiter was more than happy to accommodate with menu items, even bringing out a few samples of some up coming items they are trying out. All the bar snacks were tasty but we especially liked the buffalo fries. The owner could not have been nicer and chatted with us about cider and some ideas for the menu including cider pairings and a gluten free section.

As other reviewers have said, interesting street traffic outside, do be sure and grab a bar stool at the window and have a great time observing! This place has a great vibe and a cool concept- we'll definately  be back!
author: Melissa W.

description:
I've been here on a saturday night. It was pretty crowded yet it was a very relaxed environment especially for a bar on saturday. I loved the big glass windows facing the polk street. What I liked the most was the fact that it wasn't the usual sf bar scene 

The servers were so attentive and friendly. they helped us on which cider we should go with since neither of us knew so much abt the ciders. We came in for one drink and stayed for the whole night. I'm not sure if they take reservations for the tables but if you wanna go there on weekends with a group like what we did it might be a good idea to ask if they take reservations.
author: Hilal P.

description: There are definitely positives to go with the negatives. Upcider has no A/C, and the windows don't cut it. I think they make it much too difficult on themselves. They have you go up to the bar to order then walk around frantically asking you if this is your dish. They have enough wait staff that they could just take your  order and know your table. Secondly, when a waitress comes up to you asking if she can take your plate because they are short on knives, is a great example of needing a back up system. A cold Kale salad in a piping hot, right out of the dishwasher. Food is meh. Drinks are meh. The bartenders try. They really need some semblance to the organization. Hats off to them for dealing with some nasty people. Kudos for trying to make it work!
author: Jaynie F.

description:
New place that opened up on the corner of Polk & Sutter. On the second floor, which is nice because you can get a decent view of the Polk Street nightlife if you sit close to the floor-to-cieling windows.

They have a menu full of cider....all kinds to choose from, coming from different parts of the world. My favorite? Anthem Pear Cider and Fox Knoll Pacific Pear. Prices vary starting at $5 per bottle.

Unfortunately there's no tasting or sampling of ciders as everything comes in a bottle. My friends and I were curious to try Kombucha beer but weren't able to.

Upcider also served beer and wines, along with small bites including lamb meatballs and different kinds of flatbreads.

Upcider is a great starter place to grab some bites before a big night out, as they close earlier than most places in the area (12 a.m.).
author: Alyssa G.

description:
Thank you to the cider gods who finally decided to grace San Francisco with this bar.

I have always liked cider and now there is a place I can go to choose from at least 30 unique and different types. Not only is Upcider's list extensive but it's also reasonable; most bottles are $5 -11 depending on the size. 

The food looked and smelled amazing as well. I'm looking forward to coming back here to try those noms out and give a new cider a whirl. Thus far, I tried the Raspberry Woodchuck and it is deliciously sweet!

La la la so happy :)
author: Rachel R.

description:
This location is right around the block from me and I just hadn't noticed it. It's a cute place -- at first when I walked in my friend we were afraid that it was more of a restaurant then a bar. We walked in and were greeted right away (probably because of our puzzled looks) and they helped us with the menu.

While we didn't try any food this time, we did have a cider and it was very tasty. Overall, I love the concept and the execution of this place. It's got a nice feel to it and it was nice and quiet for us to just talk. I really like this place and I'll definitely be back.
author: Shauna S.

description:
Ciders and Sliders - it's a simple concept that I love. Plus there is a sweet view of the Polk Street madness.

The pickled beets are the perfect compliment to the slider and the cider selection is solid (not to mention novel)! Can't wait to come back!
author: Don W.

description:
amazing food, great prices, fabulous ambiance.  Great place to go with friends to grab a yummy bite and refreshing cider!  Will definitely go again. Try the kale caesar salad, any of the sliders and buffalo fries were delicious!  I really wanted to try the flatbreads, but will have to save that for another time.

The prices are between $5-$11 for food, and totally worth it.  5 star quality food.  Great new hot spot with a great view of Polk!
author: Azin A.

description: Perfect spot to meet up with friends for some quality chat time. Service isn't rushed - you pretty much have to flag the server(s) down - but that's the only annoyance apart from them being closed on Mondays. Love the simple open layout of tables and benches. Super laid back atmosphere. The drinks menu is plentiful - even if you don't care for hard cider, there's also beer and wine to choose from. The food is amazingly good for small plates - I recommend the lamb and peppered salmon sliders (they're served with a side of pickled beets) , the meatballs, kale caesar salad, zucchini cakes, and sweet potato fries with blueberry ketchup. Everything is made on site and delicious. The first time I went here, I tried the habanero cider. It's definitely spicy and can totally go up your nose like wasabi if you don't wait for the bubbles to die down. I love it here.
author: Elaine W.

description:
This place is amazing! It has class and style, but not snobby. Not even a bit.

It is simple with not too much in your face, which is what I prefer.
Seating next to the window is my favorite, since you get to observe Polk Street weirdness as well as cross your legs comfortably (not like other widow/wall seating where I felt squashed and could not wait to leave). I consider it perfect for "working from home" in the afternoon.

So far I tried lamb Spicy Lamb Slider with Tomato Marmalade, Garlic French Fries with Blueberry Ketchup and Sauteed Mushrooms Flat Bread and each one of those was a special treat! The portion size is just right for afternoon snack/light or late dinner. The taste is outstanding and is definitely something completely different than anything I ever ate. Their chef know his spices and secrets and is not hesitating to use them :)

I am highly recommending Upcider and can't wait to stop by again!
author: Sanja P.

description: Cider choices for days.. Just close your eyes and point. I am a serious lover of cider so this place is a dream. I had a really good habanero cider and an equally good pineapple and blackberry. The appetizers were good too. I even liked the buffalo fries, and I'm not a big fan of blue cheese.
author: Kristina K.

description:
We had a great experience here last night!

Incredible ciders! 

Attentive and knowledgeable staff!

Great space and a great menu!

I hope this place hangs out!
author: Robert M.

description: I was so excited to try this place on my first visit to San Francisco. Ciders and sliders?! Two of my favorite things! The crazy long list of cider choices was awesome and I tried a couple. The place was super busy so it was hard to find a seat, my boyfriend and I ended up sharing one stool to eat...the tiniest $6 burgers of my life. For $6 I really thought I would be getting the size of like half a burger, which I have seen at other restaurants, but no. They're slider sized and would normally cost $10 for 3 anywhere else. I was disappointed that we wasted our vacation dinner out on some tiny overpriced burgers so I drowned my sorrows in delicious cider and then went back to the hotel and had a pb&j.
author: Samantha T.

description:
Calling on all light-weights out there, this is you, you and you. This review is long overdue. 
I dare say the moment I walk into Upcider the theme for "cheers" starts to play in my head because it's a place you want be after a long day at work or a place you think about going to when you want get away from the City but not.  I've been here a few times and every single visit has been a welcoming one. The modern but simple space with handcrafted hardwood accents makes it feel cozy but yet chic.

The cider selection is quite extensive and the "hosts" of this establishment will lovingly guide you to a favorite cider or 2 or 3. Ciders are either dry or sweet with flavors of Apple, Pear, Blood orange and I hear Cherry. My favorite is the Woodchuck pear, it's a light refreshing cider, very much like bubbly champagne. 

The food menu is not to be missed. You must try the Turkish flatbread, calamari, sweet potato fries with a blueberry mayonase (seasonal),Cajun shrimp to name a few. The food is delicious. It rivals any full service restaurant. Hands down.
Going back to the "Cheers" theme. "Making your way in the world today takes everything you've got. Taking a break from all your worries, sure would help a lot" "Wouldn't you like to get away?

Upcider is that place in the heart of a very busy city. Bring your family, your friends, you colleagues, your date and let them take a break from their worries.
source: http://www.lyricsondemand.com/
author: J. C.

description:
Cool place to chill with friends. It's located on top of Subway and the windows overlook the street. If you sit facing the windows, you can get some good people watching in. I came on a Friday night and there was a good crowd of people already. The music is too loud though and I couldn't hear myself talk.

The cider menu is really extensive with all kinds of different ciders. The waitress was really helpful with recommendations and asked me if I liked bitter/sweet/tart/fruity/clean flavors. I ended up getting the Julian Black & Blue cider and my friend got the Crispin. The waitress brought out the cider and mason jars for us to to pour into. I had some of my friend's Crispin and wished I had ordered that for myself. It was so cold and refreshing!
I tried the sweet potato fries and they were ok. I just wish they had ciders on tap so I could try more varieties.
author: Bommy C.

description: Great atmosphere and location. Upcider was an oasis in a sea of dive bars while waiting for a formal event at the regency. Highly recommend it!
author: Alex L.

description: Huge selection of cider, above average food (creole shrimp!), and never too crowded. The vibe of the staff is not always stellar but it's not a big deal.
author: Keith P.

description:
I've been already couple times here..and all the times I tried different ciders and food..honestly..i had no idea about what the heck is cider..however, whatever they suggested me i liked it..they were very patient and friendly while answering my questions about ciders..that's why i can suggest you to trust your bartender/server.. 

anyway..about the food..i tried meat flatbread (turkish lahmajun), spinach flatbread, salmon sliders, portobello sliders (mushroom + blue cheese), soufle (smashed potatoes with sausage) and finally sweet potatoes with blueberry ketchup so far..and none of them disappointed me..in fact I really liked all of them..therefore i'll be definetely back to try other things.. 

in addition to food and ciders, they also provide you such a nice view of Polk street..you can sip your cider while watching all the madness down the street..it's quite cool..

..long story short..they created a hip place with nice design, concept and friendly employees..
author: mert k.

description:
Not a huge cider fan but found this place to be pleasant and had a cool vibe. 

The cider and beer selection was pretty impressive. Also I really appreciated this cider tasting flight because it was nice to taste a variety and for a good price. I think it would be a nice place on Polk to start if you're going out because it's kind of in the middle of everything but isn't too crazy yet.
author: Catherine C.

description:
UpCider,
Thank you for a unique and delicious foodie experience.
As a person who has grown tired of beer, a bar centered around Ciders is a refreshing, new concept. I had the cider by Sonoma brewing company (infused with bourbon flavor), and the St Perry Berry cider. 5 stars for the ciders.

Now, the food.
The sliders were each delightful. Tried the salmon, the bbq pork, the Cajun chicken...all had great spice, flavor and just the right bite size to be filling without being overpowering.

The sweet potato fries...great texture, perfect salt, perfect slice size. The blueberry ketchup lacked flavor. You could tell it was blueberry...but it lacked that needed punch.

Will definitely be coming back again!
author: Ilya F.

description:
20 people over staffed and none available to provide decent service? I really really really wanted to LOVE this place. I'm a HUGE cider fan and this place is only a few blocks from home. Unfortunately though, the place isn't great, it's OK at best. 

-Service was super slow. We sat with our empty drinks (at the bar mind you) for a few minutes and finally waved someone down to give us our bill. Had someone checked on us, we may have ordered another... just sayin. If you're there to work, you should probably pay attention to the few customers there. I felt like there were more people "working" than who were actually at the bar.

-Too bad everything is bottled and you don't have any taps. I would MUCH prefer my cider from a tap than from a bottle that I can pour into my warm glass (yes, please chill your glasses - thought that was common sense).

-The place is decorated somewhat cheaply and it has NO warmth. By warmth I don't just mean that the decor is uninviting (although it was) but, my bf and I kept our jackets on the entire time.

Add some taps, maybe some curtains or couches or something... and we'll come back.
author: Noneya B.

description:
Would have been higher except they only accept two forms of payment per table...so old fashioned...but they use Square so what the hell does it matter? Even the waitress agreed with our observation saying that the "Manager/owner is a bit behind the times"

The drink selection rocked and the food wasn't bad (although portions were tiny even for tapas).
author: Tim P.

description: Best new concept for a bar/restaurant in SF. Hundreds of hard ciders to choose from, friendly staff (especially Özge), lots of excellent food options, and a great view of Polk St. Cheers to all their hard work and creativity.
author: manny r.

description:
Lots of cider options that were interesting to try.  We came with a group of 6 and ordered a number of drinks and menu items. Some to share and some to consume exclusively.

The sliders were expensive, but good from what people said. We ordered every french fry combination and enjoyed them all. I liked the meatballs quite a bit too. 

The music was a little louder than it needed to be for the number of people in the bar and it was hard to hear each other. I couldn't tell if they wanted the feeling to be restaurant like, bar like, or lounge like. Given it was a room with tables and seats I would have thought the focus would be on good food, good cider, and great conversation. Unfortunately this was not possible in our group and it was even hard to talk to the people next to you.

I would consider going back, but not sure if I would pay a premium for the ciders versus buying them from whole foods or another specialty shop and drinking at home.
author: Chris I.

description: Four stars if I liked cider. Some trendy food ideas and an all around cool concept. The food is average...but im picky.
author: Graham A.

description: I enjoyed this location, which was almost empty around 9 PM on a Tues night (we had left another bar because it was too noisy, so the lack of people was nice). Our waiter was friendly and helped us with the menu. We are both people who like cider, but then realize that we don't know where to start when presented with pages of cider options. Having said that, we asked for two different ciders on the drier side, and one was definitely still a bit sweet. But, the view is kind of neat, and the bathroom's nice and clean, so I don't have any complaints.
author: Lisa K.

description:
I actually had a pretty amusing experience here a few months back. A group of us gathered a month after a friend's birthday for a surprise party and we thought we'd be kind and accommodate her gluten-free diet by going to "the new all cider" spot in town. They kindly took group reservations and was patient enough to explain the menu to each of us as we trickled in. They even offered to put the Mission Pie we brought into the fridge and gave us extra room for the balloons. After 25 minutes of nursing our ciders we got a call from the friend that was supposed to get the birthday girl to Upcider saying that the birthday girl really wanted to ditch her diet for the night and eat a Nick's taco...

Awkward. We explained it to our server and they quickly wrapped up our tab, returned our pie (reluctantly haha), and let us on our merry way. I really appreciated their flexibility but also felt really bad because we were the only people in the place. Maybe things have changed now but for that reason alone - I can only give it 3 stars. I will be sure to update if I find my way there again!
author: Krystle S.

description:
I was expecting a LOT more from a cider bar. I was expecting it to be a bit more like Capital Cider in Seattle. I am a big fan of cider, since I am mainly gluten-free, and this is the only cider-focused bar in the city. I think they can do a lot more with this theme. 

I asked a bartender what he would recommend given my desire for a dry, non-sweat cider. He was not very warm and did not give me a great recommendation. I would really like to see more bartenders more enthusiastic about ciders that work at a cider bar.

The sweet potato fries with blueberry sauce is interested - I like the unique option.
author: Harmony P.

description: This spot came highly recommended but was honestly a bit of a disappointment for me. The ciders were ok but the ambience, lacking. It was too noisy to hear my friend...and it was a bit too drafty.
author: Erin W.

description:
So much potential for this place. 

The place was up some stairs through some unmarked doors. It looked trendy- lots of vintage wood and chalkboards. But honestly, it was a little creepy. It was very empty and some of the characters there seemed like they were out of a mob movie. 

The food here was mediocre hipster fare. Arugula salad was great, but not amazing and the flat bread was probably the highlight. The buffalo fries were... meh. More weird than intriguing. 

The most disappointing part of this establishment was that although its collection of worldwide ciders was intriguing and interesting, THEY HAD NO BEER OR CIDER ON TAP. As a beer snob, this loses major points. A great beer or cider can be experienced the best fresh from the tap, not bottled. At least offer a few beers and ciders on tap!

Overall, I'm really not sure if the food or cider is the highest priority here rather than the cool trendy hipster looks.
author: Daniel L.

description:
I was going to give only 3 stars, but that was because the calamari we ordered was probably the worst I've ever had.  

Otherwise, I had never had alcoholic cider drinks before and it was a great experience!  Our waitress recommended several and our group tried many of them ... including an ice cider similar to ice wines.  

The atmosphere is quintessential gastro-pub and we had a great time.
author: Sang L.

description:
loved loved loved! went with co-workers. laid-back, definitely a good way to start a night out on polk...! so many options for cider. Hard liquor only served downstairs though. 

Appetizers were delicious and the service was awesome!
author: Christie B.

description:
We are BIG fans of cider and, having been regulars at Capitol Cider in Seattle (Cider heaven!), had large expectations. Upcider met them! The 3 page cider list was impressive, and the food was deeeeelicious. At first, the bread-heavy menu was disheartening for a glutard like me, but the waiter was very helpful in finding me enough gluten-free options that I came away stuffed and happy. We had the pulled pork slider with a cabbage wrap instead of a bun, which i think was better than a breaded exterior could have been - you get this high-test, slightly cool crunch with a hot, juicy pork center. Mmmmmmm. . .  Also a very good arugula salad, light and crispy calamari (dredged in rice flour instead of wheat, which give you a more delicate, crispy crust), peppered salmon slider, and the meatballs, which were pleasantly savory and smoky. I had a strong hankering for a tart cherry cider and went over all the options with our waiter, but they didn't have any in the smaller bottles. He went away and then returned to tell me that they 'happened to have' an open bottle in the back, however, and my wish was granted. Very cool. The ciders are mostly in bottles, but discussion with our very helpful ciderier revealed that bottles preserve the really good stuff in a way serving it on tap cannot replicate. that said, they will be getting some taps for some of the more robust ciders in the future. And they serve my favorite french cider - Eric Bordelet, which is like the champagne of ciders it is so good. 
We will be back!
author: Jordan J.

description:
Upcider is a cool place and it's a spot I never would have noticed (it's on the second floor and the entrance is unassuming). The selection of ciders is expansive and the menu of food is good for tapas-style bites and small plates. I had the kale caesar salad and cajun shrimp, and a bite of a slider and I would easily recommend all of them. Atmosphere is rustic and nice and it's fairly quiet.

Here's the thing: for a bar, it shouldn't take so long to get a bottle of cider...it's not like they're specialty cocktails. While the service was slow and he couldn't keep up with food and drink orders for our table (granted, a dozen or so people), the food and drinks--when they came and were the correct orders--were very good.

Cheapest cider is $5 for a bottle but some of the expensive ones get into the $20+ range. Food is generally priced around $10 per plate (smaller plates).

I'll give this place a second chance when it's a smaller group and see how it goes.
author: Aaron E.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night around 8pm and they were fairly busy. They only accept reservations for groups of 10+. We had to wait about 20 minutes on Saturday evening around 8pm for a group of six. 

The cider selection here is amazing - over 3 pages of ciders (both domestic and international). They do have 10 or so beers available and some wine options as well. We ordered a variety of the sliders (chicken, salmon, pork), Kale Caesar salad, Turkish flatbread, Calamari, and Garlic Fries. The sliders, salad, and flatbread were just "meh".  The calamari and fries were good. I probably would not eat here again, but would definitely come here for drinks.

Overall take away from my review : come here for the drinks, not the food.
author: Lindsay N.

description:
Finally managed to get in here after hearing about it a few months ago. 

This is a large and spacious bar/pub that specializes in (dun dun dun) cider of all kinds. Lots of local varieties, plus some from around the world, the drink list had 50+ different kinds you can order from a pretty wide range of prices. 

We stopped in last night to get a drink and possibly food. We were a bit disappointed in the food selection, there's not a lot and it's really carb-heavy, which we weren't in the mood for, so we decided just to order a drink and eat elsewhere. I ordered one of the cherry ciders while my friend tried the Honeycrisp one. Both were amazing and delicious.

We were in early in the evening so the bar was pretty quiet and dead (except for the 90s rock music playing, which was a bit nostalgic). We were taken care of by a friendly server very quickly. Sitting at the window gives you some great views of Polk Street in front and ideally nothing really sketchy will happen while you're watching the people and traffic going by. 

I definitely think this would be a great place to go back to. Not sure if I'll try the food at some point, but for drinks with a friend, it's definitely a good place to check out.
author: Cassandra J.

description: If you're a cider person, this is your spot. Hundreds of ciders to try, and daily tastings with a great variety. There was a vendor there from Spain when we came in, and she was setting out platters of pairings with cheese and artisan crackers. Very large, comfortable space, with friendly staff. Try their sliders...you can order as many or as little as you like, and they range from pulled pork to salmon, and were delicious. Great compliment to a couple flights of cider.
author: Kelly G.

description: Went here on accident and didn't understand the cute name until we saw the menu XD turns out its all hard cider! Felt like I was in Fantastic Mr. Fox! We were exploring the city and found that this place was super cool and definitely something Im gunna revisit during my next san fran trip.
author: Ninny V.

description: This place is the fucking shit. They know all about the poison in GMO's and there food is GMO free. Avoid cancer later in life and dine and drink here!!!!
author: Keyth V.

description: Nice space but the service is almost non-existent and the two guys working at the bar are clueless to their customers and are too busy talking to each other... The food is so/so.  I wouldn't return, several other places that are better.
author: Steve S.

description: Space was huge, so good for big groups. Order at the bar and sit with a number style. Fast service. Good food. Not really a cider girl, but their selection is outrageous. Thankfully they also have beers on the menu, including some kombucha beer which I tried and liked. Great spot to try before heading to a show at Regency Ballroom or Great American.
author: Venice P.

description:
Huge Cider Menu!  This was my first time trying cider, I absolutely loved it!  Their snacks are delicious as well.

We ordered: 
Sauteed Mushroom Flatbread (Mushroom pizza on a very thin crust) - my favorite
 Buffalo fries  -watch out, they're spicy!   It doesn't taste spicy initially but it kicks in after
Sliders (pulled pork & salmon) both were good, a little pricey ($7 per slider)
Cajun Shrimp - Good
Calamari - Good 

One Suggestion - A Happy Hour Menu would be awesome

This is definitely a place to grab a drink with friends and relax.
author: Veronica N.

description: We didn't actually have cider, so this review is for beer and food. The ambiance is pretty nice with cool cider-related decor. The beer selection is decent and small portion plates tasty. The pulled pork flatbread and spinach/gruyere flatbread were super yummy and the garlic fries a hit. The slider was juicy but too small to share /not worth the price since you can't really share. An upstairs space so you can people watch. Though we don't venture to the tenderloin often, pretty cool place to return to.
author: Zara S.

description: Since I don't drink beer, here's the one pub I actually enjoy. Super collection, big open space.
author: Dimple B.

description:
The Upcider has a great concept and room to grow!

Went on Sunday night, it was only half full, and there seemed to be only 2-3 staff on duty.  Service was slow, the ciders were delicious.  Food is overpriced (5.95 for a single slider) and unmemorable (garlic fries tasted just like at a street fair, and the homemade ketchup was not better than Heinz.)  I also wish the ciders were a bit less expensive, and this place would be a big hit with me.  I'll be back to check in in a few months.

On my scale, Upcider gets a 2, but I will probably go back to check in, like I said, because the place is new and the concept has so much potential!

Scale:
1: Would not go back alone and would protest if a friend suggested we go
2: Would not go back alone, but would not protest if a friend suggested we go
3: Would go back happily and willingly alone
author: Lauren J.

description:
Great selection of ciders, and a really chill environment. This is a great place to come for a few drinks on a weeknight, or to get a buzz going before heading to the crazier bars on Polk. 

They have food too, but I haven't gotten the chance to try it. I'll definitely be back.
author: Lauren D.

description:
Came here on Thursday night for HH.  They either didn't have HH pricing or I was too late and completely missed it.  Either way the prices for cider and food were not too bad.  I'm not sure if this is a restaurant or a bar- I would say it's a bar with alot of table seating.  

The cider menu is large and the beer menu is decent.  The food consists of sliders, flat breads, fries, and other appetizers.  I got the mushroom flatbread- it was a little saltier than I like, but good.  

I had two ciders that were recommended to me, after telling the bar tender that I wanted something that tasted like apple juice.  He did a great job picking for me!

The entire place uses square for payment. COOL.
author: Skye W.

description: Tried to give this place a second chance and I was disappointed yet again. I went at a decent time were there was little to no crowd, however the two people working at the bar (Vanessa and Ali) were completely oblivious to our presences when we tried to order. I would understand if it was busy at which point a quick acknowledgment would have been fine, but we stood and were ignored until I finally confronted the manager whose excuse fell flat just like their ciders. The lack of customer service is why I will not return.
author: Newton K.

description: I love ciders so this place was easy to appreciate. Tons of ciders from around the world. Didn't try the food as the menu didn't really call me but the cider was flowing and the Turkish bar keep was friendly. Will be back.
author: Derek C.

description:
When my friends suggested a cider bar, I didn't really know what that would entail. As it happens, I like cider, but wouldn't have described myself as a 'big cider fan' largely because it's just not widely available. I'm no connoisseur. Well. This is the place to become one. I had no idea that there were so many styles of cider being made around the country, and it was really cool to be able to try a bunch and compare. They were all excellent, and we were all guided well by the server. 

The food was also really fun & tasty. I had the kale caesar which I really enjoyed and one of the sliders. We shared the potato souffle, but that's really more of mashed potatoes trying to sound fancier than they are. If the space was a little more welcoming and not so stark, I think I would have warmed to it sooner, but the windows looking out onto the street are pretty fun. I had a very good evening here, and would highly recommend it to anyone even mildly interested in cider. Since going I've been ordering cider much more, so thanks for that Upcider!
author: Colleen L.

description: This is one of my favorite spots!  I love their huge selection of cider and beer, and the food is always great.  The guys who own this place are really cool too.  They actually work here, serving tables or working in the back, so the service is great.  Really a unique place that people should try at least once.
author: Hassan A.

description:
I had a delicious Sour ale, the Bellegems Bruin. The drinks here are fun, different, and vast.

The appetizers were disappointing, very under seasoned and flavorless.
author: Ameer N.

description:
I really, really wanted to like this place. It was recommended by a friend of a very good friend of mine... However, I doubt I'll find myself visiting again any time soon.

As others have commented, the service here is EXTREMELY SLOW.

I went with my husband on Saturday night. It was not very busy at the restaurant. It took about 15 minutes after we sat down before anyone came to take our order. We ordered a 500 mL bottle of cider for... $18. 

It took close to 15 more minutes for the cider to come. The waitress told us she had been busy taking 3 other orders, when actually we could see her chatting with friends nearby. When we asked where the cider was from, we were told "Portland." The waitress wandered off without saying anything else. One look at the back of the bottle, and we notice it says "Product of Sonoma County." Eventually, after about 5 minutes, the waitress came back to tell us it was indeed from Sonoma. Way to know about what you're selling. 

We waited close to another 20 minutes to order another round of drinks, with my husband growing more and more annoyed as the waitress continued to chat with her friends. When she finally came to ask us what else we wanted, we told her "we are out of time, we need the check," which took another 5 minutes to come.

At this point, we had been in the restaurant for about an hour. Totally not worth it for how much the drinks cost here.
author: Jamie G.

description:
I like the crazy amounts of ciders they have here! It's a pretty awesome list of it!

The food here is A-OKAY, but it's not anything I would crave for and go OH MY GOD, I want the ______ from Upcider! 

The ambiance is realllyyyyyy loud, so if you come with friends, prepare to scream to hear the person at the other side of the table. It's probably not the best idea to bring a date either, unless you really don't want to hear him/her talk AT ALL...
author: Jeanette Y.

description:
this place is a hidden gem amidst the pizza, donuts, and bars lining polk street! it's conveniently located right next to the entrance to vertigo and i honestly never noticed it before. came here on a Friday night with a group of 8 girls, and it wasn't too crowded at all. the space is pretty large and dimly lit, and I liked how the tables are all spaced pretty far away from each other so the noise level isn't too crazy. you order your food/drinks at the bar, and the food is delivered to your table. prices are pretty reasonable, $6-10 per appetizer, and around $10 per cider.

we ordered a bunch of random appetizers and bar food (calamari, flatbreads, zucchini cakes, and mac and cheese). the food was pretty standard bar food, not the best but not bad at all. the selection of ciders offered here is almost overwhelming! you would think you could just choose a pear cider and be done, but then you realize that they have 5 types of pear ciders from different vineyards! i'm not super cider savvy, but luckily the bartenders were pretty knowledgeable and open to all our random questions. they even offered us samples of certain ciders to help us with our decisions.

we all had a great time at upcider and would definitely come back again!
author: Caitlin C.

description:
I came back to Upcider with some friends to give it a second chance now that it's been open for a while. It was a little better and if I lived near by or was already in the area, then I'd probably be happier to come here. But for a bit of a trek, I might pass again.

FOOD: sweet potato fries (great!), spinach flatbread (ok), and zucchini cakes (tasted good but a smaller portion than I was expecting). I would probably not come back for food.

DRINKS: I picked an awesome cider (angry orchard - apple ginger, so delicious). They've split up their menu to better show where the ciders are coming from. And there's so many to choose. Thumbs up on selection and my choice.

ENVIRONMENT: The space is big enough that it doesn't feel packed, but just nicely crowded. Acoustics are terrible - it gets so loud for not feeling packed. But the place was definitely lively on a Friday night.

SERVICE: I still had issues with slow service. We were seated right away and once our orders were in, things moved along. But we had to flag someone down to put in our order and it felt like a really long time before they checked in to see if we needed more drinks or food.
author: Kailyn G.

description: The only thing that i can say is "guys, you rock!". You made my San Francisco trip awesome. Best and i guess the only place to drink ciders in downtown. You should also try their delicious Turkish flat bread and the desert.
author: Esra Y.

description: Fun location and a good place for a casual group outing. For food we tried a few of the sliders--the fried chicken, Cajun chicken, and the spicy lamb. We also tried the Turkish flatbread and the buffalo fries. I thought the food was a bit pricey and not great. The buffalo fries were very, very blue-cheesy; and somewhat soggy as fries tend to be when you coat them in a wet sauce. The turkish flatbread was strongly seasoned; overall it was the best thing we ordered food-wise. The sliders were just okay. Where this place really shines is the cider. While I wouldn't really recommend going hungry, if you love cider this place is for you. Unfortunately, they don't have a lot of cider on tap, but they do have a large number of bottled ciders. I'll definitely be visiting this place again to grab a few drinks. Overall, it was a pleasant experience.
author: Justin H.

description:
YES! FINALLY! 
 After going to several bars/restaurants and being told the only hard cider options were Wyder's (blech!) or nothing, I finally found my heaven. What a wonderful place this is. We took the steps to the gateway of my happy place and my eyes landed on the best cider menu I have ever seen. Sure, some of the ciders were "drop-on-the-floor" expensive, but that's why you get the good stuff that is nice and cheap. Take Strongbow, for instance. A wonderful dry cider that was just $5 a bottle. 
 I honestly could have cared less how the food tasted, so imagine my surprise when everything we ordered was spot on and absolutely delicious. The potato soufle was superb; by far the best mashed potatoes I have ever had. Next time I visit (and there will be a next time) I'm gonna ask for two of those suckers. The pesto potato pizza was also very tasty, but my boyfriend polished it off before I could so much as breathe in a sliver of it. I ordered the Mac & Cheese with crispy bacon and I thought it was VERY good. Not too cheesy, pasta cooked just right with the bacon not overpowering the dish. To end off the meal we ordered the Caramel Bread Pudding. Once they scraped me off the ceiling (it was that good), I had to be restrained from making out with the chef. Everything was just so perfect! I left on such a buzzed high that I didn't even mind the homeless guy who berated us the entire way to our car for not giving him a quarter for "a peep show."
 Ask for the server Ari. A wonderful guy who treats his customers like royalty. He truly was excellent and I hope he is still there when we return. He made our night so much more enjoyable and was just fun to talk with. 
 Now go. GO to Upcider! NOW!
author: Melissa T.

description: BIG menu of ciders, interesting+fancy bar food menu. Chill and sophisticated, it's fun to watch the upper Tenderloin on the street below. For food, place is more like $$.5 or $$$, than $$.
author: Pedro G.

description:
5 stars if you're only coming for the cider. 3 stars if you decide to eat something.

They have three pages of apple and pear ciders! The imported ones from Germany and other parts of Europe are reasonably priced for a bar and each cider has a brief description. I've seen maybe half of these ciders before at various bars and Whole Foods but never so many in one place! (Try the Woodchuck from Oregon. My favorite.)

Sadly, the food doesn't live up to the cider selection (or the excellent service.) The sweet potato fries with blueberry ketchup are unbalanced with too much Cajun spice masking the flavor of everything. The meatballs in red sauce are delightful, though only 3 meatballs come with each serving. The warm spinach salad with mushrooms reminded me of spinach drowned in cream of mushroom, which isn't as terrible as it sounds but isn't surprisingly excellent either.

It gets noisy and crowded in here but there are nice seats along the large window where you can watch Polk Street go by... (watch people park in front of the two hydrants in front of the restaurant all night long.)

I'd come here again for a snack and apple based beverage but I'd be harder pressed (no pun intended) to make a meal here again.
author: Alexander J.

description: I'm glad plenty of people like this place, so they'll hopefully stay in business. Unfortunately, I was pretty disappointed with the Turkish flatbread--it just wasn't very exciting at all. And the $15 (11.2 oz.) bottle of cider was beyond overpriced--even most badass cocktails elsewhere don't cost that much. Also, what a missed opportunity to not have any ciders on tap. The servers are very friendly though.
author: Maximillian M.

description: This bar is one of my favorites! I love this place. I always go to sample each cider/ food and each time I'm completely satisfied.
author: Yvette R.

description:
Who knew I like Cider? Thank you Upcider for opening! I have been 2x and still like the place. Its more of a pre-game, girlnights, let's catch up first before rallying it up for the night kind of place. 

Nice date spot too! I will be back again!

Music too loud and wish they had a lounge area as suppose to one big open space. Separate by a wall or plants? something!
author: Rebecca M.

description:
I've been here a couple times for an after work bite/drink and the food is good as well as the selection of cider... Actually that's the best part..so much cider!!!
So, when one of my coworkers wants to do her good bye party here we thought that was a great idea!.. Unfortunately we found that the service was really non existent and the place was half empty! The waitress rarely came by and never checked on us. Many of our group wanted more cider but after an hour of being ignored we decided to get the check and go else where and we literally had to walk up to the waitress and get the check...then we discovered that an automatic 20 percent gratuity had been added ..Wow.. we really felt that we were neglected because we were a large party and she was going to get her tip regardless.
As always the cider and  food was good but  in a city where there are so many awesome places to eat that just isn't enough. This place needs to step up there service.
author: Christina W.

description: Love upcider. 5 pages of different kind of ciders, nice space on the 2nd floor overlooking Sutter and Polk intersection. Nice meeting spot, does not get too crowded.
author: Lena R.

description: Amazing, extensive selection of ciders! Despite the name, I could not believe the variety of ciders that are on the menu. The food is good too--I recommend the caramel bread pudding with mint whipped cream!
author: Dhwani T.

description: Chose this place for dinner before a weeknight show at Regency Ballroom. Arrived and it was fairly empty. They have a great selection of ciders. The menu was scanty and unimpressive but we chose a pulled pork flatbread and a meatball dish for dinner.  We proceeded to watch the establishment fill & have the surrounding tables (who ordered after us) receive their food. Waited 40 minutes before we inquired about our order and then watched them scramble to produce it for us. No explanations, apology, or acknowledgment of their error. The food itself was bland and not worth the wait. We won't be returning.
author: ali r.

description:
A good selection of ciders, and the waiter was knowledgeable in helping us pick out ones we would like.  However, it would have been nice to have at least a few selections on draft rather than everything being in bottles.

We tried the sweet potato fries, which were super delicious (especially the spicy blueberry ketchup they came with - sounds weird, but it was awesome).

However, we were definitely put off by the service.  Despite there being maybe 3-4 tables and at least 4-5 waitstaff we could see, the service was painfully slow.  How long does it take to grab a bottle from the back?!  We spotted waitstaff drinking/hanging out behind the bar, gchatting on a computer that faced the dining area, and generally ignoring us while we waited in vain for the bill.  

I also wasn't a huge fan of the decor, although obviously this is a matter of taste - it was a little too intentionally 'trendy' for me.
author: Sara C.

description: Crazy variety of cider (I'm talking like 3 pages of just cider). The bar itself is also super chill, and it wasn't too busy when I went, though I imagine everyone was watching the Giants game at a bar with a TV. I'm a fan of the decor -- definitely has a hipster vibe to it.
author: Becky L.

description: Came here for my birthday with a bunch of my coworkers.  It was pretty empty when we came here and it was around 6pm.  I kind of liked that b/c it felt like the whole place was to ourselves.  Their well known for their alcoholic ciders.  I had the pineapple cider which according to our server, was one of their most popular drinks.  We ordered alot of sides since it was on the company - kale salad, mushrooms on toasted bread, meatballs with bread, garlic fries, buffalo fries and mac and cheese.  All were pretty good.  We also had the spinach and gargonzola flat bread which was also pretty good.  This place is pretty good for a casual hangout with friends/coworkers.
author: Jonathan L.

description: Cool second floor bar and restaurant with a great selection of ciders. The Upsliders are amazing too! Nice atmosphere and friendly staff, I'll certainly be back.
author: Peter W.

description: Out with a group looking for a place on Polk to eat before we saw a movie at the AMC Theaters and we stumbled upon this amazing place! The service was top notch and the creative menu was delicious! The sweet potato fries are some of the best I have ever tried especially with the blueberry ketchup! Never really tried cider before, but now I am a big fan! The staff will help you find the best cider for your taste.
author: Therese V.

description: They have so many ciders to choose from. This is my version of heaven. Can't wait to come back again
author: Lisa M.

description: If you don't know about Turkish hospitality, you don't know about hospitality. Omer gave me a serving of his personal soup creation. Delicious! And let's not forget about the mac 'n cheese. Bomb!
author: Martin M.

description: Great Bar, Good Place, good vibe.  Very chill and nice staff
author: Daniel D.

description: The first cider bar in the city. Great selection of cider and delicious complimentary food. Try flatbread.
author: Monica G.

description: Good selection of cider, obviously - and great for people watching (seating along the windows) and friendly service. It gets kind of dark though, especially near the restrooms.
author: Kira G.

description: Best place to drink and talk. It has a beautiful atmosphere and energy. Owners are so friendly.
author: Heather Y.

description: I love hard cider but it's always a struggle to find a place to get a good craft cider. In comes UpCider. Here you'll find pages upon pages of ciders from around the world, some of which were the most unique and tasty ciders I've had. Food is good as well but more for snacking rather than a meal. This place looses a star for no draft options for cider or beer. I understand that draft cider is harder to find but at least have some taps of your local apple goodness!
author: Brian B.

description: Great sliders and mushroom flatbread. Good atmosphere and a nice view out of the windows. Good place to bring friends, especially if they're into cider.
author: Olga A.

description:
So far, so great!! We ordered the special slider (grilled eggplant), special flatbread (kale, toms, red onions), the buffalo fries, & fried chicken slider with a Thistly Cross ginger cider. The sliders came on brioche buns, which made the fried chicken taste sort of like chicken & waffles (a win in our book). The eggplant was perfectly done and came with a Goldilocks amount of goat cheese (juuust right).  They brought the kale salad instead of the flatbread by mistake, but graciously allowed us to keep it--and it turned out to be one of our favorites. Simple but tasty! The flatbread was like a very thin crust pizza. All the food was flavorful, a really fun experience. 

The ambience really picked up over the almost 2 hours we were here.  By 830 it was pretty loud, but the patrons all seemed nice enough, and the staff was unflaggingly friendly & helpful.
author: S H.

description:
Went here at 5:30 on a Friday night with a group of 6. Nice views of the street out the huge windows, a lot of fun ciders to try and an interesting menu. Servers were nice, lamb slider was tasty and a good portion for a slider, sweat potato fries were bland, cool and needed salt. I asked for salt but no one ever brought it. Blueberry ketchup was weird, cold blueberry jam with a slight ketchup flavor.

My major complaint is that it was FREEZING inside. I get it, huge windows on a cold SF night = cold inside but turn the heat on. I live in an old drafty SF building with big windows too. I turn the heat on. Everyone in the bar was wearing their wool coats trying to stay warm. I asked if they could turn the heat on. They did not. We left after two drinks each simply because we were too cold to stay. There was no discernible difference in temperature when we went outside. 

I might go back during the summer.
author: Janell H.

description: Wow Louisa!!! Shawnacy 40th bday was a blast. Thanks fr the great night. Amazing portobello sliders !!! Unbelievable tasty. The mushroom pizza and kale salad were surprisingly healthy and nom nom nom.
author: Neil D.

description: I love Upcider it's the perfect place to take friends, family or go on a hot date.
author: Candice B.

description: Such an amazing place !! They have wonderful cider from all over the world. Sliders are amazing too.
author: Faruk Sahin B.

description: Terrible. $6.95 for frozen fast food fries tossed in buffalo sauce. In a city known for great food, an absolute joke. An old office building of sorts converted into a joke of a modern "bar food done right", spot. Must be making a killing from all the frozen, pre packaged items that are priced as freshly prepared options. Go back to being a trashy club.
author: Christian C.

description: Such a cool awesome place, they have a wide variety of ciders from all over the world. I tried one from Ireland and it was semi sweet, it was perfect for me! The view was great! Love the large windows. Will be coming back!
author: Tiff W.

description: Great long tables for groups to hang out.  Nice idea with everyone having to get drinks at the bar which eliminates the who owes what for what group tab.  Service is great all around.  All in all a good spot.
author: Daniel Y.

description: Good selection of ciders. I enjoyed the pulled pork slider. I didn't like the buffalo fries but I'm not a big fan of blue cheese so that may be just me. Service was underwhelming.
author: Joffrey F.

description: Upcider is the ONLY bar I go to in San Francisco. I've tried different bars in San Francisco, but I always end up going to Upcider. The atmosphere is very laid-back and relaxing. It's a great place to hang out with friends. The bar isn't too loud and packed.The decoration is really cute. I love the blue lights and the tree branches. The shadow of the braches casted on the celling is just beautiful. They have the best cider beers and good quality bar food. They recently carry three brands of pumpkin ciders for a limited time.I tried the Ace pumkin cider. And it was AMAZING. Ace pumpkin cider almost tastes like a pumpkin spice soda. It's very sweet and tasty. I highly recommend it if you are crazy for pumpkins! I've also tried quite a few other ciders. And they are all good. It's definitely the best cider beer bar in San Francisco.
author: Annie Y.

description:
A couple of us fatties came here one night to check it out. It's a lovely second floor space with long windows overlooking Polk street. It's an excellent place for people watching. You have the colorful characters below, and then of course, the restaurant patrons. 
They specialize in ciders, but it was the food I was fixated on. We got the spicy lamb sliders, mushroom herbed toast, creole shrimp and meatballs. While everything was deemed to be delicious, the creole shrimp was the star of the evening. The shellfish was done to firm perfection, and the creole sauce was creamy spicy goodness. The flavor explosion in your mouth definitely warrants another go round. 
Service was a tad bit slow, but we were not left hanging. BTW, did I mention that they play the best music here? Any place that plays the Smiths and Joy Division is a hands down winner in my book. They do close early, so get here at the start of your night and then get your dance on at any of the fine establishments in Polk Gulch.
author: Zehra A.

description:
I love this place. Amazing variety of ciders. I will have to come back over and over to try a bunch. Tonight I had the Fox Valley Blackberry Pear. Sweet but not cloying. Crisp and refreshing. The food was great too - loved the kale Caesar salad. And the meatballs were delicious - the sauce orgasmic served with tasty bread to sop up the last drop.

Also, I dined alone and they were very attentive. Sometimes dining alone can feel awkward from a service point of view, but not here. The ambience was lovely. The crowd ranged from hipsters to middle aged couples and groups. It had a cozy vibe, and  nice window views of the bustling street scene below. 

I will be back. I recommend it highly.
author: Pidge M.

description: The boyfriend and I went here several weeks ago, but I still keep thinking about how much we enjoyed ourselves. Not only do they have tons of ciders on their menu, they also have beer and wine. Our favorite ciders were the habanero cider and the whisky cask cider. On top of their cider, I really enjoyed the food and the view. The walls are floor to ceiling windows! In San Francisco, this is almost better than outside because you're warm! We also had the pleasure of meeting meeting the owner. He seemed like a great guy. My only piece of advice would be that the more people you go with, the more you can sample. They don't have anything on tap, so there are no cider flights. But no matter who you go with, this place is worth your time.
author: Hayley T.

description: Finally got to check this place out and was really surprised with the variety of ciders they had! I knew it was a cider place but was stoked to try some new things (2-3 pages of options). Came on a Thursday night and it was actually pretty chill and not crowded. The sliders are awesome along with all the other small plates. Nice vibe, good food, awesome selection, and friendly staff (helpful when it came to suggestions). May be my new go-to spot.
author: Colleen G.

description: So I went to Upsider for the first time ever. And I can't believe I have never been there before. Its kinda hidden away, like so many of the awesome places in SF. They have great food and drinks selection. Because it is hidden it doesn't get crazy super packed, but not dead; which a plus for me.
author: Michelle L.

description: Cider selection is good. It took 20 minutes to get an order of fries on a night when there were 7 tables there with 3 waiters. When we asked when they would be ready, they said it depends on what you ordered. It was fries! Also, it took at least 5 minutes for a bartender to even look at us. They were cleaning the board, checking phones, etc. Not coming back here again!
author: Lauren C.

description: The drink selection was great for such a casual location. I thoroughly enjoyed the food and loved the atmosphere. I had a great experience with the location for a large birthday party. The food came out pretty fast too.
author: Albert S.

description: Great little upstairs spot. Very clean restaurant with great views of surrounding nightlife. The menus are great with nice easy descriptions of the ciders and food. Great selection.. The food was pretty tasty it's all a good deal except for the sliders. I'll definitely be back!
author: Nick M.

description:
Not a big fan of this place. . . oh, I wanted to love it so much though!  I mean, just give me ONE bar on upper polk, right?  But alas...

In the end, the food is a greasy, the drink selection ain't great (unless you're into cider), and the ambiance is best described as "meh."
author: M G.

description: Great cider and desserts, but bad waitressing and sit down policy.  One waitress gave me an especially hard time about sitting down at an empty table that I saw open, saying that I needed to "put my name on the list."  After inquiring further to put my name on the list, one of the cashiers told me that I could sit anywhere I wanted, and that she was probably having a bad day.  I was aghast at his reply.  The drink servings at Upcider is so good that I would probably go again, but that is definitely not a way to treat a customer.
author: Mary N.

description: After MONTHS of trying to get my boyfriend to take me to Upcider, we finally went! I dread going out to the city because of the parking/idiot drivers. We went on a week night and parking was easy to find. We walked in and felt pretty relaxed. I couldn't wait to get a window seat! I'm not much of a drinker but I do love hard cider. The drinks were delicious and the food was great as well. The calamari and mac n cheese were BOMB. Best date night I've had in a while! We'll definitely be back!
author: Danielle B.

description: Amazing selection of ciders! We tried a wide variety of the food offered and all of them were great. The Turkish flatbread is a must try!
author: Funda K.

description:
I came here for the cider selection and a few bites to eat, but ended up eating dinner here. Great food.

We liked the shrimp and the Turkish flatbread (don't forget to squeeze on some lemon juice if you order it!). Loved the eggplant slider; it should be a permanent addition to the menu.

This place is a tad expensive.
author: Craig D.

description: Great selection of cider, great people watching spot. Love it!
author: James S.

description: Though I am not a huge cider fan, I can really appreciate the seriously huge menu Upcider boasts, followed by a comprehensive beer list (which includes Racer 5 IPA, yes!).  I love that they have stools lining the entire perimeter of the second story windows, so you can people watch below.  A perfect date spot, or bar crawl stop with a large group of friends.
author: Josie S.

description: This place has an excellent selection of cider, but it is a bit pricey.  I thought the food was just so-so, though.  Somewhat disappointing, but I would go back if friends wanted to go there.
author: Scott E.

description:
Let's talk about the food too! 

I had crispy sweet potato fries with unique blueberry ketchup. The combo was unexpectedly yummy and I'm a former student at the International Culinary Institute!  

 I also tried three different flat breads: spinach, calamari and mushroom. The vote's  a three-way tie!  

The atmosphere is comfy and friendly with a Western look that compliments the cider menu.  

I'll be back :-)
author: Belita A.

description: Pretty cool spot.  Tried the zucchini cakes and they were delicious.  I have been twice for just a beverage and I must say the service is very good.  I would definitely go back and try some more of their small plates.  I hope this place is able to stay in the neighborhood because it really does add some flavor to lower Polk.
author: Kirsten M.

description: Great vibe on the second floor. The beer selection is pretty good and the ciders are super impressive. Make sure to ask for the poutine.
author: Brian S.

description: They have a huge selection of ciders from all per the world so everyone in your party should find something. The food is decent  but not much variety. The place is pretty big so it never feels crowded :).
author: A. R.

description:
The food was fine.  The drink was fine.

The service?  What service?  You order at the bar (and on a busy night like tonight, that means waiting 20min to order drinks, then 20min more for apps, then 20min more for more drinks .... you get the picture).  And in this -large- restaurant, that means somebody gets nominated to -not- spend their evening with their friends, instead waiting at the bar to be noticed and order.

To add insult to injury, the tip percentages were 18%, 20%, and something-or-other more.  Me, I wanted to leave 'em 10%, but since the Square app doesn't show you the bill amount on the tip page, I gave up and just gave 'em 18%

But no, I won't ever go there again.  Because what did they do to earn their tip?  Deliver my food?  Really?  that's all?
author: Chet M.

description: I'm a huge cider fan and was really excited to find a place that had so many to offer. This place  has a huge cider menu as well as appetizers and bread pudding for dessert. The food and ciders were both really good! The only qualm for me is the price, each cider is a minimum of $13, with some being much more expensive than that. So it's more than the price of a decent meal without the meal part. But the opportunity to try so many ciders is definitely unique! And the food we tried was very good.
author: Ashley C.

description: Really cool interior, and unique/slightly hidden location. I ordered a kale salad and added a crumbled burger on top for protein - they obliged and it was delicious! Nice wine and beer selection as well.
author: Lauren D.

description: Excellent service waiter was more then helpfully!  music and food was good.  And the cider was wow!!!
author: Timmy B.

description: Upcider has a great selection of cider but they also have a other beverages such as, beer and wine but the list is average. The atmosphere is cool, great for groups and they also have some appetizers to much onin the mean time. Upcider is located on corner of Polk street and its on the second floor of the building, and has windows surrounding half the place with a bunch of seating along the edge of window panel.
author: Migz T.

description: Amazing food and great selection of ciders! The owners are super friendly and have great recommendations. Definitely going here again.
author: Meghan O.

description:
Don't come here

Unless you're looking for a different drink menu and really good service. My group of 7 rolled in at 11pm to escape the over served masses on Polk. What we found was a varied menu if ciders that range from super sweet to very dry - and even a delicious ginger kombucha beer packing an 8% kick.  The bartender gave me a run down on the menu and helped me carry my order back to my table. Recommended.
author: Greg K.

description: Fun place to hang out and some food and drinks before going out some where. Super chill envirnoment
author: Vishal V.

description:
The upside to the cleverly named Upcider is, well, the cider.  I have mixed feelings about this spot so will try to separate the good from the bad in a balanced manner.

Let's start with the actual space.  It's a cool idea - a large upstairs space with two walls of windows and a nice window bar overlooking Polk and Sutter - but they really fail on the esthetic execution.  When you reach the top of the stairs you could be in any generic office space trying to decide if the dentist is to the right or to the left.  Not warm at all, but very dark...black walls, black carpet, etc.  Upcider itself is very spacious and you can tell that an attempt was made to turn a mediocre space into an acceptable dining spot.  Unfortunately, they don't quite make it.  The large space is cavernous so the acoustics are terrible, making it difficult to have a conversation, and while we were there the music was way to dance-mixey and loud for the attempted atmosphere.  The bar to the right was the warmest part of the space and, I thought, quite inviting, but since we had a group of four, a table was more practical.   So, I'd give the atmosphere 1.5 stars.

Once the service got rolling, it was exceptional.  It took a while for our server to initially approach our table, but once she did, she and the other servers, were very attentive and patient with our in depth perusal of the encyclopedic cider list.  This is a minor thing, but I think it would be a nice touch if the servers were knowledgeable about the cider menu so that they could answer questions and make recommendations.  Overall, I'd give the service 4 stars.

I loved the menu and thought the food was outstanding.  I have read some reviews here panning the food, so I don't know if there has been improvement there or if we just have differing tastes, but I thought the food was one of the highlights of the experience.  Everything on the menu (except for one item) is $9.95 or less, and we found everything we tried to be delicious from the sweet potato fries with blueberry ketchup, to the zucchini patties with yogurt sauce all the way through the daily special of bacon-laced mac and cheese.
