Definitely not food for those on a diet, but truly some creative and delicious comfort food here.  The food gets a solid 4.5 stars.

Saving the best for last!  The cider menu gets a full 5 stars!  It was comprehensive, offered ciders across a range of prices ($5 - $38/bottle), included helpful descriptions that were pretty accurate, and alcohol content.  If you are a cider fan, or want to learn more about the art of ciders and try sampling them, this is a home run!  I did find myself wishing they had tasting flights, but when we asked for tasting glasses for the table so we could do our own sampling they were promptly and happily delivered.

Overall, if you don't mind a sterile environment that is acoustically challenged, you'll dig this place.  Go for the cider and stay for the food.
author: Stacy H.

description: What a great place!  A friend picked it out because he'd just brewed his own first batch of cider, and wanted to see what they had to offer.  They've been open ~6 mo and one of the main guys was our server.  He knew his stuff, and worked with us for 15 minutes picking out *the perfect* ciders for our tastes.  While my husband can always find a microbrewery to try, having a mostly cider menu for me is a real treat.  Definitely worth a try--and the garlic fries and portobello sliders are kick-butt!
author: Jennifer B.

description: Food not very good.. Overpriced and kind of a boring place to go. Only upside were the quick and nice servers
author: Anastasia P.

description: If you're looking for a good Belgium beer or a cider this is the place. If you're looking for a 5 star Gastropub go to Stock and Trade in the Marina. The Mac & cheese here is mediocre at best and the sliders were overdone and dry.
author: Monique L.

description: Nice ambiance: I had the spinach and gruyere flatbread, which was a good snack. The strong flavor of the cheese went along well with one of the sweeter ciders. Love all the variety of ciders; this place made me wish that stores carried more than just the usual apple and pear!
author: Amanda A.

description: I've been obsessed with gastropubs lately and when I saw this new location open up on Polk I had to check it out. Flatbread and sweet potato fries were meh, but the potato soufflé  was delicious. Cider flights are available so it was a great way to try a few different types. I would be back for the nice view of Polk St, beers/ciders, but would pass on the food next time. Once the secret is out, I can see this place being getting more lively!
author: Vivian D.

description:
Upcider had such a wide range of ciders, a good big space, so if you had a large group it would be great. We went during happy hour (on a Tuesday) it wasn't  very busy. I had the mac & cheese which was yum but a little oily.
The staff were very friendly and helpful.
author: Wendy C.

description: Salmon slider, spinach salad (over dressed), and calamari (yuck). Despite that the first two were good. 3.5 stars
author: Jenny B.

description: This is my 2nd 5 star review to date: 5 stars for excellent service, great food, large cider selection, and reasonable prices.  So, this joint just opened about a month ago and I am a fan.  I went as a party of 4, a double date with another couple.  We ordered about half their menu + 3 ciders.  We paid $120 with a 20% tip and had leftovers (that sadly got donated by my boyfriend to a nice homeless man).  Everything we ordered was made to order and served hot & fresh.  This is rare for me to say but I was most impressed with their homemade ketchup because I usually hate homemade ketchup.
author: Linda W.

description:
I wasn't so keen on ciders, or didn't know much about them until I found out that there were so many varieties at Upcider! I didn't even know ciders had 5-6% alcohol and taste better then beer :) 

When me and couple of friends went to Upcider to try some ciders, we also tried some food from their menu. The salmon and bbq pulled pork sliders were great, mushroom flatbread was amazing. 

It's a fun, friendly environment, definitely to try out if you are around Polk street. And wanna have some good food while at the same time drinking!

Especially on Thursday, Friday, Sat nights, it's a great spot for people watching, from above ! ;) and to escape the crazy drunk crowds on the street while enjoying food, drinks and good conversations..
author: Simin A.

description: Amazing new and hip joint. Get the sweet hard cider and the amazing sliders. All of them are so incredibly good, and the spicy lamb was my favorite. Come here with a crowd of your friends!
author: Dak R.

description: Finally a bar/restaurant that carries a variety of CIDERS and not BEERS. This is definitely my kind of drink. They are pretty reasonable if you get the more common ciders, like Crispin. Otherwise, you can try the more expensive brands as well. Nice atmosphere and clean bathrooms!
author: Michelle L.

description: Just stumbled onto this place while walking down Polk to a movie.  Great concept, fun atmosphere and a very impressive cider menu.  Everything we ordered was great with a special shout out to the Buffalo Fries and the Grilled Portobello Sliders.
author: K W.

description: You continue to amaze me Upcider.  I love your drink selection, your food selection and everyone working there.  One of the best places to eat and drink on lower Polk.
author: Corey V.

description:
I stumbled on this little gem the other night and after taking a quick peak inside, I knew I needed to come back for some eats! I met a friend there and we sat down to watch Polk Street come to life. We ordered the pulled pork slider, and it was so good, we ordered another! Good crunch, nice bit of spice, yummy slaw, fresh bun, and good balance. We got the potato souffle, which was kind of like a mini shepherd's pie; ground beef, whipped potato, and a slight layer of cheese baked on top. Delish! We had to throw a healthy option in there and went for the kale Caesar salad. So much healthier than a regular Caesar, extra crunch from the kale, great garlicky dressing, and house made croutons. Super good!  
Oh right,... the cider! We chose one for a fun name and it was a sweeter variety, but good. For our second helping, we asked for a drier option and they recommended a raspberry cider. It had quite a nose on it. Good strong fruit in the nose, but dry on the palate. Just what we were hoping for!
The guys who work there were super helpful and really welcoming. The atmosphere was clean and modern feeling with wood touches that give the space warmth. The quality of the meat is all grass fed, and the herbs are freshly grown by the chef. Reasonable prices, and it fills a cider niche that I haven't seen in the city before. Clearly we needed this place! The bar is concrete with a cool finish on it, and as I mentioned before, there is a panoramic view of Polk Street where you can watch the "show" without having to be in it! I'll be back again soon!
author: Tei G.

description: A group of friends came with me here and I joked that this place had to be a collective hallucination: great music provided by the U2 fan of our group, great cider conjured up by the former Samuel Adams employee, great decor provided by my wife, and Pay with Square provided by myself. We had a great time and tried each others' very different ciders. Very friendly staff and floor to ceiling windows make for good people watching.
author: Brian D.

description: Definitely a great addition to Polk Street. I was pretty excited to hear about a place with so many cider options, although a bit disappointed to find there wasn't anything on tap and the prices were ridiculously high (seriously they ranged from about $6-$35 for a normal to large sized bottle). I really wanted to try the ice cider, but didn't want to pay what I'd normally pay for an entire bottle of wine. Service was a bit slow and timid, they ran out of the macaroni&cheese special and it wasn't even 8PM, and portions are small so I wouldn't necessarily recommend coming for dinner, but all in all a light and airy atmosphere with plenty of space between tables and great views of Polk below.
author: Natalie H.

description: I thought I hated cider because I'm a man and my manliness would be threatened by cider sipping... Well, I'm thankfully very wrong and it turns out that I love cider. My favorite is the honey crisp cider. The food was 4 star worthy and the seating also a 4. However, the selection of ciders was at a 10! Thus, it receives a 5 all around. I'd like to live there but I'm sure they'd say no...
author: Joshua M.

description: only came for the cider. looooved the vibe. fun view. deeeelicious ciders!
author: D L.

description: Cool place with a huge selection of cider, and at decent prices as well.  Food was decent and interesting if not amazing - skip the flatbread and go for the sliders for sure.  Place had ambience of a bar, but was setup more like a restaurant.
author: Hapy M.

description: Wow! Who knew? Great new restaurant!  Ciders with alcohol? This is new to me but it was fantastic. Tried a few of them. Each were great! The staff was super friendly and accomodating! The food was phenomenal! Buffalo fries, Turkish flatbread, the meatballs, salmon slider, chicken, pulled pork, spicy lamb, sweet potato fries with blueberry ketchup..culinary heaven!!  All the meats from Marin Sun Farms and pasture raised. It was sooo sooo good. I left full and happy and can't wait to go back again.
author: Georgianne T.

description: New idea, interesting style, courteous staff, ambient atmosphere - what else one would need? Ah, right, right - the Cider! Yummmyyy! Totally loved a few from their extensive collection! Way to go guys! wish you the best luck, and i WILL come back again :)
author: Kri H.

description: The whole idea of a bar that caters to cider is delightful to me.  They have the normal ciders and then the fancy ciders.  This place definitely caters to the fancier ciders, which I suppose is most logical.  Most of all, I love how they have made cider classy by having such a perfectly lit and organized space.  The upstairs location and name pun are pluses as are the massive people watching windows.  My only complaint is that they don't carry any South African ciders.  Though that is a small complaint to have.
author: Jeremy G.

description: Came here with a friend last night after checking out the MOMA count down..... we came after 7, just missing the happy hour but it was all good. This is a nice large space... it got progressively louder, but I would come again. I had the kale salad and the spinach/gruyere flatbread. My friend had the pulled pork sandwich on a cabbage roll. Very fun with a nice staff.
author: Patricia M.

description: Place is too big. Amazing selection of ciders. I only like this place because it's where I first met my boyfriend!
author: Jocelle A.

description: This place is incredibly inviting and has such an extensive, and fantastic menu of ciders, beers, wines, etc! The food menu is delicious! Ozzie and the rest of the staff are so warm and informative and the ambiance is unparalleled! Find your perfect cider here and relax with such a well designed, comfortable environment and excellent staff! What a jem-- Definitely the best new neighborhood bar! Will be frequenting often. :)
author: Rachel W.

description:
Living in London, and not being a beer drinker, quickly got me into cider so I was excited when I saw this place opened.  Pretty good list of ciders, wide range of prices, and what I had was all really good. The service was good, much better than expected after reading some of the reviews - our waitress came over frequently enough, our drinks and food came quickly, the guy who appeared to be the owner checked on us, so all in all, good. I felt like our waitress could have known a bit more about cider though. For most coming in, they're not going to know what to choose so the waitstaff should really be the experts on tastes, flavors, etc. I asked specific questions and I could tell the girl was trying, but couldn't give me a good description of any of them.

Food-wise, we ordered the gruyere and spinach flatbread (good, but a bit heavy on the garlic), the chicken slider (really tasty) and the cajun shrimp which was 5 shrimp with a lot of sauce and crostini. Overall everything was pretty good and prices were decent, maybe the shrimp was a little over-priced. It would be great if they did happy hour specials too - maybe they do, we arrived about 6:45pm.

overall a cool place, but they should definitely hype up the cider thing since it's what they're known for and have their waitstaff educate people on the differences.
author: Lauren M.

description:
Having lived in Bristol, England for a year where cider is a religion amongst the locals......my girlfriend acquired quite the taste for this fermented apple juice.
On arrival in the bar come restaurant.....it's all very stark. They have a huge space and they look like they don't know what to do with it. My girlfriend remarked that it looked like the remodel done on an episode of 'Restaurant Impossible'...i.e. "Done on the cheap!"
But still let's give it a chance....it's the cider we are here for.....though the place really lacked ambience for a Saturday night, especially having been featured the week before on numerous SF blogs.

The cider selection itself was pretty outstanding, with a large variety stemming from England, Spain, Ireland and the United States.
Unfortunately of the 3 barmen who served us, none had any sound knowledge of the product that the bar was named for.
Seriously.....why base a bar on a certain style of drink and then not train your barstaff to know that drink. 
Once bar lady had to ask us to point to the drink on the menu so that she could write it down as she did not know the names when we spoke them to her......just all around very amateur.

Drinks were confusingly labelled with their bottle sizes in imperial or metric measures, making it hard to judge (unless your now how many ml to an oz) and the prices varied from $5 for a cider you can buy at Safeway to $26 for a special import from the Basque Country, Spain.

We didn't sample the food here (we came around 9.30pm), so we cannot comment but what we saw looked appetizing. 

The killer moment of the night came as we realized that they were playing Queen's Greatest Hits over the soundsystem.

After asking for the check twice and waiting 20 minutes....we left.

"We are the Champions"......not at all.
author: Jake S.

description: Lamb sliders were the bomb diggity... Was not in the mood to drink but the bar menu looked really good.  Me and my date sat along the window and had a really good view while we ate. Our server was the bartender so there really wasn't much service but other than that I really liked the place.
author: Ryan R.

description:
I went here the other night with two other people, and we all had to agree that it was just "meh".

The cider selection is great, and both the sweet potato and garlic fries were great, but the sliders and the potato flatbread were extremely bland. I had the blackened salmon sliders; not only were they under-seasoned but they were incredibly dry and there wasn't any sort of sauce to remedy the situation.

Would I come here again for the cider and the fries? Yes. But I don't think I'll be back for anything more than a drink and fries.
author: Jan R.

description: A neat place with many many ciders to choose from. I got to taste many different ciders from the rest of our group. There is something for everyone ranging from sweet to super dry. Also had the sweet potato fries with blueberry sauce. The sauce was so-so but the fries were done well. I'll have to come back for more food and drinks in the future.
author: John H.

description: I love cider so I had high expectations for this bar. It's quiet, big, spacious and full of unlimited number of cider choices. The table service was also quite fanatstic. My only complaint is that the seats are all wood so if you want to hang out all night it's not the most comfortable and inviting place. Kind of cold too.
author: Cassy R.

description: Good first experience, VERY noisy and hard to hear other people at my table. Great selection, wished the servers gave some more guidance on the selection. Buffalo fries are AMAZING.
author: Amber M.

description: The entrance was blocked by drunken chain smokers from the club next door. but after getting up there it was fun.
author: Michael T.

description: love it, love it, love it! best ciders I have every had and the staff educated the crap out of me and cider.. this place is a cider addicts dream come true!
author: Andy N.

description: Great cider selection and decent food. Worth a try!
author: Kalie M.

description:
Been looking forward to trying this place, but honestly I expected better. 

Good:
-The peppered salmon slider was delish!
-Great selection of ciders
-The service- patient and lots of suggestions for what you're feeling for.

Not so great:
-Kale salad - got it b/c of good yelp reviews, but ours was drenched with so much mayo that we basically did not taste the kale at all. Sad.
-Turkish flat bread - Okay seasoning, but ground lamb/beef was more of a mush. Decent, but wouldn't get it again. 

For a drink and snack, this is a good place. For dinner, not so much.
author: Jenny L.

description: I love me some cider!  Downside is that there only in bottles, no draft.  Also, it would be good if there were a strong selection of other drinks, as not everyone is as big of a fan of cider as I am.  The food (don't remember what I had) was ok, but not great.  Really liked the atmosphere inside.
author: Angela R.

description: This bar was amazing! If you're a cider fan, the list goes on for 3 pages! If you're not, there's still a great selection of beer and wine. And the food, wow, I did a happy dance every time we tried something new. My mouth waters when I think about the potato hash soufflé. The beet salad was probably the best salad I had the whole trip, really fresh with a good portion of ingredients. We also shared the zucchini cakes with pickled lemon rind and bbq pulled pork pizza, delicious! The atmosphere was fun and trendy. Try to get a seat at the window- really great people watching.
author: Cory E.

description: Great selection of ciders, and server was really nice, spent a lot of time with us discussing various ciders. Food was very tasty and they even gave us a desert at no extra cost. Would defiantly recommend!
author: Sarah K.

description: Loved the vibe, delicious flat bread and arugula salad and beer and cider, all around lovely experience
author: Grover W.

description: The turkish flat bread was great. Selection of cider is massive. There were ciders here that you absolutely will not find in Bevmo.
author: Chris C.

description: My group of 4 went in on a Saturday night at around 8. We'd tried to get into a couple other places on Polk but the wait had been upwards of an hour, too hungry for that...We were able to walk right in and get seated. Our server was incredibly knowledgeable about their extensive list of ciders, most of which are bottled. Our group ordered a bunch of them to share which was fun. The food is really good and almost everything is under $10. Can't wait to go back!
author: Catherine M.

description: This place is awesome. so many cider choices too. got pretty buzzed off of cider! food was good too. My fav was the caeser kale salad. I  didnt like the lamb sliders. the sweet potato fries were delicious too. great place to have a big group too. make sure u make a reservation though.
author: Cindy L.

description: Amazing selection of ciders. We tried a few, some interesting, some good ones one bad one (VINEGAR!) The food however.....greasy. How come restaurants think macaroni & cheese should be pasta & cheese?  Okay they add bacon, a few garnishes, but so effin GREASY. When cheese melts it is very OILY and GREASY.  Have you heard of a ROUX?  Guys add some flour and some milk to your mac and lets get that cheesy creaminess we all love.  Oh yeah, maybe some SALT??  And whats with the LOUD restaurants, the problem seems worse than ever. This place has NO sound insulation whatsoever, and hearing anyone except the guy at the next table who is bellowing is impossible
author: Gary G.

description: great selection of ciders! some are pricier than others but definitely a great place to check out. tasty food too!
author: Marianna L.

description: Ok:  so I've been back to the Upcider about a half  dozen times since my first review. The place is still REALLY GOOD! Great food, a constantly rotating selection of ciders, beers and wines! OH Yeah... My new favorite is the Lamb Slider.... And try the Mac & Cheese..... Good Stuff!!
author: Brian D.

description: I love this place, I travel to SF for work and to see family pretty often.  My friends took me here because I enjoy my cider- I have drank it from coast to coast.  I appreciated the fact that these guys have like 30 or 40 different types of ciders many with really different tastes.  And talking to the owners they plan on getting new ciders on a regular basis. I enjoyed the food- I read some of the other reviews before I went and had to order the too "spicy" buffalo fries and "standard" garlic fries- I don't know why there were negative comments about these I thought they were both good.  I also liked the mom and pop feel to the bar, and as a small business owner myself I can appreciate trying to minimize employee overhead, especially just starting out, so with that in mind I didn't experience any slow service.  I am definitely going back, in fact when I'm back next week I'm taking several of my coworkers.
author: Brian C.

description: This place has a really great space and a big selection of ciders and beer. They even had the Fox Barrel Blackberry Pear cider which is amazing (though I think you have to ask the waiter for it because it may not be on the menu).  Their food is pretty good too, just know that when they say "sliders" they really mean "slider" as in just one small sandwich.  It's a good sandwich, but it is small, and there is only one.
author: Masha B.

description: Couldn't be more happier with this place! The ambience is cool, the food is awesome with the menu being so different than what I've seen in a long time, and the wait staff is great! Their drink selection is very nice! So many different ciders to choose from, but if you aren't a fan of cider - no worries! They offer beer and wine too! Their lamb sliders are out of this world and their Buffalo fries is something I order each time I'm there! Their flat breads are also good and that spinach salad is yummy! They're small portions, but that's tapas style for you! The vibe in this place is young, hip, rustic/modern, chill and cool, but not too swanky. The wait staff (male and female) are all good looking, down to earth, and super nice! This place is ideal for people of all ages and for all types of events - drinks after work, before the club or afterwards, on a date or out with the girls, with the family or not, with co-workers or with friends...don't miss out on this place! I've been here 3 times since they've opened. Love it! I heard they host events as well, so I am looking into having our next company party there. Thank you for opening, Upcider!
author: Louisa Blake N.

description: I like apple cider. I like alcohol. The combo of both makes this place awesome. We came here on a Thursday night and it was surprisingly empty, only a few people were there drinking, what happened to thirsty Thursdays? We got different ciders, trying to perfect the "not too sweet and not too crisp" combo. Ended up trying multiple ciders and got too full. I would come back again, to try the rest of the menu.
author: Lily T.

description: It's a nice alternative to traditional bars and lounges.  They have a great selection of ciders, domestic and international, mainstream and not-so-mainstream.  We went there on a Friday night and made reservations in advance, but it wasn't too busy.  Food was really good, though portion sizes are small -- more snack than meal.  Service was good and waiters friendly, if a bit slow at times.  Will definitely go again.
author: Maulik S.

description: great place! nice rustic feel and great selection of ciders and food. good for groups! try the possman its fantastic along with the buffalo fries! keep it upcider, cant wait to be back. maybe throw in a pool table?! and have happy hour prices
author: sue c.
